He lives with toys and books and television in a house whose windows are heavily curtained. Occasionally his parents walk with him outside, but only at night when the moon and stars are out. The boy will never greet the dawn, or know what it is like to feel the hot sun on his face. For he is suffering from a rare genetic disease  xeroderniapigmentosum. If he ventures into the sunshine his face dark ens with pigment and his skin breaks out into ugly malignant tumors which can be removed only by a surgeon's knife: Whether the boy can ever be cured to live a normal life is presently unknown. For his battle is not only, against an inherited deficiency but against an extraordinarily implacable the sun.

title: Sikhs Here Trying to Mix Old and New
description: Each Sunday, by the hun dreds, they arrive at a squat, buffcolored school building next to a Roman Catholic church in Flushing, Queens. The women wear long, flow ing saris; the men, mostly bearded, wear colorful tur bans.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: The only thing better than being an American Girl is being the guy she works for. With the recent ap pointment of Marion Dailey as vice president, the eye catching slogan of the AGS Services Corporation has taken on new meaning.

title: The Last Word: Hard Times in Academe
description: Late each spring a rare specimen of bookman, a hybrid of scholar and businessman, is accustomed to foregather in some hospitable college town to swap gossip and tricks of the trade. Three or four days later these members of the Association of American University Presses scatter to their usual habitats, the nation's foremost campuses, to resume their workaday task, cultivation of the literary fruits of academe.

title: Allies Report Advances in Cambodia and Laos
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 7 (AP)South Vietnamese troops in eastern Cambodia and Government troops in Laos re portedly advanced today in of fensives aimed at disrupting en emy supply lines. In South Viet nam the United States com mand reported a mortar attack against an American unit.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: SteelStock Outlook
description: Compared with most other investments, the shares of the bigger steel companies are not usually considered vehicles for a speculative fling. They are seasoned se curities.

title: Disillusioned 25YearOld Quits Race in Eastchester and Politics
description: EASTCHESTER, N. Y., Aug. 7Joseph J. Kennedy, at age 25, says he is through politics here forever, to the embar rassment of local Democratic leaders who less than two months ago designated him as the party's official candidate for Town Supervisor  the youngest person ever to seek such a high office in West chester County.

title: Monitoring System On the Environment Proposed for U.N.
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Aug. 7  A draft proposal for a global environmental monitoring sys tem has been sent to the United Nations Secretariat by the International Biological Pro gram.

title: Thant Lauds Flight
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 7 (Reuters)Secretary General Thant, in a message today to President Nixon, hailed the Apollo 15 flight as another brilliant chapter in man's peaceful exploration of outer space.

title: MORE STATES EASE MARIJUANA CURBS
description: The trend toward easing state penalties for possessing marijuana has continued in recent months as many states have acted to shift the emphasis from punishing the occasional smoker to curbing the pusher.

title: Bears Beat Packers, 20
description: MILWAUKEE, Aug. 7 (AP) The Chicago Bears forced Frank Patrick, quarterback for Green Bay, behind his own end zone for a safety in the third quar ter tonight, then held on for a 20 victory over the Packers in the preseason opener for both teams.

title: TOUR OF THE CITY BEMUSES VISITORS
description: Is it not funny? asked Rose Marie Janzen of Paris, look ing up from Chase Manhattan Plaza to where skyscrapers, each a showcase for the archi tecture of its period, seemed almost to meet overhead.

title: Mary Jo Donovan Wed To E. James Colyer Jr.
description: WHITE PLAINS, Aug. 7 Miss Mary Jo Donovan was married here today in St. Bernard's Roman Catholic Church to E. James Colyer Jr. Msgr. Daniel I Donovan of New York, an uncle of the bride, performed the cere mony and celebrated the nuptial mass.

title: If he shouted loud enough the war might stop
description: When the 1914 war began, Bernard Shaw retired to Torquay, in Devon, and wrote a long polemic called Commonsense About the War, which advised soldiers on both sides to shoot their officers and return home. He had many other unpalatable and only half truethings to say, such as that England began it and the Germans only met us half way, and that the violation of Belgian neu trality was a trumpedup excuse to fight the Germans. Oddly enough, was not badly received, although members of the Dramatists' Club threatened to resign if Shaw didn't, and actors refused to be photo graphed with him at a benefit matinee.

title: Killian Forecasts New Boornin Sciencel
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass., Aug. 7 This tendency to deprecate reason will not long survive in our society, says Dr. James Rhyne Killian Jr., the first Pres idential science adviser. We have too long a record of find ing answers and solutions.

title: Physicist Reported in China
description: HONG KONG, Aug. 7 (AP) The newspaper Hong Kong Star said today that Chen Ning Yang, an American nuclear physicist who was born in China, was believed to have secretly gone to Peking. Mr. Yang is said to have told friends in the United States that his mother was seriously ill in Peking, the paper said, but added, quoting unnamed sources, His cloakanddagger trip could be connected with President Nixon's coming visit to China.

title: ORRIN C. EVANS, JOURNALIST, 68
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 7 Orrin C. Evans, a reporter for The Philadelphia Bulletin, died here last night at MercyDoug lass Hospital. He was 68 years old and lived in nearby Yeadon.

title: EXPOS TOP REDS, 43, ON 3 RUNS IN FIRST
description: CINCINNATI, Aug. 7 (AF) The Montreal Expos built a fourrun lead in the first two innings with the help of two runs batted in by Rusty Staub, then held off the Cincinnati Reds, 43, tonight.

title: Goldenrod
description: The goldenrods come to bloom and gild the August days, yellow as sunlight at every country roadside, in every neglected field, at the woodland's edges, in swales leading down to bogs and brooks. Goldenrod, asters and bouncing bet will dominate the countryside's floral dis play from now until hard frost.

title: U.S.Pakistan Food Pact
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Aug. 7 The United States and Pakis tan yesterday signed a $15.3 million foodforpeace agree ment in Islamabad that is to provide East Pakistan with 100,000 tons of wheat and 50,000 tons of rice. The aid is designed to ease the effects of last year's cyclone disaster in East Pakistan.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: FORDE TODD IS DEAD; RETIRED ADMIRAL, 90
description: HAVERFORD, Pa., Aug. 7 Rear Adm. Forde Anderson Todd, who was Naval aide to President Woodrow Wilson in 191415, died Thursday at his home here at the age of 90.

title: A HOSPITAL AIDE QUITS IN PROTEST
description: WEST HAVERSTRAW, N. Y., Aug. 7The medical director of the State Rehabilitation Hospi tal here has resigned to protest stateimposed economy meas ures that he says are grossly destructive to the work of the hospital.

title: 2 Youths Run in Connecticut
description: NEW CANAAN, Conn., Aug. 7  Two 20yearold youths this week said that they would run for seats on the town Council despite a ruling by State Attor ney General Robert K. Killian that they were ineligible.

title: For the Tops in Cops And Robbers, Tune In to Scotland Yard
description: WELL, Alice, I just had to tele phone before I unzip my suit case to tell you about the fantastic experience I had in London all last week. It was so mind bending that I think I forgot to pack my curlers and maybe the second set of eyelashes. I don't imagine many tour ists get a chance to find out how Lon don really works behind the scenes, and I can tell you that what I stumbled across completely by accident, simply by turning on a portable radio, turned out to be a lot more exciting than the Changing of the Guard or the Elgin Marbles.

title: ExAide's Loan Application Is Held Up by City Agency
description: A building rehabilitation loan application by a former city official to his erstwhile agency, the Housing and Development Administration, is not being processed at this time because of his involvement in a con tinuing investigation.

title: No. 7 Hole at Paris C.C. Belongs to Earl Hooker
description: PARIS, Tex., Aug. 7 (AP) Earl Hooker has scored his sixth holeinone, but that's just part of the story.

title: Kurlands Have a Son
description: SCARSDALE, N.Y., Aug. 7A son was born on July 12 to Mr. and Mrs. Lawrence G. Kurland of Scarsdale, in New York LyingIn Hospital. The child has been named Craig Adam.

title: Jane Ressos Engaged
description: Mrs. C. George Ressos of Brooklyn has announced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Jane Ellen Ressos, to Lieut. Peter H. Elson, U.S.N., retired, the son of Mr. and Mrs. Norman W. Elson of New York and Montauk, L.I. Miss Ressos is the daughter also of the late Mr. Ressos. A Sept. 9 wedding is plan ned. The future bridegroom is executive vice president of Guild Enterprises, Inc., which operates a chain of motion picture theaters. His father is president of that company.

title: More Money Recovered In Qantas Bomb Hoax
description: SYDNEY, Australia, Aug. 7 (AP)  Policemen with sledge hammers smashed open a brickedup fireplace today to re cover $224,00 of the $556,000 paid by Quantas Airline in a bomb hoax.

title: Fresh Oysters, Free Stout Plus Carousing AboutThat's n Irish Festival for You
description: GALWAY, IrelandThis year the annual twoday Galway Oyster Festival runs from Sept. 17 to 19give or take a few days. The reason the length of the festival cannot be forecast with precision is that the participants always seem to start celebrating early and to continue cele brating beyond the official close.

title: Quick Pride Takes $107,686 Dexter
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Aug. 7 The $107,686.75 Dexter Cup trot for 3yearolds became a family affair at Roosevelt Race way tonight as Stanley Dancer drove favored Quick Pride to a halflength victory over Key stone Hilliard, handled by Stan ley's older brother, Vernon.

title: Et Al.
description: All about primate research. Miss Hahn, a simianophile from way back, gives historical background by describing the pioneer work of Robert M. Yerkes, America's foremost early primatologist. She visits the main laboratories now in operation and gives a good deal of interesting material about physical and psychological ex periments being performed on a wide variety of simians, in cluding chimps that have been raised like children. Speech seems beyond their capacity, but some success with sign lan guage has been achieved. She warns against the fad of gen eralizing about human behavior from idealized subhuman pre Good reporting.

title: Astros Top Padres, 53
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 7 (AP) Rich Chiles, a pinchhitter, singled home the tying run in the sixth inning and scored the goahead run on Roger Metz ger's single as the Houston Astros beat the San Diego Padres, 53 tonight.

title: Photography
description: ONLY yesterday picto rial was a dirty word in photography. It meant (and I am quot ing a statement made almost half a century ago) the at tempt to turn the camera into a brush, to make a pho tograph look like a painting, an etching, a charcoal draw ing or what not, like any thing but a photograph; and always in imitation of the work of inferior painters.

title: Praying With the President In the White House;
description: WASHINGTON.

title: Brooklyn Arch Is Getting a FaceLifting
description: The 79yearold Soldiers and Sailors Memorial Arch, which is to Brooklyn what the Arc de Triomphe is to Paris, this summer is receiv ing its first major face lifting.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: Environment
description: As all television gazers know by now, the West was won against not only unfriendly na tives but also against millions of marauding carnivores: wolves, coyotes, bobcats, bears and mountain lions, all stalking the outskirts of village and ranch, and eagles and vultures preying hungrily from the sky. But the problem of predatory animals, so far as a lot of farm ers and cattle and sheepraisers are concerned, is by no means confined to the dramatized past. Nor, it appears, is another, seamier element of Old West legendary.

title: AVIGNON FESTIVAL SHOWS TWO SIDES
description: AVIGNON, France  As be fits the birthplace of theatre populaire, Avignon is celebrat ing much of its 25th festival in the streets. Fringe groups pa trol the streets in gaudy trucks and muscle through the crowds in Communard costume, bran dishing bugles and cutlasses. And long before your car has crawled to the center of town you can hear the guitars and tin whistles of the army of hippies encamped on the Place de l'Horloge.

title: They Use the Thumb to Roam the Land
description: LEADVILLE, Colo., Aug. 7 The traveler was putting down his backpack when he spotted the Lake County sheriff's patrol car coming over the rise of U.S. 24.

title: Soviet Tug Offers Aid After Hard Splashdown
description: ABOARD U.S.S. OKINAWA, Aug. 7 (UPI)A Soviet sea going tug shadowing the Apollo 15 recovery forces radioed an offer of help to day when the astronauts splashed down hard because of a parachute failure.

title: Metros Turn Back Cosmos in. Soccer On Early Spurt, 21
description: TORONTO, Aug. 7  Two goals within four minutes late in the first half tonight carried the Toronto Metros to a 21 victory over the New York Cos mos at Varsity Stadium. The triumph kept, alive the Metros' hopes for a North American Soccer League playoff berth.

title: BADILLO'S BACKING GOES TO MIDONICK
description: Representative Herman Ba dillo endorsed Family Court Judge Millard L. Midonick yes terday for the Democratic nom ination for Manhattan surro gate.

title: 16 Nuclear Plants Set
description: OAK RIDGE, Tenn.Elec tric utilities in the United States during the first half of 1971 announced plans for construction of 16 nuclear power plants, says the Atom ic Energy Commission's Oak Ridge Operations, which supplies enriched fuel for nuclearpower plants in the United States and other countries.

title: Education Chief Urges More Career Training
description: Vocational education, far more broadly based than at present, figures prominently in the blueprint that the United States Commissioner of Edu cation is drawing up for the future of American education.

title: Malverne Passes Law On Dog Droppings
description: MALVERNE, L. L, Aug. 7 Beginning Oct. 2, this com munity will become the sec ond in the country to require dog owners to clean up their pet's droppings on the street or else face a fine of up to $250.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Director of Nursing Named
description: Peggy R. Durham has been appointed exeCative director of nursing services at the Brook dale Hospital Medical Center in Brooklyn. Miss Durham, a graduate of St. John's Univers ity and of Long Island College Hospital School of Nursing, has betn Brookdale director of nursing education since 1966.

title: Photography
description: THE FILM DIREC TOR, by Richard L. Bare, is a new book recently released (Macmillan Company, $8.95) that does a good job of pro viding the information and guidance implied in its sub title, A Practical Guide to Motion Picture and Television Techniques. Interestingly written as a clear and well illustrated handbook for the beginner who is interested in eventually becoming a pro fessional film director, the book not only describes all of the basic techniques the student will have to master, it also takes him behind the scenes into the world of the director and includes many actual examples from the work of such men as Hitch cock, Wilder, Kubrick, Nich ols, Stevens, Wise and Vidor.

title: New Day in Mississippi
description: When Mississippians vote for their Governor next November, they will choose between Charles Evers, the Negro Mayor of Fayette, running as an independent, and one of two white candidates moderate enough in racial matters to enjoy apparently substantial support among the state's black voters. But that is only the superficial result of this week's Democratic primaries,, in which Lieut. Gov. Charles L. Sullivan and William Waller together captured something like 68 per cent of the vote in a field of seven.

title: COURT ASKED TO BAN FEDERAL JOBS TEST
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7The Federal District Court here has been asked to forbid continued use of the Federal service en trance examination, long the standard means for college graduates to obtain Federal employment.

title: TEXAS DRIVER, 24, THRIVES ABROAD
description: LONDON Aug. 7 (UPI)As racing drivers go, Sandy Shep ard still is a beginner. But remember the name. Shepard, a 24yearold native of Denton, Tex., is serving his apprentice ship the hard waysupporting himself on his meager race win nings which, to date, amount to little.

title: Fourie Outpoints Scott
description: JOHANNESBURG, South Af rica, Aug. 7 (Reuters)Pierre Fourie, South African middle weight champion, outpointed Fraser Scott of Los Angeles during a 10round bout tonight. Apart from a brief rally late in the fight, Scott's perform ance was disappointing.

title: Steele Hits 2 Home Runs As U.S. Tops Puerto Rico
description: CALM, Colombia, Aug. 7 (UPI) Two home runs by Tim Steele of Southern California led the United States baseball team to a 104 victory over Puerto Rico to keep alive the Americans' hopes for a silver medal in the PanAmerican Games tourna ment.

title: Et Al.
description: British literary babbling: The classics were great and though I want to be tolerant and ac tually am of two minds I do think Stendhal and the Rus sians are superior to the life hating purility of William Bur roughs though of course Lady Chatterley is not Lawrence's best book and I'm sure I've written much too much in my effortless way during my life and I reread Saintshury every year...

title: Miss McGrail Plans Nuptials
description: OLD BROOKVILLE, L. I., Aug. 7Mrs. Gaines Gwath mey Jr. has announced the engagement of her daughter, Miss Augusta Day McGrail, to Philip Clement Keevil, son of Mr. and Mrs. Clement Keevil of Herstmonceux, England. Miss McGrail is the daughter also of William Phipps McGrail of New York.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: REYKJAVIK, Iceland  NATO is enormously dependent upon maritime links between its transAtlantic partners. These links are now acutely threatened with the possibility that the principal sealines might be cut or out flanked. Because of virtually simul taneous political developments in Ice land and Malta the alliance suddenly risks seeing the entrances to the North Atlantic and the West Mediterranean become unstoppered.

title: Train Wreck in Illinois Laid to Locked Wheels
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (AP)  The National Transporta tion Safety Board reported Thursday that a locked pair of locomotive wheels might have caused a passenger train wreck in which 11 peo ple were killed and 164 in jured near Salem, Ill., June 10.

title: SABLE CAPE WINS EAST COAST CUP
description: MIDDLETOWN, N. Y., Aug. 7Barrett Farm's Sable Cape ridden by Gay Wiles, won the East Coast Challenge Cup for open jumpers at the concluding session of the eightday Orange County horse show todayand made it look easy.

title: Clark Clifford Sounds the Alarm
description: WASHINGTON.

title: Ripping Off, The New Life Style
description: PASSING a joint from one hand to the other, grad peels off his a clerical garb. I never imagined my religious training would pay off so well, says the 24yearold Har vard Divinity School dropout, slump ing into an Americanflagslipcovered armchair at the Orphanage. His words are half drowned out by a Jefferson Airplane record:

title: Beame Lists Figures To Support Charges
description: Following are statistics of fered yesterday by Controller Abraham D. Beanie to sup port his charge that New York City's public school at tendance was the worst, by percentage, in the country:

title: Palmer to Buy the Course Where He Learned to Play
description: LATROBE, Pa,, Aug. 7 The borough of Latrobe lies at the foothills of the Al leghenies, some 50 miles east of Pittsburgh. Its major in dustry is steel and it has a population of 11,671. It is also the home and birthplace of Arnold Palmer, who peri odically takes off from its airport in his jet plane on golfing conquests.

title: Brown Names Woodworth
description: PROVIDENCE, R. I., Aug. 7 (AP)  George N. (Woody) Woodworth was named today varsity baseball coach and di rector of intramural athletics at Brown University.

title: Stamps
description: WHAT was once the Division of Philately in the old United States Post Office Department is now the Phila telic Affairs Division of the United States Postal Service, which became functional on July 1. The new division is under the direction of Gor don C. Morison, who for some months has been di recting philatelic activities. Official announcement of his role was not made until July 28 by Postmaster General Winton M. Blount.

title: Television
description: HE is a television exec utive, and he insists that there is entirely too much television programing available, that the critical and sensory facul ties of the ordinary viewer are bound to be bombarded into overstuffed paralysis. His solution would be to lim it onair schedules to, say, between 7 and 10 o'clock each evening, and perhaps to close down completely for the months of July and August.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: SADAT CRITICIZES COMMUNISM AGAIN
description: CAIRO, Aug. 7President Anwar elSadat took further slaps at Communism today as the first year of the suspension of hostilities along the Suez Canal ended.

title: FIVE NEW TRUSTEES NAMED AT ADELPHI
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I., Aug. 7 The board of trustees of Adelphi University has ap pointed five new trustees, in cluding the first black and the two youngest trustees in the board's history.

title: Who regulates the regulator? The regulated
description: Woodrow Wilson once said, The masters of the government of the United States are the combined cap italists and manufacturers of the United States. It is written on every intimate page of the records of Con gress, it is written through the his tory of conferences at the White House, that the suggestions of eco nomic policy come from one source, not from many sources. His state ment sounded the common theme of these books.

title: Return From Hadley Rille
description: To worldwide acclaim astronauts Scott and Irwin, who stood at the rim of Hadley Rille and rode up the lower slope of the lunar Apennines, are safely back on earth along with astronaut Worden who walked deep space. Apollo 15 now enters the history books as the most successful exploratory journey men have ever undertaken away from their own planet. Every frontier of lunar science has been or will be substantially extend ed as a result of this extraordinary interplanetary trek, with its rich harvest of lunar material and scientific observations. Even the failure of one parachute to operate properly as the astronauts returned to earth yesterday could not detract from the overall brilliance of the mis sion's performance.

title: Come Back to the Farm By Jesse Stuart. 246 pp. New York: McGraw Hill Book Co. $6.95.
description: Highminded critics are always urging regionalists to transmute their restricted characters and settings into that inane area of generalized theme called universality. You may write about those unforgettable bumpkins, those rotting barns, those charming superstitions and quaint folkways, they concede. But if you expect us to praise you (or even to read you), you must draw from these narrow peculiarities a series of Abstractions to which we can all nod agreement about love, growingup, loss, kin ship, grief, pride, honor. Local color is nice in its place, but when you keep the color all on the surface, you give us little more than a W.P.A. guidebook.

title: The World
description: JOHANNESBURGEvery day during the lunch hour in Johan nesburg, people slip quietly into the graystone Anglican Cathedral of St. Mary and kneel in prayer. Side by side, whites and blacks bow their heads.

title: Hardin Doubts Corn Blight Will Seriously Affect Crop
description: URBANA, Ill., Aug. 7 (AP) Secretary of Agriculture Clif ford M. Hardin says that South ern corn leaf blight should not severely affect this years' corn crop and that mass production of blightresistant seed could make 1972 a good year for farmers.

title: Ski Areas in Vermont Are Expanding Into AllSports Centers
description: MOUNT SNOW, Vt., Aug. 7Just a short lob from the sprawling, fourstory Snow Lake Lodge, four doubles teams were competing in a tournament sanctioned by the New England Lawn Ten nis Association.

title: POINT OF VIEW
description: Americans concerned about the status of JapaneseAmer ican trade relations might well take heart from a major development now under way in Japan that, to date, has escaped wide notice at least on the United States side of the Pacific.

title: Patricia Dames Married
description: Miss Patricia R. Dames and Michael Drayton Jr. were married here yester day afternoon by the Rev. William D. Hogans in Rush Temple, the African Metho dist Episcopal Zion Church in Jamaica, Queens. The bride is a daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Henry S. Dames of South Ozone Park, Queens. Her husband is a son of Mr. and Mrs. Drayton of New York.

title: An UptoDate And Sexy Verona
description: WILLIAM SHAKESPEARE'S wry and nifty (if flawed) little comedy about love and friendship, The Two Gentlemen of Verona, ends with a cheerful but orderly exeunt. Not so the New York Shakespeare Festival's wild, hilarious, sexy and brazenly highhanded adaptation, which concludes with a pepfest involving, besides the entire 27member cast onstage and singing at the top of its lungs, simultane ous highjinks with a Frisbee, an inflated rubber ball, several YoYo's, three manual bubble machines, at least four of those paddles with little rubber balls attached to them by elastic bands, one bicycle and a pair of roller skates. It is quite an eye and earful, and it tops off an evening of goofy and exhilarating theater in which Shakespeare, while occasionally roughed up a bit beyond the call of duty, is well served in unexpected and sig nificant ways.

title: Miss Seton Wall Wed to J. E. Scott
description: GARDEN CITY, L. I., Aug. 7Miss Seton Ann Wall, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Richard A. Wall, was married here this morning in St. Jo seph's Roman Catholic Church, to James E. Scott, son of Mrs. Nicholas D'Ales sandro of Cleveland, and the late James E. Scott of Santa Cruz, Calif.

title: David Dobins Have Son
description: LAWRENCE, L.I., Aug. 7 A son was horn to Mr. and Mrs. David M. Dobin July 22 at St. Luke's Hospital in New York. Mrs. Dobin is the for mer Miss Elaine Brauner Lu ham Mr. Dobin is with the New York law firm of Wof sey, Certilman, Haft, Snow & Becker.

title: BRITISH DOCTORS CURB PEP PILLS
description: Many physicians in England and Scotland have voluntarily stopped prescribing ampheta mines and thereby have helped curb abuses of the drugs that are considered among the most potent stimulants of the brain, a medical journal has reported.

title: 6 YOUNG CANDIDATES. LOSE IN CAMPUS CITY
description: EAST LANSING, Mich., Aug. 7All six youth candidates for City Council in this university city of 47,500 finished out of the running in a primary election.

title: LOUIS ADLER
description: ELIZABETH, N. J., Aug. 7 Louis Adler of 404 South Broad Street, a lawyer formerly with the New York City rent con trol office, died Thursday in St. Elizabeth's Hospital, apparently of a heart attack. His age was 58.

title: BLANCHARD TAKES POST AT SCHOOL
description: ROSWELL, N. M., Aug. 7 Col. Felix A. (Doc) Blanchard, the Mr. Inside of West Point football during the World War IT era, has assumed his new job as a military school com mandant following a thorough ly enjoyable four months of retirement from the United States Air Force, in which he served for 25 years.

title: Gardens
description: TWO springs in one year, is unlikely for most of us. The near est I've come to it is an autmun day when the colchicums thrust their leaf less lilac goblets out of the ground. At that moment, it's spring again in my garden.

title: Education
description: When Dr. Albert 11. Bowker resigned as chancellor of the City University of New York last April to head the Univer sity of California at Berkeley, he set off a talent search proc ess that is becoming as familiar to higher education as football and fiscal crises.

title: Music
description: AS a truly integrated symphony or chestra, the Symphony of the New World makes an effort to introduce black composers and conductors in its annual series of con certs in New York. In its initial program at Philharmonic Flail, on Oct. 10, it will give the world premiere of Visions of lshwara, 1970 by Stephen Chambers, who is president of the Society of Black Composers. In the final concert on May 7, there will he two such works, Charles Coleman's Heros and Martyrs, a New York premiere, and Margaret Harris's Piano Concerto No. 2. Miss Har ris will be soloist in this first perform ance anywhere of her piece.

title: L. I. Customs House Is Named a Landmark
description: SAG HARBOR, L.I., Aug. 7 A 200yearold frame house that once was the home and office of Henry Packer Dering, the first customs collector of New York, has been desig nated a customs landmark by the United States Customs Service.

title: MAN IN BUSINESS
description: KANNAPOLIS, N. C.It seems incongruous to speak of a 6foot2 athlete stepping ant of the shadow of a 5 footer. Yet that is what hap pened when Charles A. Can non, chairman of the board of the Cannon Mills Company, died of a stroke April 2 and was succeeded by Don S. Holt.

title: Mother and BirthControl Crusader Are Arrested at L. I. Lecture
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., Aug. 7 A crusader for birth control and a 28yearold mother spent the night in county jails after being arrested yesterday for endan gering the welfare of a child, the woman's 14monthold baby girl who slept on her lap during a lecture on birth control.

title: Education
description: STANFORD, Calif.A con troversy has built up over a governmental task force's re port that sharply criticized the country's colleges and universities for what it called lukewarm interest in innova tion and selfreform. The higher education establish ment has reacted coldly to the report and has asked, in effect, for specific propos als.

title: Vision of another
description: William Maxwell, a novelist ven turing for the first time outside his field, has not deserted it as much as one might think. Ancestors, his uncommon family history, is an ex ploration of the past in which the novelist's invention figures as large as the historian's research. If in its meditative rambles the book at times drifts slightly out of focus, it is not able for its quiet humor, affectionate tone and, most of all, its sharp vi sion of another America.

title: Miller of Astros Sidelined
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 7 (UPI) Norm Miller, a Houston Astros outfielder, was placed on the 21day disabled list last night after breaking a bone in his right wrist. Marty Martinez, an infielder, replaced Miller on the active list. Martinez had been out for two weeks with a broken wrist.

title: Controversy Grows Over Teton River Dam Project
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7  A regional official of the Envi ronmental Protection Agency describes the proposed darn as an ecological disaster. But the Federal agency that pro poses to build the dam and its water and electric power works concludes that the ben efits outweigh the potential losses.

title: ASTRONAUTS SPLASH DOWN CLOSE TO PACIFIC TARGET TO END 12DAY MOON TRIP
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 7The as tronauts of Apollo 15 splashed down in the Pacific Ocean today and brought to a safe conclusion their successful 12 day moonexploring mission; which space agency officials called an epic scientific voy age.'

title: McKeige, Blam, Van Hagen Win As 92 Race in Cow Bay Sailing
description: PORT WASHINGTON, L. L, Aug. 7Patience proved a vir tue today as 92 skippers out waited tardy northwesterly winds in the Cow Bay area, Yacht Racing Association of Long Island Sound competition.

title: Frank Robinson Keeps Door Ajar for Pilot Job
description: Frank Robinson, Baltimore's $135,000 player who is con sidered a prime candidate to be baseball's first black man ager, said yesterday he had not received any offers, but he would keep the door open if any were made.

title: U.S. Agencies Split on Bottled Water
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 Two Federal agencies have failed to reach agreement on possible regulation of the multi milliondollar bottled water in dustry.

title: Mets Crush Braves, 206, With a 21Hit Onslaught
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 7The New York Mets, the hitless wonders of baseball most of the sum mer, broke loose with the most tigrish display of hitting in their 10year history tonight as they socked out a 21hit, 206 victory over the Atlanta Braves.

title: Nixon Phones Astronauts
description: BREWER, Me., Aug. 7Presi dent Nixon watched the Apollo 15 splashdown today with his family on television in the liv ing room of the house in which he is staying on Minot Island in Penobscot Bay.

title: National Dog Week Urged
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (UPI)Senator Lowell P. Weicker Jr., Republican of Connecticut, introduced a reso lution yesterday to declare the last week in September Na tional Dog Week. Mr. Weicker owns nine dogs.

title: Criminals At Large
description: It's a nice point in ethics, capable of being argued by the philosophers. Should we have sympathy for the professional thief or hired killer? They are enemies of society, misfits, eternally taking and never giv ing. But the criminalashero has been a fixture of the mys tery novel, and now there are two more recent examples.

title: Ken Dryden: You Don't Have a Nader in Any Sport
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 Ken Dryden, the brilliant young goalie who put aside his law books just long enough last spring to save another Stanley Cup for the Montreal Canadiens, is an expert on water pollution now at the end of a sum mer project with Ralph Nader.

title: Phillies Triumph, 53, as Pirates Suffer Their 7th Defeat in Last 9 Games
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 7 (AP) Deron Johnson's runscoring double sparked a threerun third inning and Rick Wise and Billy Wilson combined to pitch the Philadelphia Phillies to a 53 victory over the Pittsburgh Pi rates today.

title: The Yen at the Door
description: TOKYOIs Tokyo about to follow New York and Lon don and become a third great center of international bank ing and finance?

title: John Copcutt Harper Marries Miss Pamela Cragg, a Teacher
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Aug. 7Miss Pamela Jane Cragg and John Copcutt Harper were married here this after noon in St. Barnabas Episco pal Churdh by the Rev. Harold Bassage.

title: While the cities burn, the machines click on
description: Politics and public life were once almost synonymous, but increasingly, government seems a private affair. Citizens and their elected represen tatives feel themselves helplessly de pendent on all but anonymous and invisible men in bureaucracy who claim discretion, the virtue of pri vate man, rather than authority, the quality of the statesman. The Penta gon Papers are only a dramatic in stance. Planning sessions, memoranda and computer files replace debates, resolutions and statute books, and the great drama of politics is re duced to the tawdriness of the peep show. In the process, public prob lems are trivialized or ignored; while the cities burn, the machines click cheerfully in unconscious imitation of Nero; human agony is reduced to a line in a cost account. Small won der that Americans at large are los ing the capacity for outrage in favor of tired disgust.

title: Jesus People and the Churches
description: NEWPORTIn the physical universe, energy does not perish but is trans formed. In like manner, religious val ues are lifted into a higher case or degenerate into a lower one. When the nuns gave up their long habits, the girls put on rriaxicoats; when the rosary as a devotion was dropped, the thippies put beads around their necks; when mysticism evaporated into an irrelevant ideal, youths sought the ecstasy not through the long haul of asceticism, but the short trip through pharmaceuticals; when seminaries, schools and convents dropped disci pline, which is an inner violence against our vices, the street snobs picked up violence but directed it this time against neighbor, race and state. When the pulpits no longer resounded with that Name above every name, the young began calling themselves Jesus people.

title: Television
description: IT'S easy to spot a trend in television. Two shows on the same theme make a trend. Three of them, a cycle. Six, a season. Which brings us to the 22 new net work programs arriving next month. More than half of the new shows deal with men bearing pistols, badges or warrants. Moreover, in a clas sic case of overkill, 10 cops androbbers sagas are left over from last year. It's a veritable patrol of police men in search of a skulk of scoundrels.

title: Somoza Visiting Mexico
description: COZUMEL, Mexico, Aug. 7 (UPI)President Anastasio So moza Debayle of Nicaragua was greeted by native musi cians rather than by a 21gun salute when he arrived on this Yucatan State island today for two days of talks with Presi dent Luis Eccheverria Alvarez of Mexico on technical co operation. A Mexican spokes man said the 21gun salute was not required since the meeting was not at a naval or artillery base.

title: Montauk Manor Is Undergoing Conversion Into Condominiums
description: MONTAUK, L. L, Aug. 7 This oceanfront community on the point of Long Island has had its ups and downs in the years since the first English set tlers arrived in the 1600's, but some people in these parts are counting on a current construc tion project to give it an ec onomic shot in the arm.

title: Tass Reports Splashdown
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 7 (Reuters) The Soviet press agency Tass reported tonight the suc cessful completion of the Apol lo 15 mission following the splashdown in the Pacific. The agency described the astro nauts' activities on the moon, including their three trips in a moon car.

title: Academy of Aeronautics Will Conduct Free Tours
description: The Academy of Aeronautics at La Guardia Airport an nounced last week that it would conduct free tours Thursday of its laboratory facilities for young men and women inter ested in technical careers.

title: WORLD OF SEVENTH AVE.
description: If the economy has recov ered from a recession, it is still not apparent from the standpoint of apparel trade credit. Many manufacturers and distributors, hurt last fall in a general decline of business and an increase in failures, have tightened their credit arrangements.

title: Chess
description: THE international tournament re cently concluded at Netanya, Is rael, attracted considerable atten tion in this country. Among the 16 participants there were no fewer than five Americans, as well as a sixth play er, grandmaster Walter Browne of Aus tralia, who grew up in the U.S.A. and is well known here. Grandmaster Lub omil Kavalek, formerly of Czechoslo vakia and now a resident of Washing ton, D. C., tied for first place with Bruno Parma of Yugoslavia, each scoring 105. In third place, half a point behind, was veteran U.S. grandmaster Sammy Resh evsky, and, half a point behind him, Pal Benko. Grandmaster Arthur Bisguier of Hartsdale, N. Y., and international mas ter Bernard Zuckerman of Brooklyn also took part.

title: Briton Depicts Afghanistan As Center of Narcotics
description: LONDON, Aug. 7Afghanis tan was described in a report published here this week as a prime source and center of the international traffic in narcot ics and as a land of slavery.

title: Union Boat Club Eight Captures U. S. Crown
description: The Union Boat Club of Bos ton, triumphed in the national rowing championships yester day at Orchard Beach Lagoon and will represent the United States in the European cham pionships at Copenhagen Aug. 1822, The Boston eight defeat ed the Vesper Boat Club of Philadelphia, the New Haven Rowing Club, and a combina tion crew made up of New York A. C. and New Haven oarsmen in the final of the Elite Division.

title: AllTerrain Vehicle, Seating 4, Is Unlocking Isolated Areas
description: LAKE GENEVA, Wis., July 23  Anyone who spends half a day struggling on foot to reach a remote beach or a snowfed lake at timber line should have a reasonable hope of at last finding a measure of solitude and iso lation.

title: Commune for the Elderly Challenged
description: WINTER PARK, Fla., Aug. 7There are hippie communes and student communes and farm communes and urban communes, but in a 27  room, 10bath mansion here in Win ter Park, there is a different sort of commune with a very different sort of member.

title: CADILLAC JACK TAKES HORSE SHOW CROWN
description: LITCHFIELD, Conn., Aug. 7 Hugh Kerrigan piloted Cadil lac Jack o victory in two classes and the regular work ing hunter championship today at the Litchfield horse show the oldest event in the North east and second oldest in the country.

title: Joseph Frazer, 79, CoFounder Of KaiserFrazer Corp., Dead
description: NEWPORT, R. I., Aug. 7 Joseph Washington Frazer, a former top executive in the automobile industry, who was founder with Henry J. Kaiser of the KaiserFrazer Corpora tion, died today of cancer. His age was 79.

title: A Parks Employe Jogs at Work, Making Tasks Go More Quickly
description: The man's a demon; he's fantastic, Matteo Monaco, a city Parks Department fore man, said as he stood on the narrow strip of park between the Henry Hudson Parkway and the Hudson River, watch ing Joseph Albani Levesque slash at a stand of tall weeds with a grass whip. At the same time Mr. Levesque was steadily jogging in position.

title: Georgina Marie Leinert Is Bride
description: RIDGEWOOD, N. J., Aug. 7 Miss Georgina Marie Lei mert and Malcolm B. McAllis ter were married here this afternoon in Christ Episcopal Church by the rector, the Rev. Marshall T. Rice. He was assisted by the Rev. Dr. Hugh McCandless, rector of the Episcopal Church of the Epiphany in New York and a ??

title: BLUE, ON 5HITTER, WINS HIS 20TH, 10
description: OAKLAND, Aug. 7  Vida Blue of the Athletics became the first 20game winner in the major leagues this season, stop ping the Chicago White Sox, 1.0, on a fivehitter today.

title: China Rejects Proposal
description: HONG KONG, Aug. 7Com munist China declared today that it could not accept the So viet proposal for a conference of the five nuclear powers.

title: Judge Tytus Wins
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 7 (AP) Judge Tytus, owned and bred by Julia and Grant Scott at their Wheaton, Ill., farm, closed strongly to win the $34,800 Springfield Handicap before a crowd of 25,906 at Arlington Park today.

title: William Barrett Plans to Marry Ingrid Johnsen, Scull Champion
description: RUMSON, N.J., Aug. 7 Miss Ingrid Christine John sen, a member of the faculty of the Gill School in Ber nardville, will be married in October to William Barrett, the business manager of the New Jersey School Consor tium, also in Bernardsville.

title: Russians Coach Cubans At PanAmerican Games
description: CALI, Colombia, Aug. 7  George Frenn spotted a fa miliar face in the crowd of Cubans standing next to him in Pascual Guerrero stadium.

title: Art Mailbag
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Miss Georgette Whitfield Wood Married to James R. Laidlaw Jr.
description: BEDMINSTER, N. J., Aug. 7Miss Georgette Whitfield Wood was married here this afternoon to James Robert Laidlaw Jr. The Rev. John T. Morrow of St. Luke's Episcopal Church in Glad stone performed the cere mony at the home of the bridegroom's stepfather and mother, Mr. and Mrs. Norman H. Robbie.

title: Poisonous Snake Found
description: MOORE, Okla., Aug. 7 (UPI) A poisonous Indian cobra that slipped away from its own er's garage July 21 was found curled up on a doorstep this week eight miles from where it escaped.

title: Art
description: AUGUST is really the end of the year in the art business, and the year doesn't end in a festi val, like Christmas or some thing. It ends in a vacuum with the galleries closed and all the big summer shows al ready installed in the mu seums and the first of the fall crop still a month off. It is a time for deskcleaning, and desk  cleaning always brings with it a fit of selfreproach. It is a very difficult time of year.

title: Football Aide Selected
description: The appointment of Dick Grey to the Montclair State freshman football staff has been announced by Bill Dio Iguardi, director of athletics. Grey, a resident of Cedar Grove, N. J., will assist the head coach, Dick Iiapward, with the offensive and defen sive backfield.

title: 2 Mosquito Species on Coast Immune to Pesticides
description: PAIR ALTO, Calif., Aug. 7  Two species of mosquito native to California have ac quired complete immunity to all manmade pesticides, ac cording to health officials here. The resistant insects, the first of their kind in the state, have been breeding unchecked for about a year.

title: Bicycle Tax Approved
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Aug. 7 (UPI)A $1 tax on the whole sale price of bicycles costing $40 or more, which will be used to finance hike trails, was ap proved yesterday by the Cali fornia Senate.

title: Csonka, Kiick End Holdouts, Sign Pacts With Dolphins
description: MIAMI, Aug. 7 (AP)Larry Csonka and Jim Kck, Miami Dolphins running backs, hold outs from the start of spring training, came to agreements with the club yesterday.

title: RWANDAN FRONTIER REOPENED BY UGANDA
description: NAIROBI, Kenya, Aug. 7 The border between the East African countries of Uganda and Rwanda was reopened this week and reports reaching here spoke of constant flow of trucks held up for nearly a month by Uganda's Presi dent, Maj. Gen. Idi Amin.

title: The World
description: We believe that freedom must be ruled by law and exercised with a sense of responsibil ity. If some foreigners disagree with our con cept for freedom, law, responsibility, we cannot help it. Thus a spokesman for the Greek Government last week explained the purpose behind a proposed sevenpoint code of ethics for reporters and foreign corre spondents working in Greece.

title: Sea Cliff Sailing Canceled
description: SEA CLIFF, L. I., Aug., 7 Sea Cliff Yacht Club canceled today's Hempstead Harbor re gatta because of lack of wind.

title: BUSINESS LETTER
description: If wishes were horses, says the old English proverb, beg gars might ride.

title: Lieut. Peter Weddle Is Fiance Of Miss Mary Kathleen Fleeson
description: ARLINGTON, Va., Aug. 7 Col. George S. Fleeson, U.S.A., and Mrs. Fleeson, have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Mary Kathleen Fleeson, to Second Lieut. Peter David Weddle, U.S.A., son of Col. Charles E. Weddle, U.S.A., and Mrs. Weddle of Fort Dix, N. J.

title: Stephanie Harder Bride in Syracuse
description: SYRACUSE, Aug 7Miss Stephanie Linda Harder, daughter of Mrs. Frederica J. Harder of Syracuse and Col. Richard S. Harder, U.S.A.F. retired, of Colorado Springs, and Langston C. McKinney of Syracuse, son of Mr. and Mrs. Lee McKinney of Miami, were married here this afternoon. The Rev. Walter Nathaniel Welch performed the cere mony in Grace Episcopal Church.

title: Home Life to Be Provided for Disturbed L. I. Youths
description: NORTH BELLMORE, L.I., Aug. 7A pilot state pro gram to remove children from state mental institutions in which they do not belong and provide them with a nor mal home atmosphere will be initiated here later this month.

title: Big Deal Wins at Cali In Heavyweight Lifting
description: CALI, Colombia, Aug. 7 (AP)Gary Deal of Seattle won the heavyweight weight lifting crown today and Deal and a teammate, Bob Kemper of San Jose, Calif., took eight medals in PanAmerican Games competition.

title: Mexico, Peru Trade Victories In Stevens Cup Tennis Play
description: Mexico and Peru split the first two singles matches in the quarterfinals of the elimin ation series in the annual Ste vens Cup international senior team tennis competition at the Town Tennis Club yesterday. The Stevens Cup is played along the lines of the Davis Cup, except that the players are 45 years and over.

title: R. M. Quintal Marries Miss Wriston
description: Miss Catherine Bigelow Wriston was married here yesterday afternoon to Rich ard Martin Quintal in the Episcopal Church of the Heav enly Rest The ceremony was performed by the Rev. Fran cis B. Creamer.

title: Jersey Testing Roadside Switch To Aid Drivers of Disabled Cars
description: PISCATAWAY, N. J., Aug. 7 Motorists stranded on New Jersey highways may soon be able to summon help by simply flicking a switch.

title: Youths in Brooklyn Help Find Leaks in Abandoned Houses
description: Neighborhood Youth Corps workers in Brooklyn are picking their way these days through the dank halls and cellars of the abandoned houses of Brownsville.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: On the zoning issue [City Studying an Overhaul in Zoning Law, July 25], the following would appear to be incontrovertible:

title: U.S. Pistol Shooters Win Cali Gold Medal, Set Mark
description: CALI, Colombia, Aug. 7 (UPI)  The United States scored a 12 sweep in center fire pistol shooting at the Pan American Games today and set a world record in the process. Francis Higginson of Placer ville, Calif., won the gold medal with 593 of a possible 600 points and Bob Whitacre of Columbus, Ga., took the silver with 589.

title: Two Are Seized in Detroit In Black Panther Slaying
description: DETROIT, Aug. 7 (AP)  A Des Moines, Iowa, man sought in the April 17 slaying of a Black Panther member in New York was arrested with a com panion today as they walked along a West Side street here.

title: Ceylon Changes Calendars, Sunday Is a Holiday Again
description: COLOMBO, Ceylon, Aug. 7 Sunday becames a holiday once again in Ceylon tomorrow, of ficially ending a costly five year experiment with the lunar calendar.

title: Reader's Report
description: Death, in this miniature work of art, evokes life. A young girl is killed in a cycling acci dent on a country road, two weeks before she was to have been married. Her 13yearold sister, through a sequence of Proustian impressions, gets to the heart of what makes her family tick. Older sister covet ing the dead girl's fianc, mama right out of Swann's Way, mysterious lover hovering in the background  family rela tionships crystallize in the girl's reflections. The narrator imag ines that their lives all re spond to a familial metronome that vibrated continually in the air, penetrated the ears, took over the whole body, mak ing the heart beat to an op pressive cadence. The metro nome beats to uppermiddle class rhythms with which Claire, the dead girl, was slight ly out of step. The author sug gests, with significant scraps of reverie and dialogue, larger im plications of character.

title: The citizens are exploited and made to like
description: In a bureaucratized society the concept of citizenship is redefined and its practice is transformed. Yet the precise character of this trans formation is too new to be grasped fully. We profoundly need a new vocabulary and new analytic tools. We might settle for one encapsulat ing insight.

title: Robert P. Tibolt, 72, Chairman Of Eastern Gas and Fuel, Dies
description: BOSTON, Aug. 7Robert P. Tibolt, board chairman of East ern Gas and Fuel Associates, died yesterday at his home in suburban Cohasset. He was 72 years old.

title: Princeton Names Captain For 1972 Varsity Crew
description: PRINCETON, N.J., August James Paulson, a 21year old senior from Silver Spring, Maryland, has been elected captain of Princeton Univer sity's 1972 varsity heavy weight crew.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: Has anyone ever asked Mayor Lindsay or Donald H. Elliott whether the New York City community wants a larger or more dense city? New York City is much too large already. We have too many people. This produces such problems as crime, mug ging and poverty. Let's have a referendum to see how the people feel about it.

title: Decorating a Room Is Like Composing a Painting
description: Jacob M. Kaplan, who made one fortune in Cuban molasses and another in American grape juice, smiled proudly as his wife, Alice, talked about their stunning ly furnished apartment.

title: Music
description: LOUIS ARMSTRONG is dead, and the rightful eulogies have been writ ten. I don't need to add my own. Along with one or two other jazzmen, such as Charlie Parker, he stands in a lonely preeminence. We all know that.

title: About Motor Sports
description: Richard Petty, who passed the $1million mark in ca reer winnings last Sunday, has spent most of his life working on stock cars or driving them. His success is basically the result of years of devotion to the jab. Part of that success, also, stems from the superb teamwork with the men who tend his electricblue No. 43 Plymouth in the pits.

title: Immolation Reported
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 7 (UPI)Two Saigon newspa pers reported today that a Buddhist monk burned himself to death in a protest against the war in Quangtin Province, 340 miles northeast of Saigon..

title: CABANA PROPOSAL IN NASSAU SCORED
description: MINEOLA, L. I., Aug. 7 Plans by Nassau County Ex ecutive Ralph G. Caso to build 1,500 cabanas at the county's Nassau Beach on the South Shore at a cost of more than $14million was termed a disgraceful waste of taxpayers' money this week by a Democratic mem ber of the Board of Super visors.

title: U.S. Wins in Field Hockey
description: CALL Colombia, Aug. 7 (AP) The United States defeated Guyana, 30, today in field hockey at the Pan American Games. Jocelyn Kaligis of Whitehall, Pa., scored two goals and the third was made by Frank Noodt of Middle Village, N.Y. The United States is tied with Jamaica for sixth place.

title: Sally Little, 19, of South Africa Impressive in Pro Golf Debut
description: The newest addition to the Ladies Professional Golf As sociation tour is Sally Little of South Africa. She corn peted in her first professional event in the O'Sullivan Open in Winchester, Va., two weeks ago.

title: A Melon For Ecstasy; By John Fortune and John Wells. 188 pp. New York: G. P. Putnam's Sons. $5.95.
description: Is there anything so tedious as comic novel that is not serious? Consider the gasping laughter of West's Miss Lonelyhearts or O' Connor's The Violent Bear It Away or Nabokov's Lolita or Friedman's Stern, and consider what these books would be without the skull that is so hideously apparent behind that laughter? Without the skull all becomes situation comedy  or as they say in the trade: SitCom. Which brings us to A Melon for Ecstasy by John Wells and John Fortune. Here is SitCom in one of its finest moments.

title: Pop: Jim Morrison at the end, Joni at a Crossroads
description: THE DOORS: L. A. Wo man (Elektra EKS 75011). With Jim Morrison gone, the Doors presumably will fade into the vague anonymity that always drifted just below the surface of their music. In their own unique fashion, the group did create a kind of classic, and highly fragile, rock style. In it, musical ele ments were reduced to al most brutal simplicity, and Morrison's self  consciously hoarse, lookI'maman voice dominated all.

title: BLACK JUDGES SET GOALS AT PARLEY
description: ALTANTA, Aug. 7  George W. Crockett Jr. of Detroit was elected today the head of the first formal organization of black judges.

title: Anne Stanford Becomes Bride
description: ESSEX, Conn., Aug. 7  The marriage of Miss Anne Stanford to David Wray Ken nedy took place here this af ternoon at the home of the bride's parents, Dr. and Mrs. John Stanford. Mr. Kennedy is a son of Mrs. Wray David Kennedy of Holmes Beach, Fla., formerly of Essex, and the late Mr. Kennedy.

title: WALTER J. FULTZ, 47, EDITOR AT FAWCETT
description: BRUNSWICK, Me., Aug. 7 Walter J. Fultz of New York, editor of Gold Medal Books, a line of original paperbacks pub lished by Fawcett Publications, was found dead in his motel room yesterday morning. Mr. Fultz, who was 47 years old, had been on vacation.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: HENRY STEVENS, LED AMERICAN LEGION, 75
description: WARSAW, N. C. Aug. 7 (AP) Superior Court Judge Henry L. Stevens, national comman der, of the American Legion in 1932, died Thursday. He was 75 years old.

title: KANSAS ASKS TO JOIN VERMONT ATOM CASE
description: MONTPELIER, Vt., Aug. 7 (AP)The Atomic Energy Commission has been asked to allow the state of Kansas to, intervene in its scheduled hearings later this month on an operating license for the huge Vermont Yankee Atomic power plant in Vernon.

title: Miss Moe, 18, Sets World Record of 2:18.59 in Women's 200Meter Butterfly
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 7 (AP) Karen Moe, an 18yearold from the Santa Clara Swim Club, broke the world record today in the women's 200meter, butterfly.

title: On Audenstrassae
description: KIRCHSTETTEN, Austria.

title: Television
description: SIDNEY TORIN was kicking the idea around with his boss at WEVD for a while, and last May 20th, Sid, better known as Symphony Sid, put the first records on the air: Repetition by Charlie Bird Parker; I'm a Fool to Want You by Billie Holiday; and Manteca by Dizzy Gil lespie. It was two in the morning when he started playing jazz for the first time since the midsixties, and the phone on his little studio desk started ringing. It's like a breath of fresh air, one caller said. It sounds great, another said.

title: Home Improvement
description: ALTHOUGH hand tools are still the backbone of even the most ex perienced home handy man's tool kit, portable power tools are being used more and more by doit yourselfers who are con stantly looking for ways to make home workshop and home maintenance jobs fast er and easier to complete.

title: CARSON IS LEADER IN LIGHTNING SAIL
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Aug. 7 (AP)After two postponements and a general recall, a fleet of 97 Lightningsthe largest ever to compete for the Atlantic Coast Championship  finally managed to sail one of two scheduled races today before winds on Long Island Sound subsided to a nearcalm off the host Cedar Point Yacht Club.

title: Michael O'Sullivan 19341971
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Women U.S. Marshals Urged by Rep. Wilson
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 (AP) Representative Bob Wilson, Republican of California, is asking the Justice Depart ment to give women a trial as United States marshals.

title: Police Bribe Ring Charges Studied by Jury in Seattle
description: SEATTLE, Aug. 7  Police Chief George Tielsch said here this week that the county grand jury in its investigation of a police bribery ring functions like a Spanish Inquisition all they need is a rack and thumbscrews.

title: Mrs. Meir is Said to Plan Not to Seek Reelection
description: TEL AVIV, Sunday, Aug. 8 (AP)An Israeli newspaper re ported today that Premier Golda Meir had told a British interviewer she would not seek reelection in 1973 because of her age.

title: U.S. Yacht Yankee Girl Takes Early Lead in Fastnet Sail
description: COWES, Isle of Wight, Aug. 7 (UPI)Yankee Girl of the United States took the early lead today as a 42yacht fleet sailed into the English Channel on the first leg of the 605mile Fastnet Race, final race of the Admiral's Cup series.

title: For Young Readers: Three Novels
description: There are many similarities be tween this second book by S. E. Hinton and her first, The Outsid ers. Both are powerful, realistic stories about being young and poor in a large Oklahoma city. But instead of a gang of rich kids spoiling for a fight, the antagonist in this more ambitious novel is time.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Sota Maintains Golf Lead
description: ZANDVOORT, the Nether lands, Aug. 7 (AP)  Roman Sota of Spain, battling strong winds, soared to a 72 today but still maintained his lead by three strokes with a 208 totalin the Dutch open golf championship. Graham Marsh of Australia and Tony Grubb of Britain also had 72's, match ing the best scores of the day, to rank second and third with 11 and 212 totals.

title: DE CARLO VERDICT UPSET ON APPEAL
description: The 1970 extortionconspiracy conviction of Angelo DeCarlo, the reputed New Jersey Mafia captain whose trial prompted the Federal Government to re lease the sensational DeCarlo Tapes detailing gangland murders and payoffs, has been overturned by a Federal, appeals court on a technicality.

title: Massachusetts Men Equal
description: BOSTON, Aug. 7 (UPI)A minor change in the Massa chusetts marriage law has given courting men equal rights with their prospective brides. For the first time in 200 years, men be tween the ages of 18 and 21 will be able to marry without parental consent. Gov. Francis W. Sargent signed legislation in May lowering the legal mar rying age for men to 18, but the law did not take effect un til today.

title: Johnson, Frederickson to Miss Giant Opener Tomorrow Night
description: The long path of outside competition, stretching at least to Dec. 19 and hopefully be yond, starts for the New York Giants in Houston tomorrow night.

title: Marion Jones, Hunter Adviser, Becomes Bride
description: NEW LEBANON, N. Y., Aug. 7Miss Marion Phelps Jones, a career counselor at Hunter College, and Kingsland Ar thur Percival, a descendant of Ambrose Kingsland, Mayor of New York from 1851 to 1853, were married here yesterday in the Roman Catholic Church of the Immaculate Concep tion.

title: Big Powers Act to Prevent IndianPakistani Fighting
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7The principal Western powers, as well as the Soviet Union, China and Secretary General U Thant, were reported today to be en gaged in new diplomatic efforts to prevent the possible out break of fighting between India and Pakistan.

title: Movies
description: IT had been a typical day for Shirley MacLaine, movie star, hoofer, mem oirist, kook, big sister of Warren Beatty, political activist, iconoclast, occasional wife, Rat Pack pioneer, cause collector, angel of two Asian orphan ages, globetrotter, and now, a selfstyled communicator.

title: 88 OF AWAMI LEAGUE KEEP PAKISTAN SEATS
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Aug. 7 The Government of President Agha Mohammed Yahya Khan announced today that 88 mem bers of the National Assembly belonging to the banned Awami League would retain their seats.

title: Susan's Girl, $3.80, Wins Inaugural of Signature Stakes by 5 Lengths at Liberty
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 7 (AP) Fred W. Hooper's Susan's Girl came from well off the pace today to win the first run ning of the $58,500 Signature Stakes for 2yearold fillies at Liberty Bell Race Track.

title: The Nation
description: WASHINGTON  As rain drummed on Pennsylvania Ave nue the other day, a yellow school bus from rural Virginia splashed past the White House with a cargo of sightseeing chil dren. Some 18 million young sters, nearly four of every ten, Aide to their public school classes in such buses every day during the school year.

title: Turbine  Powered Pleasure Boat Is Ready to Goon Production Line
description: POMPANO BEACH, Fla., Aug. 7  The first turbine powered pleasure boat to be put into production has been announced by ChrisCraft. Aft er years of research and test ing turbines, the world's larg est builder of motorboats has adapted the new Ford Motor Company turbine to some of its larger boats.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: WASHINGTON REPORT
description: WASHINGTON  Most of us have been brought up to believe that a steadystate inflation is not only dreadful but impossible.

title: T. V. Station on L. I. Seeks Aid
description: GARDEN CITY, L.I., Aug. 7Take a heaping helping of Julia Child, William F. Buckley Jr. and Sesame Street, add daytime school television service and stir with a varied assortment of original programing focused on Long Island and its prob lems.

title: = NATIONAL PARKS DROP IN TOURISM
description: YOSEMITE NATIONAL PARK, Calif.  For years Cali fornians have assumed  and they were right most of the time  that to get a hotel room at this crowded park in August, they had to make a reservation in May at the lat est. But this summer, the hotels here have empty rooms many Lights.

title: SYKES An WEED WIN Y.R.A. RACES
Syracuse Seeks a Truce Between White and Black Youths
description: SYRACUSE, Aug. 7The Hu man Relations Commission of Syracuse and Onondaga Coun ty is seeking to bring about truce between bands of black and white youths here to avoid recurrences of the series of racial clashes, window break ings and firebombings that have occurred in recent weeks.

title: Shaving for Gold
description: CALI, Colombia, Aug. 7 Is it possible for two teams to control the outcome of an athletic event if the final re sult is to their benefit?

title: City and Unions to Confer On Blue Shield Dispute
description: Leaders and technicians rep resenting the Municipal Labor Committee will confer tomor row and Tuesday with city of ficials in a further attempt to find a solution of the dispute over the city's plan to term inate Blue Shield coverage for city employes.

title: Entremont Makes Local Debut As Conductor in Mozart Fete
description: Philippe Entremont was front and center and very busy at Philharmonic Hall, on Friday night and again last night in his New York debut appearances as conductorpianist in Lin coln Center's Mostly Mozart Festival. The French keyboard virtuoso has been a frequent visitor here since 1954, but un til this weekend he had always left the conducting of concerts in which he performed to some body else.

title: DITTEMORE, POSEY TAKE AUTO HEATS
description: SEATTLE, Aug. 7 (AP)Jim Dittemore of Palos Verdes, Calif., and Sam Posey of Sharon, Conn., dominated the Seafair 200 auto race today and collected $12,000 of the $40,000 purse.

title: Frank T. Ace Wins
description: The 11yearold Frank T. Ace, driven by Lucien Fontaine, changed apparent defeat into la brilliant, length victory over Ferric Hanover in a $15,000, JFAAA handicap mile pace timed in 1:5935. Frank T. Ace returned $4.40 for $2 to win.

title: L.I. Polo Players Resort to Wheels
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L.I., Aug. 7From behind the tall hedgerows of this resort community, when the intense heat of a sunny Sunday sum mer afternoon has begun to wane, the careful listener may hear an unusual combi nation of soundsthe thwack of a mallet against a polo ball and the squeal of brakes.

title: Deborah Johnson Is Bride Upstate
description: WATERTOWN, N. Y., Aug. 7Miss Deborah Jane John son and Fitzhugh Elder 3d, son of Mr. and Mrs. Elder Jr. of Staunton, Va., were married here this afternoon In the First Presbyterian Church by the Rev. John B. Smiley.

title: Upstairs at The Bull Run By Moira Pearce. 287 pp. New York: W. W. Norton & Co. $6.95.
description: The Bull Run is a con verted New York town house, in which several wellseasoned ladies are facing the sunset years. Each occupant has a dif ferent accommodation to age: One takes to booze; one to sculpture; one to a new suitor. One is a New York grande dame with a particular attach ment to the old building. (Her father was its architect.) When the Bull Run is sold and headed for the bulldozers, some re adjustments are called for. Moira Pearce has an engaging way with a storylow keyed and drily witty.

title: Brewers Edge Royals, 65
description: KANSAS CITY, Aug. 7 (AP)  Jose Cardenal and Tommy Harper each drove in two runs and Dave May hit a home run to lead the Milwaukee Brew ers to a 65 victory over the Kansas City Royals tonight in the first game of a scheduled doubleheader. The game was cut short by rain in the sev enth inning and the second game was rained out and re scheduled for Sept. 6.

title: Miss Gardner Wed in Akron
description: AKRON, Ohio, Aug. 7 Miss Margaret Eileen Gard ner and James A. Fletcher were married here at noon today in St. Sebastian Roman Catholic Church by the Rev. Charles Byrider.

title: EDUCATION GROUP REVISES CHARTER
description: FORT COLLINS, Colo., Aug. 7 (AP)Delegates to the con stitutional convention of the National Education Association have adopted a proposed new constitution that would limit the influence of school admin istrators in the organization and, in some cases, bar them from membership.

title: YANKS BEATEN
description: The way some of the Yankees talked after they lost to Baltimore, 31, yesterday, they probably would have pre ferred having Mickey Mouse and Snow White umpire behind the plate.

title: Space
description: The full moon shines on the earth this weekend with special splendor.

title: Mrs. Wendy Hart Wed to a Banker
description: FARMINGTON, Conn., Aug. 7Mrs. Wendy Morgan Hart and John Carlyle Garrels 3d were married here this noon by the Rev. Sidney Lovett, an Episcopal minister and chaplain emeritus of Yale University. The ceremony was performed at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Olcott Damon Smith. The bridegroom is the son of Mr. and Mrs. Garrels Jr. of Wentworth, England.

title: They Told You Hollywood Was Dead? Ha!
description: UNIVERSAL CITY, Calif.Hurry, hurry, hurry, folks, step right up, put your money down and take the titanic tour! What tour? Why just the most terrifically titillating treasurefilled treat of a triedandtrue tour that you've ever taken, yes, sirree! They told you Hollywood was dead? That the big studios are all going out of business and that nobody's making mov ies the way they used to anymore? Don't you believe it, folks! Because right here, at Universal Studios, which bills itself as the world's largest and busiest motion picture studio, nestled on some 420 acres in the very heart of the smog shrouded Hollywood Hills, we will prove to you, beyond the shadow of any possi ble doubt, that the patient is not only still alive and well, but just as beautiful as ever.

title: MANY RON DIES; PARIS COUTURIER
description: CANNES, France, Aug. 7 (AP) Maggy Rouff, who opened her haute couture house in Paris in 1930, died here today. In private life she was Mrs. Pierre Besan con de Wagner.

title: Gallic wedding treat
description: The French film director, Claude Chabrol, begins his re cent film, Le Bucher, with an elaborate wedding in a Peri gord village. Always extreme ly careful about the small de tails of provincial life, this Bal zac of the movies sees to it that the wedding cake is the right one.As the camera pans around the hired banquet hall, a honey colored pyramid comes into view, a croquembouche: Liter ally, the word meanscrunches in the mouth and that is just what this hill of cream puffs does. Caramel syrup holds the puffs together and gives them their snappy texture. Try it at next wedding.

title: 201 Shot Jersey Victor;
description: OCEANPORT, N. J., Aug. 7 A neglected guest named West Coast Scout turned out to be the $42.20 life of the party to day in fourth running of the $100,000 Monmouth Invitational Handicap.

title: MOBILE U.S. UNITS HELP CONSUMERS
description: Rather than wait for slum residents to go to them, two Federal offices here have been going into the slums themselves in the last few weeks to seek out consumer complaints.

title: Elizabeth Lemmon Bride in Memphis
description: MEMPHIS, Aug 7Mr. and Mrs. Henry Brandon Lemmon have announced the engage ment of their daughter, Miss Elizabeth Minor Lemmon, to Hugh Montgomery Brinkley Jr., son of the late Mr. and Mrs. Brinkley of Memphis and Bruins Plantation at Hughes, Ark.

title: Astronaut's Father Resigns
description: DERRY, N. H., Aug. 7 (AP) Alan B. Shepard, father of Capt. Alan Shepard Jr., the as tronaut, has resigned as treas urer of Pinkerton Academy after 40 years in the post. Mr. Shepard will be succeeded by Irving Bicey.

title: RANGERS TO PLAY 39 HOME GAMES
description: The New York Rangers, start ing their 46th year in the Na tional Hockey League, will open their home season on Wednes day, Oct. 13, against the Bos ton Bruins at Madison Square Garden. The game will be the first of 39 at the Garden for the 197172 Rangers, who last season finished with 109 points, the second highest total in N. H. L. history.

title: Hicksville Facing a Test On Shape of Its Future
description: HICKSVILLE, LI., Aug. 7 The Town of Oyster Bay is ready to act on the first phase of a plan to develop Hicksville's downtown section into one of Nassau County's major office and apartment hubs.

title: Susan Coombe and Robert Wolff Wed
description: SCARSDALE, N.Y., Aug. 7 Miss Susan Coombe and Rob ert Richard Wolff were mar ried here today in the Hitch cock Presbyterian Church by the Rev. David O. Kendall.

title: HighandDry Marina Will Open at Freeport Today
description: FREEPORT, L.I., Aug. 7 A former Army paratrooper has taken a jump ahead of the marine industry's growth by virtually extending the boating season on Long Is land through a newtype fa cility: the largest indoor stor age marina on the northeast ern seaboard.

title: Pros Enroll Dover
description: MEMPHIS, Aug. 7 (AP)The Memphis Pros today signed Jer ry Dover, who at 5 feet inches and 155 pounds, would be the smallest player in profes sional basketballprovided he can make the team.

title: Dr. Joel Greenberger Is Fiance Of Miss Martha Lee Spaulding
description: ARMONK, N. Y., Aug. 7 Mr. and Mrs. John Pearson Spaulding of Armonk and Moultonboro, N. H., have made known the engagement of their daughter, Miss Mar tha Lee Spaulding, to Dr. Joel Steven Greenberger. His parents are Dr. and Mrs. Ju lius P. Greenberger of Pitts burgh.

title: MARTIN, WALTS GAIN BOYS' TENNIS FINAL
description: KALAMAZOO, Mich., Aug. 7 (AP)Bill Martin, seeded No. 1, a 14yearold from River Forest, Ill., defeated Tom Kreiss of Los Angeles, 6.2, 62, today in the semifinal round of boys' singles in the national junior and boys16 tennis champion ships.

title: Dressage Judges' Clinic at Spa Being Directed by Col. Handler
description: Horse Show News

title: Tea, Sympathyand Help
description: CAROLE THOMPSON, shown here with playwright Robert Anderson, is the newest member of The New Drama tists Committee, currently celebrating its 21st year of helping to develop writing talent for the theater. Miss Thompson's first play, I'd Go to Heaven If I Was Good, about growing up in a Brooklyn ghetto, brought en couraging comments from the more than halfdozen pro ducers to whom she submitted it. But only Harold Prince actually did something, says Miss Thompson. The producer sent it, with his commendation, to The New Dramatists Com mittee, which immediately took the young playwright under its wing.

title: Le Mans 24 By Denne Bart Petitclerc. 182 pp. New York: Harcourt Brace Jovanovich. $5.95.
description: Chris Breslin, international racingcar champ out of River dale, Calif., is in Le Mans for the famous 24hour endurance race. Piloting No. 17, a green Lola special, Chris does better on the track than he does back at the hotel with Vali Beaufort, his French girl friend. Petit clerc himself is handier with automotive affairs than with human relationships... Weee eeishcrack! There goes Bres lin into the Indianapolis curve, wheel to wheel with Karl Ernst, the German ace. Very exciting, and authentic enough so that you can smell scorched tires. But Chris's liaison with Vali seems a mechanical after thought of smaller moment than a pit stop.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: AROUND THE
description: Ragweed can be controlled by spraying with the amine form of 2,4D at the rate of onehalf pound per acre; be careful of drift of this weedkiller to valuable plants. ... Make plans to feed all valu able trees in late summer or early fall io promote their growth and vigor. . . . Protect peach trees from moths of peach tree borer in flight now: spray trunks and scaffold with malathion and drench soil around tree every two weeks until the end of month.

title: Miss Lang Married To Rex Lardner Jr.
description: YARMOUTHPORT, Mass., Aug. 7Miss Mary Lucille Lang, daughter of Mrs. Ben jamin R. Lang and the late Mr. Lang, was married here this afternoon to Rex Lard ner Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Lardner of Greak Neck, L. I. The Rev. Richard Tinney per formed the ceremony in the Roman Catholic Chapel of the Sacred Heart.

title: Books:
description: CAPITALISM TODAY. Edited by Daniel Bell and Irving Kristol. Basic Books, Inc. 185 pages. $6.95.

title: COWBOYS VICTORS OVER RAMS, 4521
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 7 (AP) The Dallas Cowboys capital ized on four pass interceptions, Mark Washington returning the final one 102 yards, to rout the Los Angeles Rams, 4521, last night and spoil the home field debut of coach Tommy Prothro.

title: For Me, the Most Wildly Romantic Figure
description: AN image can be so pow erful that it is more than your imagination can bear. You can find yourself forced into dealing with it as you deal with joy or grief, forced into allevi ating the pressure it exerts. on you by sharing it with others, forced, in other words, into making a painting ... a photograph ... a film.

title: Cali Time Bombs Didn't Co Off, But Some People Keep Trying
description: CALI, Colombia, Aug. 7 Political extremists have not given up trying to sabotage the 31nation sixth Pan American Games.

title: DEMOCRATS HELD BEST ON ECONOMY
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 7 Americans currently place twice as much confidence in the Democratic party's ability to assure prosperity than in the Republican party's economic prospects, the Gallup Poll re ported today.

title: SAILOR GIVES VIEW OF DEFECTION BID
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 7 (AP) Simas A. Kudirka, the Lithu anian sailor who attempted to defect to the United States last year, reportedly believes that the American refusal to grant him political asylum stemmed from reluctance to meddle in internal Soviet policy.

title: Police in Brooklyn Led to Arms Cache By Suspect's Child
description: A child's suggestion to see all the guns and knives and things my daddy has in the garage led the police yester day to a cache of almost 100 weapons, including rifles, pis tols and two machine guns, in a Brooklyn garage rented by a former marine sergeant.

title: M'NITT ACHIEVES SHIELDS TRIUMPH
description: GREENWICH, Conn., Aug. 7 James D. McNitt's Imbat (by 31 seconds and 10 lengths in the Shields Class) and H. Franklin Bloomer Jr.'s Mon goose (by 73 seconds and 22 lengths among the Solings) were winners of 9.8mile races off Belle Haven Club on Long Island Sound today.

title: JUDGE NOMINEE BACKS PRECEDENT
description: I think of myself, said Charles L. Brieant Jr., as a be liever in the importance of de cided precedents. I believe that the courts, particularly the lower courts, ought to follow the decisions of higher courts.

title: SYNTHETIC TRACK WILL BE COVERED
description: MIAMI, Aug. 7 (AP)Horse men at Calder Race Course voted today to cover the syn thetic SafTTurf racing strip with dirt or sand.

title: Stamps
