description: AT 8:52 A.M. last Monday, Col. David Scott, commander of the Apollo 15 Mission to the Moon carried out a firstday ceremony on the moon, his audience being singular, Lieut. Col. James B. Irwin, his companion on the record breaking mission.

title: Staten Island Development Topic of State Hearings
description: A joint state legislative com mittee headed by Senator John J. Marchi and Assemblyman Edward J. Amann has sched uled public hearings next month on a proposal to create a South Richmond Develop ment Corporation on Staten Island.

title: Rights Aides Find Southern Blacks Failing to Use Voting Power
description: WATERPROOF, La., Aug. 6 Julian Bond and John Lewis, two pioneers in the civil rights movement, came to this tiny river town yesterday and dis covered a blend Of the activism and apathy that has come to typify the new black electorate of the South.

title: HARTFORD REVIEW OF NEW TAX IS SET
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 7Thou aands of Connecticut residents have written letters, telephoned and signed petitions urging repeal of the recently enacted state income tax, but the Joint Finance Committee of the Gen eral Assembly is offering yet another opportunity to speak out on the question Monday.

title: Taiwan Preparing Its Envoys For Drive to Keep Seat in U.N.
description: TAIPEI, Taiwan, Aug. 7  Nationalist China, preparing to make a vigorous defense of its position in the United Nations, is convening conferences of its ambassadors in various parts of the world and sending high level economic and trade mis sions to Latin America.

title: Gardens
description: PASSING through Ashley Falls, Mass., travelers headed for the music of Tanglewood or the ski slopes of the Berkshires go by a small sign pointing left, bearing the words Bartholomew's Cobble. If they take the time to investigate, they find that the Cobble is not, as they may have supposed, the home of an ancient shoe maker, but is instead an unusually var ied 167acre nature preserve.

title: Drysdale, Rosewall Cain U.S. Pro. Final
description: BROOKLINE, Mass., Aug. 7 Thirdseeded Cliff Drysdale ousted the favorite, John New combe, and Ken Rosewall crushed America's last hope by defeating Marty Riessen today in the semifinals of the $50,000 United States pro tennis cham pionships at the Longwood Cricket Club.

title: HIGHLIGHTS OF THE WEEK
description: STEEL PRODUCERS, shortly after reaching a labor agreement calling for wage increases of about 31 per cent over the next three years, announced they would raise prices by an average of 8 per cent on nearly all types of steel products. The price changes were the second round this year and brought cumulative increases in 1971 to about 15 per cent.

title: NATOMalta Talks Reported
description: VALLETTA, Malta, Aug. (AP)Two officials of the North Atlantic Treaty organi zation were on Malta today with a reported offer of $24 million a year to keep this Mediterranean island as a base for the alliance.

title: Equal Opportunities for Deaf Are Asked at Parley
description: PARIS, Aug. 7Some 2,000 deaf people and experts spe cializing in their problems ended their sixth World Con gress here this week with a call for equal opportunity for the 30 million people in the world afflicted with deafness.

title: Trading With a Bigger E.E.C.
description: Enlargement of the Euro pean Common Market may well be the best thing that could happen to us.

title: Cuban Falls to Death At Games in Colombia
description: CALI, Colombia, Aug. 7 (AP)A trainer from the Cu ban athletic team, reported ly shouting Down with Fi del! plunged to his death from the fifth floor of the Cu ban building today.

title: New Texas Airline Loves Its Passengers
description: DALLAS, Aug. 7Love as a weapon to encourage de fections from established loyalties is a proven tactic in international politics. But a new Texasbased commuter airline might teach the C.I.A. some new tricks.

title: Leone Seeking a Bus Terminal
description: Sebastian Leone, the Bor ough President of Brooklyn, wants a portion of the more than $1billion due the city in Federal transportation funds to be used for the con struction of a major bus ter minal in Brooklyn.

title: Center on L.I. Aids Youths and Parents
description: SMITHTOWN, L. I., Aug. 7 It's a store in a shopping mall that has been called an antinarcotics center, but it closely resembles a religious bookstore. It is a little bit of both. The store sells religious books and it offers drug counseling, but its true na ture, as described by one of its founders, is a kaleido scope.

title: PEKING
description: PEKING, Aug. 7President Nixon is handling his relations with this sensitive and suspicious capital about as well as anybody could do under the circumstances. He is tiptoeing through a mine field, which extends from here through Tokyo, Moscow, Taipei, Saigon and Hanoi, and could easily be blown up at any point, but so far, as seen from here, he has been remarkably effective.

title: Harriet Friday To Be a Bride
description: FOX CHAPEL, Pa., Aug. 7  Mr. and Mrs. Grant Ed ward Friday have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Harriet Fri day, to Michael J. Leahy of New York, son of Mrs. Joseph M. Leahy of Chicago and the late Mr. Leahy.

title: HEARD 201 LEADS AKRON GOLF BY 5
description: AKRON, Ohio, Aug. 7Jerry Heard, blistering the Firestone South Course at a record pace, fired a third straight subpar round today, a twounderpar 68, for a 54hole total of 201 to lead the $150,000 American Golf Classic.

title: Frederica, P. French Is Affianced
description: LOCUST VALLEY, L. I., Aug. 7Miss Frederica Pear son French, an assistant to the appointments secretary of Mayor John V. Lindsay of New York, and Alexander Yount McFerran, a manage ment consultant with A. P. Kerr & Associates in New York, will be married here Oct. 2.

title: Bank Names Two Women
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 7 (UPI)The Bank of America has announced the appoint ment of two women employes to special jobs to assure that females are being trained for and placed into challenging and meaningful positions. The new positions are called personnel relations officerwomen.

title: Recordings
description: WITHIN the walled museum that is the modern concert hall (some composers would say walled fortress), Handel's Israel in ?? can occasionally be encounteral, when a choral society look, about for an alternative to the Messiah. But where oth er than in the concerthall withoutwalls that recordings make possible is anyone like ly to be put in touch with Carl Philipp Emanuel Bach's The Israelites in the Desert?

title: Satchel Paige Will Enter Hall of Fame Tomorrow
description: COOPERSTOWN, N. Y., Aug. 7 (AP)Satchel Paige, the Ne gro pitching great, will be among seven former baseball stars and one executive who will be inducted into the Hall of Fame Monday.

title: Schooners Sail Off Gloucester In Annual Race Next Saturday
description: Traditional schooners and their modern skippers and crews will stir Gloucester, Mass., waters next Saturday in the third annual Great Schooner Race. To enter, a schooner must have, a gaff rigged fore and mainsail, with at least a 25foot water line length.

title: BELFAST TRUCKMAN KILLED BY A SENTRY
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Aug. 7The driver of a deliv ery truck was shot to death to day by a British Army sentry in the Springfield Road section of this city. It appeared later that the sentry had fired in er ror, mistaking the vehicle's backfiring for the sound of a gunshot.

title: Linda Adler Betrothed
description: Mr. and Mrs. Ira R. Adler of Riverdale, the Bronx, have made known the en gagement of their daughter, Miss Linda Susan Adler, to Seymour Stein. He is the son of Mr, and Mrs. David Stein bigle of New York, Miss Adler, a graduate of the Uni versity of Buffalo, holds a master's degree from Teach ers College of Columbia University and is teaching in the public school system here.

title: Royals Promote Hurler
description: KANSAS CITY, Aug. 7 (AP) The Kansas City Royals to day called up Lance Clemons, a pitcher, from Omaha to re place Bruce Dal Canton, who was placed on the 21day dis abled list.

title: 3 Bearded Astronauts Cheered By Sailors on Deck of Carrier
description: ABOARD U.S.S. OKINAWA IN THE PACIFIC, Aug. 7The United States Navy plucked the allAir Force Apollo 15 crew from the Pacific. Ocean today amid the cheers of sailors lin ing the decks of this helicopter carrier.

title: Cambodians Retake Town
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Aug. 7 (Reuters)Cambodian troops, supported by river gunboats, have retaken the strategic town of Preykry in an 11day opera tion to cut a major enemy in filtration and supply route north of Pnompenh, a military spokesman reported today.

title: CHINA SEEN WARM TO NIXON FOR 1972
description: A leading Hungarian mag azine has published an article that purports to present the views of China experts in the, Soviet Union on Peking's rela tions with the United States and the Soviet Union.

title: Mrs. Bullen Has Child
description: KINGS POINT, L.I., Aug. 7A daughter was born July 25 to Mr. and Mrs. George H. Bullen at the North Shore Hospital in Manhasset.

title: James Thayer, Harriette Peper Are Wed Here
description: Miss Harriette Ann Peper was married yesterday to James Little Thayer, The Rev. F. Goldthwaite Sherrill performed the ceremon yin Grace Episcopal Church in Brooklyn Heights.

title: The Nation
description: I hate the thoughts of the Black Panthers. I hate the thoughts of the Weathermen's faction of the Students for a Democratic Society. I hate the thoughts of Fascists. I hate the thoughts of totalitarians. I hate the thoughts of people who adopt violence as a policy. But those people have the same right to freedom of speech, subject to a very slight qualification, that I have.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Announced with some fan fare in May, 1969, Opera tion Breakthrough, the Hous ing and Urban Development (HUD) program aimed at im proving housing production, is slowly, here and there, be ginning to take onsite shape.

title: Brezhnev Reported Planning a Visit to Yugoslavia Next Month
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, Aug. 7Leonid I. Brezhnev, the So viet Communist party leader, plans to make an official visit to Yugoslavia next month, well informed officials disclosed today.

title: Mailbox:
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: A Journey To Sahalin By James McConkey. 248 pp. New York: Coward, McCann & Geoghegan. $6.95.
description: In James McConkey's excellent first novel, Crossroads, published in 1968, a man in his forties is assailed by a rush of memories that almost obscures his sense of present time. Mr. McConkey's second novel, A Journey to Sahalin, is all present a current event. Newspaper articles and letters provide some of the ex position, and in the second part of the book the chapters are dated rath er than numbered. Along the bottom of each page and extending beyond the end of the text is a continuous string of newspaper headlines on na tional and international affairs, which have a disturbing effect on the reader, just as they have a dis turbing effect on the characters in the book. The headlines constantly remind us that no matter what takes place in the story, the world itself has mad.

title: Letters:
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: Flyers Sign Plante
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 7 (AP) The Philadelphia Flyers of the National Hockey League to day signed Pierre Plante, their second draft choice. Plante plays right wing.

title: Letters
description: TO THE EDITOR:

title: MILWAUKEE WAR: CITY VS. COUNTY
description: MILWAUKEE, Aug, 6The Milwaukee County Executive, John L. Doyne, can sit in his thirdfloor, woodpaneled offices high on a hill near the down town section and look out over the city at the offices of Mayor Henry W. Maier.

title: Foreign Notes
description: Boy's End

title: GOLDWATER CALLED TARGET OF RED DRIVE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (AP) Czechoslovak agents in the United States distributed leaf lets during the 1964 Presidenti al campaign attacking Senator Barry Goldwater of Arizona, the Republican nominee, as a racist, according to testimony published today.

title: Media General Introduces Financial Daily Newspaper
description: RICHMOND, Va., Aug. 8 (UPI)The Media General Fin ancial Daily, a daily newspaper designed mainly for the East Coast financial community, be gan publication today. It is pub lished by Media General, Inc., a Richmondbased communica tions company.

title: 21 G.O.P. Fund Dinners To Hear President Nov. 9
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (AP) The Republicans announced plans today to hold $500a plate Salute to the President fundraising dinners Tuesday, Nov. 9, in 21 cities.

title: European Bankers Fearful Of U.S. Capital Outflow
description: GENEVA, Aug. 8 (AP)Euro pean bankers said today that a United States Congressional subcommittee's call for devalua tion of the dollar could intensify the outflow of capital from the United States and set off a series of currency readjustments that would disturb foreign exchange markets.

title: PAUL P. MOLE, CUT CELEBRITIES' HAIR
description: Paul Peter Mold, who made his barber shop at 1021 Lexing ton Avenue a rendezvous for personalities in the entertain ment world and others who enjoyed hearing his stories about them, died Friday in Boulevard Hospital after a long illness. He was 61 years old and lived at 3503 28th Avenue, Astoria.

title: Nader Urges Stans Resign
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (AP) Ralph Nader, the consumer advocate, called today for the resignation of Maurice H. Stans as Secretary of Commerce. He said Mr. Stans clearly, un abashedly represents a special, narrow, businessinterest view point. Mr. Nader was inter viewed on Face the Nation, a C.B.S. television program.

title: Schumacher's Hydro Wins In Seafair Trophy Race
description: SEATTLE, Aug. 8 (AP)Bill Schumacher in Pride of Pay'n Pak, forced by an accident to twice win a championship heat, raced to a quarterlap victory in $30,000 Seafair Trophy un limited hydroplane race today.

title: WELFARE STUDY FOR 1969 REPORTS 60,000 INELIGIBLE
description: A stateaided study estimat ed yesterday that about 20 per cent more black family membersabout 60,000 peo plethan were eligible were receiving welfare aid in New York City in 1969.

title: U.S. Jets Attack Gun Positions In Northin Protective Reaction
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam. Monday, Aug. 9 (AP)  Two American supersonic fighter bombers yesterday attacked antiaircraft emplacements six miles inside North Vietnam that had fired on an American re connaisance jet, the United States command announced to day.

title: Service, Not Snobbery, Made This Wine Merchant Successful
description: CHARENTON, FrancePierre Nicolas drinks wine with almost every meal. But then, he has 11 million bottles in his cellars.

title: YOUTH VOTE DRIVE SLOWED IN TEXAS
description: AUSTIN, Tex., Aug. 8 Countdown '72, an effort to register voters under 21 in the hope of electing candidates who will end the war in Vietnam, arrived in Texas this weekend and became embroiled in a dis pute over local strategy and tactics.

title: He BabySits, for Houseplants, That Is
description: The poodle can go to the kennel and the Siamese a cattery when the family's on vacation, but what happens to the fern or the peperomia that's blooming in the win dow? Often it's left to the hitormiss care of a neighbor or a motherinlaw, who either drowns it or forgets to water it.

title: Janet Rose Fuchsberg Is Bride Of Michael Rootberg, Consultant
description: HARRISON, N. Y., Aug. 8 Miss Janet Rose Fuchsberg, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Jacob D. Fuchsberg of New York and Harrison, and Michael Yale Rootberg, son of Mr. and Mrs. Irving Root berg of Lincolnwood, Ill., were married here this after noon.

title: INFLATION VEXES PURCHASE GROUP
description: Inflation worries remain in tense among purchasing exec utives, according to the month ly survey of its members by the National Association of Pur chasing Management, Inc.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Last year, Kevin Smith's mother said he'd better find himself a summer program. No more running around the streets. Kevin was 14 then. Reluctantly, he began playing tennis under Sydney Llewellyn, in Harlem. I played to pacify my mother, said Kevin. I really wasn't getting into things, but she was paranoid. My neighborhood's not that had, I live on the Concourse between 163d and 164th Streets. I wasn't interested in tennis, I thought it was boring. Like boating. I never liked that tennis stuff on I Spy.

title: Puerto Rican Quintet Upsets Cuba by 8479
description: CALI, Colombia, Aug. 8 (AP)Puerto Rico used a strong zone defense to upset Cuba, the conqueror of the United States, 8479, today in the first game of the six team playoffs for the Pan American basketball cham pionship.

title: DICK LAMB
description: DAVENPORT, Iowa, Aug. 8 (AP)Dick Lamb, official his torian for the National Football Foundation and Hall of Fame and a reporter for The Daven port TimesDemocrat, died yes terday, apparently of a heart attack. He was 43 years old.

title: Miss Kessler Bride Of Dr. Larry Stein
description: BRYN MAWR, Pa., Aug. 8 Miss Marsha Kessler, a graduate of Bryn Mawr Col lege and daughter of Mrs. Charles M. Fleshner of At lanta and Samuel Kessler Of Tampa, Fla., was married here this afternoon to Dr. Larry Stein, head of the de partment of psychopharma cology of Wyeth Labora tories in Radnor. He is the son of Mrs. Leo Stein of New York and the late Mr. Stein.

title: Time, Gentlemen, Asks A Committee of Lords
description: LONDON, Aug. 8A com mittee of the House of Lords wants at least two clocks installed prominently in the Upper House of Parliament to register how long a mem ber has been speaking.

title: Welcome at Airport
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 8 (Reuters) A crowd of about 4,000, mostly members of India's pro Moscow Communist party, gave Foreign Minister Gromyko a tumultuous welcome at New Delhi's Palam Airport. Many carried Soviet flags and ban ners with slogans supporting the Bengali independence move ment in East Pakistan.

title: Prospects for Yugoslavia
description: President Tito at 79 has been elected to another five year term as the climax to a drastic overhaul of Yugo slavia's federal system. Designed to insure the unity and integrity of the country after his departure, the reforms, hammered out in oftenacrimonious sessions over ten months, make much sense, given Yugoslavia's potpourri of nationalities and cultures.

title: BOAC Denies It Is Planning A New $180 Atlantic Fare
description: LONDON, Monday Aug. 9 (UPI)The British Overseas Airways Corporation yesterday denied report that the airline was going to offer a $180 roundtrip fare between Lon don and New York.

title: Article 2  No Title
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (AP) The Washington Darts and Bangu of Brazil played to b a 22 tie today in a North Ameri can Soccer League internation al game.

title: AT HOME ABROAD
description: LONDON, Aug. 8The first reports from China by the newly admitted American correspondents have been especially fascinating in their picture of egalitarianism in that society. The absence of private cars, the modest salary differentials, the doctors taking their turn of service in remote rural areasall this has great appeal to those troubled by the individual ac quisitiveness of our world.

title: Article 3  No Title
description: KALAMAZOO, Mich., Aug. 8 (AP)Raul Ramirez of Mexico and undefeated Billy Martin of River Forest, Ill., scored straightset victories today in the singles finals of the na tional junior and boys16 ten nis championships.

title: STEEL MILLS FACE REDUCED DEMANDS
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 8Steel producers were puzzling last week over the implications of declining demand and rising prices.

title: City Urged to Adopt The Town Horse Idea
description: A onemonth trial of free subway service was advo cated last night by Felix J. Cuervo, president of the Native New Yorkers His torical Association.

title: Iraq Forms Unit on Babylon
description: BAGHDAD, Iraq, Aug. 8 (Reuters)A committee of ex perts has been formed under Information Minister Shafik al Kamali to open a worldwide campaign to reconstruct the ancient city of Babylon.

title: ABRAMS RALLIES FARE OPPONENTS
description: Bronx Borough President Robert Abrams reported yes terday that a committee was being formed to back. his plan to eliminate transit fares in fa vor of a new tax package.

title: New French Nuclear Test
description: PARIS, Aug. 8 (UPI)France exploded a nuclear device of low intensity today over the Mururoa atoll, French Poly nesia, Defense Ministry officials said. The test was the fourth in a series designed to create a small but powerful nuclear weapon, the Ministry said.

title: Ballet: Halprin Troupe
description: NEW LONDON, Conn., Aug. 8What did we expect to see at Connecticut College from Ann Halprin's Dancers Work shop of San Francisco a choreographic revolution, a splendid company, a frank display of the human body?

title: Poor Crowd, Not Defeat, Jolts Colts
description: BALTIMORE, Aug. 8The size of the crowd, and cer tainly not the game, was the news at Memorial Stadium last night as the Baltimore Colts, pro football's cham pions, played the first pre season game in their home stadium in 10 years. The crowd was 16,771, which is likely to be the smallest of the year in the National Foot ball League unless the Colts draw fewer fans in two future home exhibitions.

title: Mourners Pay Tribute to Carlo Gambino's Wife
description: Federal and city lawenforce ment officers sat in unmarked cars outside a Brooklyn fu neral parlor yesterday watch ing mourners who arrived to pay tribute to Mrs. Kathryn Gambino, the wife of Carlo Gambino, reputed Mafia leader. She died Friday in a hospital after a long illness.

title: Coast Policemen Acquitted In Slaying of 2 Mexicans
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 8 (Reut ers)A Federal court jury, after deliberating for three days, acquited four California policemen today on charges arising from the fatal shootings of two Mexicans during a police raid a year ago.

title: Mrs. Binh: Our Plan for Peace
description: PARISThe Paris fourparty confer ence on Vietnam has held over 120 sessions and, if counted in days, has lasted two and onehalf years. In the meantime, the war is still going on in South Vietnam and has been ex panded to Cambodia and Laos. The South Vietnam people still have to live in rains of bombs, destruction, and death. American youths continue to die on battlefields and to destroy themselves with drugs out of despair and frustration.

title: Vikings Spoil Plunkett's Debut
description: Many of the players the Na tional Football League teams garnered from the colleges were on view over the week end as the preseason sched ule began for most of the clubs.

title: 2 U.S. Embassy Aides' Cars Are Vandalized in Moscow
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 8The auto mobiles of two American diplo mats were badly damaged to day by Soviet vandals in an apparent act of retaliation against attacks on Soviet cars in the United States.

title: Campbell, McConica Set Swim Marks
description: CALI, Colombia, Aug. 8 (AP)  Two California collegians smashed records and a 19year old from Seattle scored a big upset as America's male swim mers won three of four gold medals tonight in the Pan American Games.

title: Sondra Gieenberg Wed to Paul Jacoby
description: SPRINGFIELD, Mass., Aug. 8Miss Sondra Lou Green berg and Paul Baker Jacoby were married here this after noon in Temple Beth El by Rabbi Jordan S. Ofseyer.

title: Chancellor's Challenge
description: The appointment of Robert J. Kibbee as Chancellor of the City University came as a surprise to New York's academic community. As vice president of Carnegie Mellon University and president of Pittsburgh's Board of Education, Dr. Kibbee is highly regarded in that city's educational establishment, but his name has not been prominent on those national rosters from which candi dates for the top university posts tend to be chosen.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: BETHPAGE, L. I., Aug. 8 Alan Corey 3d scored five goals today and led Brookville to an 85 triumph over Bethpage at Bethpage State Park in the Roth mann Tournament Cup final.

title: Mrs. Austin T. Levy Dead; Rhode Island Philanthropist
description: BURRILLVILLE, R. I., Aug. 8 (AP)Mrs. June Rockwell Levy, widow of Austin T. Levy, the philanthropist, died today at her home here. She was 85 years old.

title: Inmate Stabs Prison Guard In Chapel at San Quentin
description: SAN QUENTIN, Calif., Aug. 8 (UPI)A San Quentin Prison guard was stabbed in the chest today as he entered a prison chapel. It was the third stab bing at the institution this weekend. One was fatal.

title: Malaysian Guerrillas Sought
description: KUCHING, Malaysia, Aug. 8 (AP)More than 1,500 police men, soldiers and Government officers mounted a largescale search for Communist guerrillas in Sarawak State over the weekend.

title: 3 Democrats in New Hampshire Stress Economics
description: HOLLIS, N. H., Aug. 8Three of the leading Democratic can didates and potential candidates for the Presidency seemed to day to agree that economic is sues would dominate the 1972 campaign against President Nixon.

title: Stakes for British Labor
description: LONDONOnly one major question remains concerning the Labor party's stand on British membership in the European Economic Community, but it may be the most important of all for Europe, for Britain and for the party itself:

title: HEARD TRIUMPHS DESPITE FINAL 74
description: AKRON, Ohio, Aug. 8 (UPI)  Jerry Heard, faltering to a fouroverpar 74 after three un derpar rounds, held on to win the $150,000 American Golf Classic; by three strokes today for his first victory as a pro golfer.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Advertising:
description: A motorist who just en tered the Good Service For You sweepstakes sponsored by the Gulf Oil Corporation wondered why entries were being sent, of all places, to the town of Blair, Neb. (Zip Code 68009).

title: Barbara Feuerstein, Editor, Bride
description: BRIGHTWATERS, L. I., Aug. 8 Miss Barbara Joy Feuerstein and David William Morgan Jr., son of Mr. and Mrs. Morgan of Scranton, Pa., were married here this afternoon.

title: MRS. LEVY ISAAC KAHANE
description: Mrs. Esther Kornblum Ka hane, widow of Rabbi Levy Isaac Kahane, who was spiritual leader of Congregation Tifereth Israel in Brooklyn until his death in 1951, died Saturday in Mount Sinai Hospital. She was 76 years old and lived at 1440 54th Street, Brooklyn.

title: World of the City Prostitute Is a Tough and Lonely Place
description: There are two closets in Rosie's bedroom, but she keeps one closed. It is the other that she is staring at as she lies in bed, the one whose door is always open, the one with three mink coats  a dark brown one, a lighter brown one arid her favorite, a floorlength white one.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Gains for Negroes Reported in Census
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8By 1970, the average American Negro family had acquired a better education, a better home and betterpaying jobs than ever before, a new finding of the Census Bureau shows.

title: Ranger Dies After a Fall While Climbing Mount Hood
description: MOUNT HOOD, Ore., Aug. 8 (UPI)An experienced moun tain climber was killed and his wife and two young sons were critically injured today after they fell onto a glacier rock pile while hiking near the top of this 11,245foot peak.

title: SOCCER FANS RIOT; REFEREE IS INJURED
description: MONTREAL, Aug. 8 (AP) A referee, Peter Johnson, was hospitalized today following a riot that erupted during the North American Soccer League game between the Rochester Lancers and the Montreal Olympic.

title: Coast Guard Speeding to Yacht Hijacked From Honolulu Berth
description: HONOLULU, Aug. 8 (Reu ters)An armed Coast Guard cutter is speeding to intercept three hijackers who took over a millionaire's $150,000 yacht at gunpoint from her berth here and set the crew adrift on a life raft 150 miles out at sea.

title: Argentina Puts Guerrilla Strength at 6,000
description: BUENOS AIRES, Aug. 8 Argentina now estimates that the armed subversive move ments in this country have reached an active membership of 6,000 persons.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. Boxers Beat Poland
description: WARSAW, Aug. 8 (UPI)A boxing team from the United States defeated a Polish squad, 108, last night to avenge a loss earlier in the week. Bouts were fought in nine weight cate gories, omitting light welter weight and light heavyweight.

title: Births
description: NEUFELDMr. and Mrs. Steven Neufeld Neufeld (nee Marci Malin) announce the birth of a daughter, Danielle on August 6, 1971.

title: Jackson Got a Mixed Reception in North Carolina
description: WRIGHTSVILLE BEACH, N.C., Aug. 8.At a rally here yester day of Young Democratic Clubs, Senator Henry M. Jack son, Democrat of Washington, took off his coat and tie in an effort to blend in with the gathering.

title: Alberta Oil Output Declines
description: CALGARY, Alberta, Aug. 8 (Canadian Press)  Crude oil production in Alberta averaged 1,073,743 barrels a day during the week ended Aug. 2, the Alberta Energy Resources Con servation Board reported to day, down from the previous week's 1,090,083 barrels a day. Daily production in August is expected to average 958,110 barrels, up from 862,280 bar rels in August, 1970.

title: Nixon Greets Women Who Attached Critics
description: BANGOR, Me., Aug. 8. (AP) President Nixon ended weekend in New England to day with a planeside chat with a young woman who had ripped down an anti Nixon sign.

title: Planes Spray Mosquitoes
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 8 (AP)Air planes spraying against mos quitoes carrying Venezuelan equine encephalomyelitis treated 371,517 acres of land along the Texas and Louisiana Gulf Coasts today. About 1.4 million acres remained to be sprayed in the program, which calls for treating 9 million acres along the Gulf Coast.

title: 40 Miles to Peace Service
description: BOISE, Idaho, Aug. 8 (UPI) About 50 Air Force personnel completed today a fortymile march from Mountain Home Air Force Base to attend an antiwar church service here.

title: Florida Drought Lasts
description: MIAMI, Aug. 8 (AP)Flood control officials say Florida faces a drought of gigantic proportions by next spring un less the current drought ends and a multibilliongallon water surplus is produced.

title: SHIN TZU DEEMED HUNTERDON BEST
description: FLEMINGTON, N. J., Aug. 8 The Shih Tzu is the most re cent of the 116 breeds to be registered with the American Kennel Club. Today, a golden white representative of the breed, Ch. MarDel's Ring A Ding Ding, owned by Mrs. Mar garet Edel of Millersville, Md., was named the best of 1,331 dogs at the Hunterdon Hills Kennel Club show at the Flem ington Fairgrounds.

title: Andrea Sherman Wed to Carl Heft
description: PURCHASE, N. Y., Aug. 8 Miss Andrea Joan Sher man, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John A. Sherman of New York, was married here today to Carl Steven Heft, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harold Bernard Heft of Willingboro, N.J. The ceremony was per formed at the Century Coun try Club by the Rev. Dr. Nathan A. Perilman of Tem ple EmanuEl in New York.

title: Donna Elkin Married
description: Miss Donna J. Elkin was married yesterday afternoon to Jay M. Singer. Rabbi Fred ric S. Dworkin performed the ceremony at Temple Ahavath Sholom of Flatbush in Brook lyn. The parents of the couple are Mr. and Mrs. Jack J. Elkin and Mr. and Mrs. Irving Singer. Both families reside in Brooklyn.

title: Fiat Assures Production As Pact Lifts Wages 10%
description: ROME, Aug. 8 (AP)After almost two years of intermit tent strikes that sharply cut production, Fiat has signed a twoyear labor agreement with unions representing its work ers. The giant Italian auto mobile manufacturer said the new contract provides across theboard wage increases that will increase labor costs by 10 per cent.

title: Laotian Declares He Has Cut Corruption in Army
description: VIENTIANE, Laos, Aug. 4 A year after having been named Acting Defense Minister by Premier Souvanna Phouma, who holds the post of Defense Minister himself, Sisouk na Champassak says he feels that he has cleaned up the army and turned it into a fighting force.

title: Lake Oil Slick Breaks Up
description: PORT HURON, Mich., Aug. 8 (AP)Coast Guard officials said today that an oil slick on Lake Huron, which at one time was one and a half miles wide, had pretty well broken itself up and no longer was a threat to the shore.

title: Bridge:
description: The final of the Spingold knockout team championship in Chicago last month was one of the closest in the long history of this famous event. With two deals remaining, the fourman squad of Lew Mathe and Don Krauss of of Los Angeles, Edgar Kap lan of New York and Norman Kay of Philadelphia led by 4 international match points:

title: Flight Director for Apollo 15
description: Man in the News

title: French Police and Armed Forces Discontented
description: PARIS, Aug. 8The French Government is facing expres sions of serious discontent in the police and the armed forces.

title: MORRIS FREILICHER
description: Morris Freilicher, a retired merchandising manager for Mc Greevey, Werring & Howell Company, resident buyers, died yesterday in Boulevard Hospi tal, Astoria, Queens. He was 67 years old and lived at 17810 Wexford Terrace, Jamaica Es tates, Queens.

title: SOVIET AND INDIA REACH AN ACCORD
description: NEW DELHI, Monday, Aug. 9 The Soviet Union and India signed a major agreement to day pledging support of each other if either country is the target of military aggression, Indian political sources re ported.

title: MISTRIAL CALLED IN NEWTON TRIAL
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Aug. 8 (AP)A mistrial was declared today in the manslaughter re trial of Huey P. Newton, a cofounder of the Black Pan ther party, after a jury re ported it had been unable to reach a verdict after six clays of deliberation.

title: 2 LATIN PRESIDENTS CHIDE U.S. ON COFFEE
description: LETICIA, Colombia, Aug. 8 The Presidents of Brazil and Colombia, which market about half the world's coffee, met in this frontier outpost beside the Amazon yesterday and criti cized United States coffee poli cies.

title: CONCERT DEBUT BY WILDER WINDS
description: Many instrumentalists now adays are able to shuttle back and forth between jazz and nonjazz musical styles with the greatest of ease, but composers do not fare so well. A fresh reminder of the truth of this was provided on Saturday night when a wind sextet called the Wilder Winds made its debut in Town Hall's Connoisseur series.

title: Playwrights Assay 4 Weeks at O'Neill Conference
description: WATERFORD, Conn., Aug. 8It had rained all week but the morning broke bright and clear and the young people lolled about on the grass like students on holi day.

title: Yanks Win 21, in Ninth;
description: Felipe Alou singled home the winning run in the ninth in ning, Steve Kline pitched a five hitter and Ralph Houk put on a managerial show that evoked. high praise from Earl Weaver as the Yankees edged Balti more, 21, yesterday.

title: Remington Arms Reports Profit Drop for First Half
description: The Remington Arms Com pany had a firsthalf profit of $6,011,000, or 80 cents a share, including a nonrecurring gain of $448,000, or 6 cents a share, the company reported over the weekend. In 1970's first six months the profit was $6,283, 000, or 83 cents a share.

title: Article 5  No Title
description: ISTANBUL, Aug. 8 (AP) the Nastase of Rumania beat Andrew. Pattision of South Africa, 64, 91, 64 today to win the men's singles title at the Istanbul international tournament.

title: 21 Die in Indian Bus Plunge
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 8 (AP) An Indian Army truck plunged into a river in northern Kash mir yesterday, and 21 soldiers were killed and eight others injured, the Kashmir police reported. The truck was on route from Srinagar to Jammu.

title: The Computer at Age 25
description: It is interesting that last week's Chicago celebration of the 25th anniversary of the building of the first elec tronic computer was confined virtually entirely to the industry itself. President Nixon was not moved to declare a national holiday; no brass bands marched through the streets, and the average citizen remained completely unaware of the anniversary. As for Drs. John W. Mauchly and J. Presper Eckert, the coinventors of ENIAC, the first electronic brain, their names are not likely ever to become household words on a par with the Wright brothers or Thomas A. Edison, let alone the Beatles.

title: Chess:
description: Ken Rogoff, 17 years old, of Rochester and Greg De Fotis, 19, of Chicago each scored 52 to tie for first place in the annual United States Junior Invitation Chess Championship, held re cently in Newburgh, N. Y.

title: Westmoreland Says Army Bears Brunt of Frustration
description: DALLAS, Aug. 8 (AP)  Gen. William C. Westmoreland, de fending the Army and its role in society, says the old Army often has to bear the brunt of national frustration.

title: GEORGE L. WEYLER, VICE ADMIRAL, 85
description: CORONADO, Calif., Aug. 8 (AP)Vice Adm. George Les ter Weyler, U.S.N. retired, whose ships scored a victory over the Japanese in World War II that was hailed as a turning point in the Pacific, died Friday. He was 85 years old.

title: Eastern Air Lines to Seek a Fare Increase
description: Eastern Air Lines, which with the other trunk carriers increased its fares by 6 per cent on May 1, intends to apply for another fare increase this fall.

title: Rosewall Wins U.S. Pro Tennis Final
description: CHESTNUT HILL, Mass., Aug. 8 (UPI)Ken Rosewall, the 36yearold Australian, put on a dazzling display of shot making today to down Cliff Drysdale of South Africa, 64, 63, 60, and win the $50,000 United States professional ten nis championship for the third time.

title: 6 CLASS SWEEPS IN BAY REGATTA
description: AMITYVILLE, L. I., Aug. 8 Six skippers completed four race sweeps in their classes as the Great South Bay Yacht Racing Association's annual race week championship regat ta ended today.

title: BRITAIN ZIGZAGS IN ECONOMIC ROLE
description: LONDON, Aug. 8The Con servative Government is follow ing a zigzag course in fulfilling its pledge to reduce Govern ment intervention in the British economy.

title: Economic Analysis
description: Can the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation make it over the long pull? Will a loan guarantee put the company back on a pathway to health or constitute a palliative that will simply pro long the patient's life a few years at most? The prevailing view, following the vote in Con gress authorizing guarantees of up to $250million in bank loans to Lockheed, is that the company will get a new lease on life that need have no time limit. Survival of the current crisis could mean that bankruptcy has been averted indefinitely.

title: BirthControl Lecture Case Is Weighed by Prosecutor
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. L, Aug. 8 The Suffolk County District Attorney, George J. Aspland, said today that his office would decide this week whether to prosecute a birthcontrol advo cate and a 28yearold mother who were arrested and charged with endangering the welfare of the woman's 14monthold daughter.

title: ANDRE L. BENEL, 81, OF BROWN, HARRIS
description: Andre L. Benel, a specialist in industrial real estate who retired several years ago as a vice president of Brown, Har ris, Stevens, Inc., died Friday at his home, 216 Manor Road, Douglaston Manor, Queens. His age was 81.

title: Patricia Samuels Wed
description: ROSLYN, L. I., Aug. 8 Miss Patricia Meri Samuels, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Samuel I. Samuels, was mar ried this afternoon to Jeffrey Sanders Muhlrad, son of Mr. and Mrs. Martin Muhlrad of Westbury. Rabbi Maurice Aranov performed the cere mony at the Samuels resi dence. The bride was gradu ated from Cornell. Her father is a certified public account ant. Mr. Muhlrad, an alumnus of Pennsylvania State Univer sity, attends the Boston Uni versity School of Medicine. His father is a lawyer in New York.

title: Bar Study Notes Little Court Disorder Despite Burger Views on Unruliness
description: BOSTON, Aug. 8A major survey of hundreds of the nation's general trial judges has produced little evidence of any widespread courtroom disruption by unruly lawyers.

title: A Monumental Undertaking
description: AUSTIN, Tex.As you whip along Interstate Highway 35 in Austin these days, you encounter a huge, brand new exit sign, A vast expanse of green that stretches across the freeway de clares: Lyndon B. Johnson Library Next Right. It is larger than the sign announcing the exit for the state capi tol.

title: 10 Senators Urge Granting Of Military Funds to Israel
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (AP) Ten members of the Senate Foreign Relations Committee urged the Nixon Administration today to grant Israel's request for $200million to meet urgent defense needs.

title: Arts Abroad
description: LONDONCultural institu tions, like others, have their phases of triumph and trial. Once of Britain's contemporary cultural monuments, the Na tioi]al Theater Company, now seems to be in the latter part or the cycle. There are rum blings of discontent, contro veisy, change. It should be said at once, for American readers, that the argument is about the high est levels of theat rical ambition and achievement. New York has nothing remotely to compare with this company, whatever its momentary problems. Nor, really, do most European Capitals.

title: Rabin Cautions U.S.
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 8 (AP)  Israel's Ambassador to the United States, Itzhak Rabin, cautioned the United States to day against overstepping its role as mediator by advocating a specific plan for an interim Middle Eastern accord.

title: Personal Finance: Hope for Consumers
description: This is the first in a series of articles analyzing consum er measures acted on during the last Legislative session. Today's article will discuss several consumer measures still under consideration.

title: Article 4  No Title
description: Al Doyle of New York, the No. 1seeded player, won the Brooklyn junior veterans tennis championship yesterday by de feating Winton Charlop of Brooklyn, the No. 2seeded player, 62, 60, at Hiway Ten nis Club in Brooklyn.

title: Dietz Takes U.S. Sculling Title
description: Jim Dietz of the New York Athletic Club, rowing into a slight wind, won the United States Elite singles champion ship at the 95th National As sociation of Amateur Oarsmen regatta yesterday on the Or chard Beach Lagoon.

title: U.S. Five Wins, 7876
description: MESSINA, Sicily, Aug. 8 (UPI)The Gillette allstars of the United States fought off rally by Rumania and took 7876 victory in the first game of a fournation basketball tournament. In another game, Poland downed the national B team from Italy, 6965.

title: Sudan Says 700 More Reds Are Arrested in New Roundup
description: KHARTOUM, the Sudan, Aug. 8 (AP)The Sudanese Govern ment has announced the arrest of 700 more people identified as members of the Communist party.

title: Six Hurt When L. L Yacht Explodes and Then Burns
description: MOUNT SINAI, L.I., Aug. 8 Six people were injured here early this morning when an ex plosion destroyed a 30foot cruiser.

title: The Talk of Clearfield, Pa.
description: CLEARFIELD, Pa., Aug. 8 The streets are not as crowded as they were, the bars are not as busy and, for the most part, people in this quiet little country town are going to bed early again.

title: Israel Is Said to Seek a StillUndeployed U.S. Missile
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8Is rael is urging the United States to sell her a new tactical field missile, the Lance, which has not yet been supplied to Amer ican Army units, according to Administration sources.

title: TWASKO DOMINANT AT JERSEY SHOW
description: READINGTON, N.J., Aug. 8 Charlie Twasko, a 23year old professional from New Hope, Pa., was the busiest and most successful rider at the Four Seasons Farm Horse Show today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Fire Bomb Hurled by Youth At Central Park Station
description: A Molotov cocktail exploded in the courtyard behind the Central Police Station at 86th Street late last night, the police said, but did not damage.

title: Schuman Awarded MacDowell Medal
description: PETERBOROUGH, N.H., Aug. 8 (AP)William Schuman, the composer and former president of the Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts in New York, was presented with the 12th Edward MacDowell Medal to day for exceptional contribu tions to the arts.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: State A.F.L.C.I.O. Is Opening Its 14th Convention Here Today
description: The political arm of the state A.F.L.C.I.O. criticized President Nixon yesterday for failing to solve two of the nation's major problemsinflation and high unemployment.

title: California Community Snaps Back but Still Bears Scars 6 Months After Quake
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 8The house the Humphreyses lived in, seemingly a total ruin after the Feb. 9 earthquake, is being re stored.

title: Books of The Times
description: THE RAFT OF THE MEDUSA. By Vercors. 185 Pages. McCall Books, $6.50.

title: 35 Reported Drowned in India
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 8 (Reuters) Thirtyfive persons were be lieved to have drowned after a boat capsized in a small river in northern Bihar state today, the news agency Press Trust of India reported. The agency said 25 people were rescued.

title: 5 Ocean Hill Principals Reported Ousted
description: The Brooklyn school board that governs Ocean Hill Brownsville has voted to dis miss five principals and to place four others on six months' probation, according to two of the board members.

title: Hoyt Predicted Log Victor
description: Dr. Anson Hoyt of Rumson, N. J., won the Captain Billop predicted log contest conducted by the Richmond County Yacht Club in Staten Island yesterday. Sailing aboard Swan Song, Hoyt triumphed with a per centage of error of 1.12. Ray Kirchmayer of Staten Island was second in ShangriLa with a 1.31 percentage of error and Hugh Alessandroni of Rumson, N. J., aboard Annina, was third with 1.71.

title: Lost Boy, 13, Is Found In California Mountains
description: SODA SPRINGS, Calif., Aug. 8 (UPI)A 13yearold mentally retarded boy, lost for five days in the rugged Sierra Mountains, was found safe today.

title: Complaints to S.E.C. Rise; Casey Wants Bigger Staff
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (UPI) The chairman of the Securi ties and Exchange Commission said today that the volume of investors' complaints about stockbrokers had jumped sharp ly in recent months.

title: Leary Extradition Sought
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8 (AP)  Extradition papers to have Dr. Timothy W. Leary returned to the United States have been forwarded to the American am bassador in Bern, Switzerland, the State Department said to day. The drug advocate was arrested by the Swiss police on June 30. The Swiss Government said he had been released on bail because no official request for extradition had been re ceived. Leary escaped from a California prison last Septem ber.

title: London House Fights Copyright of Solzhenitsyn's August 1914
description: The Flegon Press, a small London publishing house that specializes in manuscripts smuggled out of the Soviet Union, is attempting to chal lenge the authorized world rights to Aleksanur I. Solzhen itsyn's new novel, August 1914.

title: Leavens Is Retiring as Director Of Citizens Budget Commission
description: John M. Leavens, executive director of the Citizens Budget Commission since 1952, said yesterday that he would retire on Oct. 1 because, I have so many things I want to do.

title: Books of The Times
description: IBSEN. A Biography, By Michael Meyer. 865 pages. Illustrated. Doubleday. $12.95.

title: Expressway Holdup Site For Nappers
description: An offduty policeman and two other men taking naps in separate cars parked along side the Long Island Express way in Queens were accosted by two bandits within two hours early yesterday and robbed of $885 in cash and other valuables. The police man was pistolwhipped when he identified himself.

title: F.D.A. Assailed on Drugs
description: CONCORD, N. H., Aug. 8 (UPI)The Food and Drug Ad ministration is applying a dan gerous system of double stand ards in its dealings with the nation's drug companies, Sena tor Thomas J. McIntyre, Demo crat of New Hampshire, said today. Senator McIntyre said in a statement that, while the agency had rigorously enforced health and safety standards on small drug companies, it had been very lax with major ones.

title: Carousel Fashions Elects
description: Directors of Carousel Fash ions, Inc., have elected Walter P. Kuenstler as president, ef fective Aug. 16, to succeed Ted Bost, who will continue as a consultant until next May 1. Mr. Kuenstler was formerly president and chief executive officer of ReidMeredith, Inc.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Fairfield Polo Team Wins From Long Island by 10.6
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Aug. 8 The Fairfield County Hunt Club polo team posted a 106 vic tory over Long Island today and won the Michelob Cup.

title: Tokyo Before Peking
description: An extraordinary climate of mutual resentment seems to be building up in JapaneseAmerican relations in the wake of President Nixon's surprise announcement of his projected visit to Communist China.

title: WILDCAT STRIKE SET BY AN A.&P. LOCAL
description: Union officials said early to day they would back a wildcat strike of meatcutters and gro cery clerks scheduled for 8 A.M. today at 60 A. & P. super markets in Westchester, Put nam and Dutchess Counties.

title: ERNEST R. BIGGS
description: COLUMBUS, Ohio, Aug. 8 (AP)  Ernest R. Biggs, head athletic trainer at Ohio State University since 1942, died yes terday in a hospital here. He was 54 years old.

title: JUDGE IN LOUISIANA ORDERS VOTING PLAN
description: BATON ROUGE, La., Aug. 8 A Federal judge here has ap pointed a special master to do the job the Lotlisiana Legisl ture could not or would not perform and reapportion elec tion districts for legislative posts.

title: Canada Evicting Campers From Park Site
description: UCLUELET, British Columbia The hard gray sand around Wreck Bay stretches about a mile between rocky headlands on Vancouver Island. On a cliff stands a dense rain forest.

title: City Hail Notes
description: The Night Mayor the official a troubled New York er can contact when the regu lar city offices are closed for the eveningis a tapere corded voice these summer weekends. Hollowly, the voice tells the troubled caller the budgetary necessities have forced curtailment of the service, and suggests that if he is really trou bled he should dial 911, the Po lice emergency number.

title: Tobacco Strike Supported
description: WILSON, N.C., Aug. 8 (AP) More than 1,000 persons, led by top labor officials marched peacefully through this North Carolina town today to show their support for striking to bacco workers. The employes, members of the Tobacco Work ers International Union, are striking for higher pay against the Export. Leaf Tobacco Com pany.

title: Smith Captures Title
description: CINCINNATI, Aug. 8 (AP) Topseeded Stan Smith of Pasa dena, Calif., overpowered Juan Gisbert of Spain, 76, 63, to win the men's singles title to day in the $30,000 Western :tennis championships at the Cincinnati Tennis Club.

title: Danbury Hunger Strikers Moved to Prison Hospital
description: DANBURY, Conn., Aug. 8 (AP)Five Federal prison in mates were transferred to the prison hospital over the week end as they continued a hunger strike in support of two im prisoned antiwar priests, the Revs. Philip and Daniel Berri gan.

title: Shlomit Miron Married Here
description: Miss Shlomit Miron, daugh ter of Mr. and Mrs. Issachar Miron of New York, was married here yesterday after noon to Dr. Steven Lee Sho lem, son of Mrs. Philip Vogel man of New York and Lee T. Sholem of Los Angeles. Rab bi Avraham Soltes performed the ceremony at the Biltmore.

title: Advertising:
description: The United States Postal Service announced the win ners of the quest for its advertising account last Friday (just as private companies are wont to do).

title: Braves Stop Mets, 50
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 8  The New York Mets, who got 21 hits and 20 runs last night, did absolutely nothing for an en core today and the chief rea son was Phil Niekro's knuckle ball.

title: Scene: Dawn at Hospital Again
description: Below, on Park Avenue, the only move ment occurred when traffic lights changed in the morning darkness of the empty streets.

title: Week's Votes in Congress
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8  Following are the votes of dele gations from New York, New Jersey and Connecticut on the major roll calls in Congress during the week ended yester day.

title: Namath Undergoes Surgery; Future in Football Uncertain
description: Joe Namath underwent knee surgery yesterday for the fourth time, clouding his fu ture with the New York Jets.

title: EDW ARD MORRIS, 76, A CONCERT PIANIST
description: SCHENECTADY, N. Y., Aug. 8 (AP)Edward Morris, a con cert pianist who appeared as soloist with the Boston Sym phony at the age of 17, died last night at a hospital in Glen ville, near his home here. He was 76 years old.

title: WILLIAM H. OGSBURY
description: DURHAM, N.C., Aug. 8 (AP) William Henry Ogsbury, for many years an official of the American Tobacco Company, died here yesterday at the age of 86. At his retirement in 1956, Mr. Ogsbury was in charge of manufacturing and assistant to the vice president of American Tobacco.

title: GREEK PRESS VOWS TO FIGHT NEW CODE
description: ATHENS, Aug. 8Greek pub lishers and newsmen told the Government today that its pro posed bill enforcing a code of ethics on journalists was un constitutional and that they would fight it.

title: Fischer Munches a Bagel and Finds 11 Chess Rivals a Piece of Cake
description: Bobby Fischer, America's chess wonder, diffidently de molished 11 grandmasters and masters in a rapidfire tournament yesterday at the Manhattan Chess Club.

title: WAVE OF SELLING JOLTS EUROBONDS
description: BRUSSELS, Aug. 7Europe's latest monetary problems caught the international bond market slam amidshipsprices in the secondary sector plunged just as the newissue calendar for dollar debt ballooned.

title: ATHEISM DEBATED IN SOVIET JOURNAL
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 8An un usual debate has broken out between believers and non believers on the pages of the Soviet Union's leading atheist journal. It is one of the rare occasions when believers have been able to explain their views in official publications.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Americans Now Favor A National Health Plan
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8  Subtly but unmistakably, Amer icans from all strata of society and all economic classes are swinging over to the idea that good health care, like a good education, ought to be a funda mental right of citizenship.

title: Mixed Prospects Confront CreditMarket Operations
description: Making their judgments largely by the volume of bonds to be sold, corporate bond deal ers are optimistic that last week's advance in prices will continue this week. Municipal bond dealers, who face a heavy schedule of sales, are not so bullish.

title: Sadat Presses for Solution To Suez Crisis by 1972
description: CAIRO, Aug. 8 (Reuters) Egypt reaffirmed today her readiness to reopen the Suez Canal as part of a Middle East settlement and said that a set tlement must be reached by the end of the year.

title: House Panel Finds Corruption In Marine Procurement Office
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8The investigating subcommittee of the House Armed Services Com mittee said today that it had found petty corruption in low places within the Marine Corps procurement office.

title: TWO PARTIES EQUAL IN A POLL ON PEACE
description: PRINCETON, N. J., Aug. 8 The Democratic party has drawn even with the Republi cans as the party that voters think is more likely to keep the United States out of a third world war, after lagging behind in this respect for the last five and onehalf years, according to the Gallop Poll.

title: Roundup: Dodgers Defeat Cards
description: Jim Lefebvre says he knows lie has been labeled a utility player but he tries never to think of himself that way. But that's my role on this club and I've learned to ac cept it, lie said.

title: Homer, Country Music Singer And Partner of Jethro, Is Dead
description: LANSING, Ill., Aug. 8 (UPI) Henry D. Haynes, known to two generations of country music fans as Homer of the Homer and Jethro singing and comedy team, died yesterday, apparently of a heart attack, at his home here. He was 51 years old.

title: In Set's Saratoga Fiesta Transforms Spa to Spainin the Name of Culture
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Aug. 8There is a dimly lit tavern not far from the Prado In old Madrid that well could have been the inspiration for last night's sparkling fiesta benefiting the educational program of the Saratoga Per forming Arts Center.

title: Drive to Enroll Young Voters Lags in Westchester
description: WHITE PLAINS, Aug. 8 After more than half a year of controversy, Westchester's County Board of Elections this week will begin sending hun dreds of volunteers to town and city halls throughout the county to register 18to21 yearold voters.

title: BRITISH SOLDIER SLAIN IN BELFAST
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Monday, Aug. 9 (Reuters)A British soldier died in hospital early today after being shot in the head during fierce rioting last night.

title: ASTRONAUTS FLY TO TEXAS BEARING MOON ROCK CARGO
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 8The tri umphant astronauts of Apollo 15 came home to Houston to night, bearing most of the sci entific treasures that have moved some of the oldtimers at the space agency to call the 12day voyage of lunar ex ploration one of the greatest expeditions of all time.

title: Rains Ease YearLong Texas Drought
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 8  Heavy rains in most of Texas during the last two weeks have eased if not ended a severe year long drought that has caused farm damage estimated at more than $500million.

title: Article 7  No Title
description: DUBLIN, Aug. 8British and German riders took all the ma jor honors in the Dublin hone show that ended today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: ProKy Newspaper Blames Thieu for Confiscations
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 8Late each afternoon recently South Vietnamese po licemen have arrived at the central newspaper distributing market to confiscate the daily Lap Truong.

title: U.S. Sees Issue of Taipei In U.N. as a CliffHanger
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8Au thoritative officials in the Nixon Administration said today that American efforts to prevent the expulsion of Nationalist China from the United Nations this fall might end in failure.

title: MISS BLALOCK 214 TAKES PEPSI GOLF
description: ATLANTA, Aug. 8 (AP) Jane Blalock, the winner last year, tapped in a threefoot putt on the final hole today to win the $20,000 Lady Pepsi Open. In doing so, she survived a closing 8underpar 65 by Mrs. Joanne Carner.

title: The New Jesuits
description: Peter O'Brien is the manager of jazz pianist Mary Lou Williams. Ken Feit took the clown course at Barnum & Bailey's circus school in Florida. Dan Berrigan was one of nine actors in protest play, wrote The Trial of the Catonsville 9, and is now writing poetry in a Federal prison.

title: Cambodians in Battle
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Aug. 8 (AP)  Three Cambodian soldiers were reported killed and 29 wounded in a battle today that included Govern ment naval gunboats and dive bombers along with the infan try.

title: Readers Protest Cut in Library Hours
description: The New York Public Li brary is being flooded by let ters and telephone calls from people protesting the recent curtailment of hours that a $1million reduction in funds forced it to make.

title: New Fashions Mother Is Not Ready forYet
description: They wear clingy sweat ers and chunky pants to work. They think it's a crime to spend a fortune on clothes. They're fashion designers to the blue jean generation. They have something else in common, too they worry about what their mothers should wear.

title: International Loans Listed for Week
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 8The following is a list of loans and other aid extended last week by United States and other international lending agencies here:

title: 5 PACIFIC STATES SEEK OWN COURSE
description: WELLINGTON, New Zealand, Aug. 7The emerging island states of the South Pacific are asserting a new collective voice in international affairs.

title: Sisco Is Reported to Suggest 2Phased Israeli Withdrawal
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 8 The of ficial news blackout on the recent talks with Joseph J. Sisco, United States. Assistant Secretary of State for Near Eastern and South. Asian Af fairs, has been maintained here, but two Israeli newspapers this morning published what were purported to be details of sug gestions brought up for discus sion by him.

title: City of London Eyes Common Market Role
description: LONDON, Aug. 8  Other centers are trying for it Frankfurt, Paris, Zurich, even Brusselsbut for expertise and inventiveness in offering fi nancial services, no city in Europe can quite match the square mile of the City of London.

title: Vatican Finds Big Increase in Priests Who Quit
description: ROME, Aug. 8The first ma jor study by the Vatican on priests who leave the priesthood says that a growing number are abandoning their ministries and that the celibacy require ment is the primary reason.

title: Ghana Bus Crash Kills 16
description: ACCRA, Ghana, Aug. 8 (Reu ters)  Sixteen persons were killed when a bus and a truck collided on the AccraCape Coast Road in central Ghana yesterday, the police reported today. Eighteen others were injured, three seriously.

title: A Caribbean Union Considered Again
description: BRIDGETOWN, Barbados, Aug. 9 (Reuters)Nearly 10 years after the collapse of a short lived attempt at federation, the small nations and territories of the Caribbean region are again looking at the possibility of po litical union.

title: Senator Buckley to Speak
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (UPI) Senator James L. Buck ley, ConservativeRepublican of New York, will speak on Sept. 3 at the Young Americans for Freedom national convention in Houston, the group announced today.

title: COMMODITY PRICES LISTED FOR WEEK
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9The Bureau of Labor Statistics re ported today the following spot primary prices for the week ended Aug. 3.

title: Campaign Notes
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 Senator Edmund S. Muskie of Maine has decided to be come a fulltime, unan nounced candidate for the Democratic Presidential nom ination.

title: Freehold's Opener Is Marked by Jazz And Kennedy Coins
description: FREEHOLD, N. J., Aug. 9 Freehold Raceway, founded in 1853, opened a 98matinee meeting today, offering 39 bet ting opportunities on an 11race card; Kennedy halfdollar pieces to those whose collections in cluded silver breakage, and Dixieland music by Jim Weichs Jazz Band.

title: HARRIMAN ASSAILS NIXON ON ARMS RACE
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9W. Averell Harriman told a Con gressional subcommittee today that the Nixon Administration's performance in slowing down the arms race had not Meas ured up to the President's promise.

title: Official Transcript of the WideRanging Interview With Premier Chou in Peking
description: PEKING, Aug. 9Following is a transcript of a recorded interview with Premier Chou Enlai of China conducted Thursday night by James Reston, vice president and columnist of The New York Times. The conversation, took place in Mr. Chou's reception hall here, and the translator was Chi Chaochu, a former Harvard student who is on the Premier's staff. Mr. Chou authorized the official transcript on the condition that both questions and answers be printed verbatim.

title: Pakistan Says Indian Shells Killed 20 in a 9Day Period
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Aug. 9 Twenty people were killed and several were wounded as a result of shelling by Indians in border areas of East Pakistan between July 29 and Aug. 6, it was officially announced today in Rawalpindi.

title: TWO HURT IN FLEEING A BURNING JETLINER
description: Two persons suffered minor injuries early yesterday morn ing while being evacuated from a chartered British jetliner at Kennedy International Airport. They were among 190 passeng ers who escaped from the Boe ing 707 via pneumatic chutes after flames erupted in the plane's landing gear while it was taxiing.

title: Concern in Washington
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9The United States has expressed to Pakistan concern over the pos sible effects that any summary, action against Sheik Mujib might have on the prospects for peace in East Pakistan, the State Department said today.

title: PARKER AND DAVIS GET 4 HITS EACH
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 9 (UPI) Wes Parker and Willie Davis had four hits each tonight to lead the Los Angeles Dodgers to a 65 triumph over the St. Louis Cardinals.

title: Man Held in Rape of Girl Charged in Second Case
description: A 24yearold man waiting to be arraigned yesterday for the rape of a 10yearold girl in Central Park was identified and charged also with the rape of a young secretary who was in the courtroom to view various prisoners.

title: IN THE NATION
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9Slowly and it may be hoped surely the American political process is being prized open to more control, or at least scrutiny, by the people for whom it is supposed to work. Party reforms, state and Fed eral legislation all are making at least an effort to turn some public light on entrenched politics and politicians.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: BASES IN LEBANON RAIDED BY ISRAEL
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 9 (AP) Israeli forces drove four miles into Lebanon today and attacked two Palestinian guer rilla bases in a battle that lasted six hours, it was reported here.

title: JUDGE STEPS DOWN IN SOLEDAD TRIAL
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 9 The murder trial of the three black prisoners known as the Soledad Brothers, who are ac cused of killing a white guard, was postponed today when the judge was unexpectedly dis qualified.

title: Anthony A. Maisano, 71, Dies; Led Labor Relations Institute
description: Anthony A. Maisano, director of the Edward Corsi Labor Management Institute of Pace College, who had long been ac tive in ItalianAmerican circles, labor relations and Republican politics, died of a heart at tack Saturday in Columbus Hos pital. He was 71 years old and lived at 315 Washington Ave nue, Brooklyn.

title: Chu Chu Wins Split DecisionBy a Hair
description: By the width of one of his curly locks, Chu Chu Malave of the East Village gained a split decision last night over Harold Weston Jr., who was so sur prised that he fell to the Madi son Square Garden canvas.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Books of The Times
description: USHANT. An Essay. By Conrad Aiken. 365 pages. Oxford. $9.50.

title: Dr. Joseph M. Feld, Teacher Of Math at Queens College
description: Dr. Joseph M. Feld, who re tired last September as profes sor of mathematics at Queens College, died Thursday of a heart attack in Munich, Ger many, while on a trip abroad. He was 71 years old and lived at 14307 Sanford Avenue, Flushing, Queens.

title: On the Road at 73With Her Horne in Tow
description: FORESTVILLE, Calif.Mrs. Denzel West does not believe in growing old gracefully. In fact, she does not think much of growing old at all.

title: CUBANS INTERRUPT AIRLIFT TO MIAMI
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 Cuba interrupted the twice daily airlift of Cuban refugees from Varadero to Miami today on the ground of administrative delays in the joint processing of names.

title: Alaskan Land Study Planned
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (UN) Representative John H. Terry, Republican of upstate New York, announced today that he would tour parts of Alaska in late August to study problems of proposed land claims settle ments.

title: NEW LOAN SOUGHT BY CONTROL DATA
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., Aug. 9The Control Data Corpora tion, which has encountered seri ous problems in its computer business in the last two years, is negotiating a $225million re volving credit agreement with a group of 14 banks headed by the Chase Manhattan Bank in New York.

title: 3 ARE FOUND DEAD IN BROOKLYN FIRE
description: Three persons were found dead after a fire of suspicious origin raced through a four story building in the Browns ville section of Brooklyn last night.

title: HARTFORD HEARS TAXPAYER VIEWS
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 9  About 400 men and women crowded into Connecticut's ornate Capi tol today for another chance to speak before the General Assembly decides whether to repeal the recently enacted state income tax.

title: Corona in Hospital Again
description: YUBA CITY, Calif., Aug. 9 (AP)Juan Corona, the farm labor contractor accused of hacking 25 fruit workers to death, has been hospitalized again after complaining of chest pains. A spokesman at the Yuba County jail said today that Mr. Corona would probably not be returned to his cell for at least three weeks.

title: Bernstein and Handel Works Begin a Month of Rehearsals
description: Leonard Bernstein took a spoonful of baby food (Ger ber's Applesauce) to sustain his strength and explained wearily that his new mass has nothing to do with a rock mass, or a hippie mass, or a Missa Solemnis or what ever else you've heard about it. It's a work without a precedenta pure theater piece that could not conceiva bly be done in a concert hall. Mr. Bernstein was sitting at a table in the fourthfloor ballroom of the Riverside Plaza Hotel here with half a dozen lieutenants on the first day of rehearsals for the mass. The work will official ly open the John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts in Washington on Sept. 8 (after previews on the 6th and 7th).

title: New Burroughs Computers
description: The Burroughs Corporation announced yesterday in Detroit two additional computer models in the B 6700 series, with de liveries of the B 6711 and B 6721 computers to begin next June. The company said the two would have monthly lease rates as low as $18,000.

title: Marriages
description: RIEMERFLANAGANGeorge and Margaret on August 6, 1971.

title: DR. ROBINSON H. DORION
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Aug. 9 Dr. Robinson H. Dorion, former president of the medical staff of Stamford Hospital, died Sat urday of a heart attack while swimming in a neighbor's pool. He was 63 years old and lived at 151 Westover Road.

title: L. B. J. and the Commitment Myth
description: WASHINGTONThere are myths on which the Pentagon Papers shed no light that need to be dispelled since they were important factors in mobi lizing public opinion in support of our war policy. The principal myth is that the United States had commitments to intervene militarily in. Vietnam.

title: DR. SAMUEL KORRY
description: Dr. Samuel Korry, a founder of the American College of Cardiology, died Sunday at Mount Sinai Hospital after long illness. He was 76 years old and lived at 242 West 19th Street.

title: L.I. School to Teach 21st Century Medicine
description: STONY BROOK, L. I., Aug. 9  A new public medical school that promises a revo lutionary approach to teach ingthe first to be started from scratch in New York State  welcomed its first class of 24 students today.

title: DENNISON BACKS 2 MORAL ARRESTS
description: HUNTINGTON, L. I., Aug. 9 6Suffolk County Executive H. Lee Dennison summoned Po lice Commissioner John L. Barry to his offices today to explain the arrest Friday of a birthcontrol advocate and a 28yearold mother at a birth control information meeting.

title: Escaped Mental Patient Seized in Attack on 2 Girls
description: EDGEWATER, N.J., Aug. 9 (AP)A man who had escaped from a Queens mental institu tion allegedly attacked two 14 yearold girls today after he picked them up as they hitch hiked along River Road in this Bergen County community, the police said. Ahalfanhour earlier the police had warned the girls against hitchhiking.

title: EASING WAS VOTED IN MONEY SUPPLY
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (Reu ters)The Federal Reserve's Open Market Committee voted unanimously to moderate growth in the money supply and credit aggregates at its May 11 meeting, the Reserve reported today.

title: Wood, Field and Stream
description: WEST TISBURY, Mass. When you introduce a scholar to the delights of fishing, be prepared for a quick reversal of the pupilteacher relation ship.

title: Flor de Sombra, Paying $77.40, Takes Handicap as Monmouth Meeting Ends
description: OCEANPORT, N. J., Aug. (UPI)Flor de Sombre, the longest shot in the field at 381, closed with a rush today and captured the $28,875 Eatontown Handicap as Monmouth Park closed out a 60day meeting.

title: Soviet Frees Marchenko, PrisonCamp Author
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 9Anatoly T. Marchenko, whose first hand account of the life of Soviet political prisoners was published abroad in 1970, has been released after serving out his latest prisoncamp term, re liable sources said today.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: WOODALL CERTAIN RE CAN FILL ROLE
description: HEMPSTEAD, L. I., Aug. 9 On the Jets' practice field today a voice yelled, hey, Joe.

title: Continental Phone Up
description: The Continental Telephone Corporation yesterday reported record highs in revenues and sales and net income for the first half.

title: Soviet Vandalism Protested
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (AP) The State Department pro tested today to the Soviet Em bassy and to the Foreign Min istry in Moscow for what was considered a very serious at tack on automobiles belong ing to two American diplomats in Moscow. There were indica tions that the attack on the two embassy cars had been in re taliation for a fire bomb di rected at a Soviet diplomat's automobile on Long Island on July 25.

title: OCEAN HILL FACES SCHOOL BOYCOTTS
description: Parents organizations in two schools in the Ocean Hill Brownsville area warned yes terday of possible boycotts next month to protest the ouster of their principals by Community School Board 23.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
PAINE, WEBBER PLANS OFFERING TO PUBLIC
description: Paine, Webber, Jackson & Curtis, Inc., a major Wall Street brokerage house, announced yesterday that directors had approved plans to offer stock to the public.

title: Pnompenh Blast Kills 4 In 2d Explosion in 2 Days
description: PNOMPENH, Cambodia, Aug. 9 (AP)  A bomb blast ripped through downtown Pnompenh this afternoon, killing three children and a 20yearold woman, as the capital was rocked by explosions for the second day.

title: U.S. EXPLAINS HELP FOR THAIS IN LAOS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (AP) The State Department today explained United States support of Thai soldiers in Laos, whom it termed volunteers.

title: JR. WIGHTMAN TENNIS
description: SinglesLisa Biscow, W.C., defeated Deb bie Disco, L.I. 16, 63, 64; Therese Sullivan, L.I., defeated Virginia Lumsden, W.C., 6.2, 6.0; Diane Liebenson, W.C., defeated Linda Slegeiman, L.I., 61, 62; Mary Carllio, L.I., defeated Cindy Strand burg, W.C., 3.6, 64, 64; Sue Williams, W.C., defeated Vicki Abels, L.I., 62, 61; Marilyn Engle, W.C., defeated Barbie Miller, L.I., 62, 63.

title: SCOTT INJURED FINGERS ON MOON
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 9  Col. David R. Scott, the commander of Apollo 15, ruptured blood vessels under four fingernails during his first day's explora tion of the moon on July 31, causing him to suffer consider able pain for a time, the astronauts' physician reported today.

title: Bronx Woman Arrested In Shooting of 11YearOld
description: A 33yearold woman was ar rested yesterday and charged with shooting an 11yearold boy who was playing in front of her home in the Bronx.

title: Chou Enlai Speaks
description: Even a preliminary study of the wideranging inter view Premier Chou Enlai gave James Reston makes plain that the Chinese leader is anxious to present him self as a reasonable manone with whom negotiations could be fruitfulalthough publicly he is not retreating a single step from his country's longheld positions. It is hard to read the interview without suspecting that there is more flexibility in Peking's position than is conveyed by its propaganda slogans. Such hints, of course, can only encourage President Nixon as he prepares for his historic negotiations.

title: MISS ROST RIDES PAIR OF SUSSEX VICTORS
description: BRANCHVILLE, N. J., Aug. 9 Robin Rost, who lives just across the street from the arena, scored an unusual double today at the opening of the sixday Sussex County horse show.

title: McCloskey Opens His Office in New Hampshire
description: CONCORD, N. H., Aug. 9 (AP)Representative Paul N. McCloskey Jr., Republican of California, opened his Presi dential campaign headquar ters today and said President Nixon could end the Indo china war within three days by ac cepting a single prin ciple.

title: Backpackers Find Wilderness Trails Are Becoming Crowded
description: KINGS CANYON NATION AL PARK, Calif. When Rick Romans was 5 years old, he pointed of a sky full of stars and said, Look at all the satellites.

title: 3 LONDON EDITORS FREE IN SMUT CASE
description: LONDON, Aug. 9  Amid mounting public protest, three undergroundnewspaper editors who are charged with obscenity were released on $240 bail each today pending an appeal over sentences ranging from 9 to 15 months of prison.

title: Mauritania Renames Chief
description: NOUAKCHOTT, Mauritania, Aug. 9 (Agence FrancePresse) Moktar Ould Daddah, who has been President of this West African country since shortly after it became independent of France in 1960, was reelected yesterday for a third fiveyear term with a majority of more than 99 per cent, incomplete results indicated today.

title: LEONARD M. HICKS
description: Leonard M. Hicks, an actor, died of cancer here on Sunday. He was 53 years old and lived at 83 Second Avenue.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: PourWeek Phone Strike Here Creates Delays in Installations
description: The four  week strike by plant employes of the New York Telephone Company has created a backlog of installa tion orders in the city's five boroughs, a spokesman for the company said yesterday.

title: 3 Moon Stations Sending Back Data
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 9  In a small science support room tucked away in a corner of the Manned Spacecraft Center's Building 30, 40 automatic pens quiver nervously as endless rolls of paper glide by under neath.

title: Labor Delegates Weigh Sun Tans and Problems
description: Complimeneting each other on their sun tans and swap ping stories of their vacations and grandchildren, 1,300 delegates (blue name tags), 400 alternates (red tags) and assorted guests (purple tags) kept up a steady murmur yesterday as a litany of woes confronting labor was re cited from the dais of the grand ballroom of the New York Hilton by the executive council of the New York State A.F.L.C.I.O. (gold tags).

title: BIG BOARD REPORTS FAKE CERTIFICATES
description: The New York Stock Ex change has reported the ap pearance of counterfeit certif icates for various issues of the American Telephone and Tele graph Company, the General Electric Company, Pan Amer ican World Airways, Inc., and the Chrysler Corporation.

title: Transit Cooling Here Is Still in Future
