description: Transit leaders have high, but guarded, hopes of making vast improvements in airconditioned service on city and commuter transportation lines in the next few years. But for this summer, the ride to and from work in the city remains a hot, humid and enervating experience for most people.

title: Israel Acts on M.D.'s Strike
description: TEL AVIV, Aug. 9Premier Golda Meir signed an emer gency regulation today threat ening striking doctors with im prisonment or fines unless they returned to work in Govern ment hospitals and clinics to morrow morning. A spokesman for the doctors said they would comply under protest. They want recognition as a union independent of the civil ser vants union and new fringe benefits.

title: CITY SCANS REPORT OF RELIEF ABUSES
description: The city's Department of Social Services, cautioning that black and poor families were consistently undercounted by the Federal Census, promised a careful review yesterday of a study that estimated there were 60,000 more black family members on welfare here in 1969 than were indicated eligible by incomes.

title: Mistrial Ruled in L.I. Case Against 4 in '69 Burglary
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., Aug. 9 (UPI)The prosecution won a motion for a mistrial today in a case involving the $126,000 burglary of the E. J. Korvette department store in Huntington Station, L. I., in 1969.

title: New Vacuum Cleaners Help City Clean Up Bryant Park
description: Using two noisy, $400 vacu um cleaners donated by the Avenue of the Americas Asso ciation, the city's Parks De partment began yesterday an intensive, twoday effort to clean up litterstrewn Bryant Park, between 40th and 42d Streets.

title: OTB Extends Deadline For Doable at Saratoga
description: A new deadline of noon for daily double wagering at all offtrack betting offices serviced by Computer Sci ences Corporation will begin today.

title: Mrs. Johnstone's 73 Paces Jersey Amateur Qualifiers
description: WEST CALDWELL, N. J., Aug. 9Mrs. David Johnstone of Montclair fired a twounder par 73 today to lead the quali fiers for the 46th New Jersey women's amateur champion ship at the Mountain Ridge Country Club. Fifteen of the 89 golfers qualified over the 5,861 yard course. Mrs. A. Sherburne Hart of Baltusrol, the defend ing champion, automatically qualified.

title: EMMA B. BREHM
description: Emma B. Brehm, former pres ident of the Municipal Bond Women's Club of New York, who was associated with R. W. Pressprich & Co., died here Sun day. She was 65 years old and lived at 150 East 37th Street.

title: Koosman Reactivated
description: Jerry Koosman, who hasn't pitched in five weeks, was re stored to active duty by the New York Mets yesterday as they headed for the West Coast for the nine games that could decide their chances for 1971.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Globe Life Plans Offering
description: The Globe Life and Accident Insurance Company intends shortly to register with the Securities and Exhange Com mission 375,000 shares of com mon stock to be disposed of by existing holders, financial sources said yesterday. Officials of the Oklahoma Citybased concern declined comment on the reports.

title: Office Thefts Fall; Security Is Credited
description: Stringent security measures in office buildings here have diminished thefts, burglaries and robberies to the point where, for the first time in several years, the cost of in surance will not go up this fall in New York State.

title: Rockefeller Rejects Escapee's Plea for Freedom
description: A clemency plea by a Brook lynborn man who faces 50 years in prison in Louisana for selling a matchbox worth or marijuana has been turned down by Governor Rockefel ler's office, his lawyer said yes terday.

title: AUSTIN F. DOHRMAN
description: CRANFORD, N.J., Aug. 9 Austin F. Dohrman of 8 River side Drive, a former official of the Anaconda Sales Company, subsidiary of the Anaconda Company, died yesterday at a nursing home. His age was 89.

title: CHOU SUGGESTS VISIT BY 4 U.S. SCHOLARS
description: During his conversation with James Reston, Premier Chou Enlai said Peking would welcome visits from four specialists in Chinese affairs The four have in common per sonal histories marked by ac cusations of disloyalty during the McCarthy era that were found to be groundless.

title: Coast Guard Recovers a Yacht And Seizes 3 After Sea Chase
description: HONOLULU, Aug. 9 (UPI) Three gunmen surrendered meekly today to a Coast Guard boarding party that recovered the pirated yacht Kamalii after a high seas chase 250 miles southwest of Honolulu.

title: Year's Residency to Get State Welfare Ruled Unconstitutional by U.S. Court
description: With only four minutes' de liberation after the oral argu ments, a threejudge Federal court in Buffalo yesterday ruled as unconstitutional New York State's new oneyear residency requirement for welfare recipi ents.

title: Looking Back, Paige Says He's Proud
description: COOPERSTOWN, N. Y., Aug. 9I am the proudest man on the earth today, and my wife and sister and sisterinlaw and my son all feel the same. It's a wonderful day and one man who appreciates it is Leroy Satchel Paige.

title: Onassis Wedding Enlivens Coast Social Life
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 9 The recent wedding of Miss Christina Onassis to Joseph Bolker, Southern California millionaire home builder and real estate man, appears to have enraptured Los Angeles society even though the Greek newspaper Eleftheros Kosmos reports that it hasn't gone over so big with Aris totle S. Onassis, the father of the bride.

title: STOCK PRICES SAC IN SLOW TRADING
description: The dog days of summer have apparently arrived as prices sagged for almost all groups yesterday in the slow est trading on the New York Stock Exchange since Aug. 17 of last year.

title: Top Physicist Back in China
description: HONG KONG, Tuesday, Aug. 10 (UPI)China confirmed to day that a ChineseAmerican physicist, a Nobel prize winner, is now in Peking. Hsinhua, the Chinese press agency, reported, that the physicist, Dr. Yang Chenning, returned to Shang hai in late July to visit his ail ing father. He now is paying a visit to Peking. Dr. Yang is Albert Einstein Professor of Physics at New York State Uni versity, Stoneybrook, L.I.

title: Wide Range of Reaction
description: LONDON, Aug. 9Reaction to the internment announce ment by Prime Minister Brian Faulkner ranged from anger to muted approval here.

title: Stamp Design of Whaler Criticized
description: The whaling ship Charles W. Morgan, a national his toric landmark berthed at a seaport museum in Mystic, Conn., may appear on a Unit ed States postage stamp with one of its long boats missing. The design for the stamp was unveiled at Mystic last Fri day, and immediately there was criticism of the design done by Melboune Brindle, the artist.

title: Advertising:
description: If an ad campaign is suc cessful when it sells the prod uct, then a recruiting cam paigin should be considered a winner if it stimulates more volunteers. And that's just what N. W. Ayer & Son be lieves it achieved with its shortlived $10million radio and TV campaign for the Army.

title: RECORD FIELD OF 393 IN U.S. OPEN CHESS
description: VENTURA, Calif., Aug. 9 The 72d United States open chess tournament began here last night, with 398 entrants, a record field.

title: Soviet Lofts Cosmos 433
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 9 (UPI) The Soviet Union has launched another unmanned Cosmos satellite Into eggshaped earth orbit, Tass, the Soviet press agency, said today. Tass said that Cosmos 433 carries sci entific instruments for space exploration.

title: National Bank Blocks Use of Francs Gained Front U.S. Funds
description: GENEVA, Aug. 9The Swiss National Bank moved today to stern a speculative flow of dol lars into Switzerland that bankers attributed to the call by a United States Congres sional subcommittee for a de valuation of the dollar.

title: Wage Costs at Issue
description: The traffic executives of the nation's railroads are scheduled to meet in Chicago tomorrow to determine what additional revenues they need to help off set the cost of the settlement last week of the United Trans portation Union's selective strike over work rules.

title: Kings Point Launches Its Social Season
description: KINGS POINT, L. I. Aug. 9The tem perature was a sweltering 90 degrees at the nonairconditioned United States Merchant Marine Academy here yester day afternoon, but that didn't keep the girls away.

title: MRS. KAJ VELDEN, 52, A FASHION DESIGNER
description: Mrs. Inge Jesperson Velden, a fashion designer, was drowned Saturday in Dering Harbor, L. I. She was 52 years old and lived at 114 East 71st Street and at Shelter Island Heights, L. I.

title: Six Months Also Off
description: Sales and earnings of the United Aircraft Corporation in the second quarter declined due to production and devel opment problems on two new engines being introduced into production, the company re ported yesterday.

title: Saint Laurent Revising Way He'll Show and Sell Couture
description: Yves Saint Laurent, one of the major French fashion houses, announced yesterday that its semiannual couture collections will be severely curtailed, rescheduled and available only to private clients. There will be no fur ther designs available for lineforline copying or cou ture clothes sold to stores.

title: Practicality of FreeFare Plan Doubted by Some M.T.A. Aides
description: Several directors of the Met ropolitan Transportation Auth ority expressed doubts yester day about the practicality of the proposal by Bronx Borough President Robert Abrams for free transit rides subsidized by taxes on city residents and corporations.

title: FRANCE TRUMPETS MONETARY VICTORY
description: PARIS, Aug. 9In fullpage newspaper advertisements, the French Government trumpeted a monetary victory today to a country on vacation and par ticularly receptive to good news.

title: End of Neutrality Seen
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 9The So viet Union's decision to lend official support to India in her current crisis with Pakistan appeared to diplomats today to mark the end of Moscow's am biguously neutral role in the Indian subcontinent.

title: Market Place: Little Guy Talks in Coast Survey
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 9 In this beautiful playland far from the bustle of Wall Street, feelings about higher commissions for the little guy run just as strong as they do in New York.

title: Modern Museum Gets Strike Threats
description: Two strike threats were is sued to the administration of the financially troubled Muse um of Modern Art yesterday by a newly formed union that was reacting to dismissal no tices served last week on 15 of its members.

title: Plan for Free Buses Languishes in London
description: Free travel plans for mil lions of subway and bus rid ers in London was proposed last October in an official re port.

title: Furniss Outswims Heckl For PanAm Gold Medal
description: CALI, Columbia, Aug. 9 The lights Went out at the PanAmerican Sports Center swimming pool tonight, but they failed to cut off the steady flow of gold medals by the United States' second string.

title: Student Sells $1Million of Magazine Subscriptions
description: DETROIT, Aug. 9As far as appearances go, there isn't much to distinguish Shri Kumar Poddar from the other Indian students attending Michigan State University in East Lansing. Even the Nehru jacket that the short 31year old Calcuttaborn doctoral student occasionally wears gives him no claim to distinc tion these days among M.S.U.'s cosmopolitan, wear yourownthing student body, Yet Mr. Poddar, the son of a Calcutta oil distributor for the Shell Oil Company, is easily the most outstanding student at the university for, since 1968, he has been grossing more than $1mil lion a year selling magazine subcriptions.

title: He Denies Club Contention He Has Retired
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 9In what is apparently a major contract dispute, Fran Tarkenton left the New York Giants today, but in sisted last night at his home in Atlanta that he still wanted to play for the team if things work out..

title: Red Sox Beat. Tigers, 1211, on Run in 9th;
description: BOSTON, Aug. 9 (UPI)Rico Petrocelli's pinchsingle with two out in the ninth drove in John Kennedy with the winning run to give the Boston Red Sox a 1211 victory today over the Detroit Tigers.

title: POWER SHORTAGE STALLS IRT LINE
description: A power shortage forced the Transit Authority to suspend subway service on the IRT local line from 137th Street in Manhattan to the terminal at 242d Street and Van Cortlandt Park in the Bronx through the evening rush period yesterday.

title: Killing a Bad Law
description: In less time than it takes to say May it please the court, a threejudge Federal panel in Buffalo yesterday ruled from the bench that New York State's recently enacted welfare residency law did not please it at all. The law makes one year's residency in the state a pre requisite for receiving public assistance. With commend able speed, immediately after hearing oral arguments, the panel found this law to be unconstitutional.

title: Drag Tests Facing G.I.'s On Temporary Leaves
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 9 (AP)The United States Army announced to day that its antinarcotics program would be expanded to include tests aimed at de tecting addicts in groups leaving Vietnam for 14day leaves in the United States.

title: MRS. HESTER HUNTER
description: HAVERFORD, Pa., Aug. 9 Mrs. Hester Walrath Hunter, a former copy writer with the J. Walter Thompson advertis ing company in New York, died today. She was 73 years old.

title: Mysterious Hill Folk Vanishing
description: SNEEDVILLE, Tenn.  It has been nearly a century since the first Melungeons walked out of the hills around Sneedville and mingled with the white farm families of the Clinch River Valley in East Tennessee.

title: Rahim Upsets Gonzales at Toronto Net
description: TORONTO, Aug. 9 (Canadian Press)A young Pakistani who turned professional three weeks ago upset Pancho Gon zales of Los Angeles, 76, 63, today in the first round of the $70,000 Canadian open tennis championships.

title: Births
description: NEUFELDMr. and Mrs. Steven Neufeld (nee Marci Malin) announce the birth of a daughter, Danielle on August 6, 1971.

title: Mrs., Nixon to Visit 5 States Next Week in Park Project
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (UPI) Mrs. Richard M. Nixon an nounced today that she would take, a threeday trip next week to transfer Federal lands to five states for use as parks and play areas.

title: Upstate G.I. Dies in War
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 (AP) The Defense Department said today that Donald B. Whitlock III, an Army sergeant from Silver Creek, N. Y., had been killed in the war in Southeast Asia.

title: REV. PHILIP BERRIGAN AND 25 ARE ISOLATED
description: DANBURY, Conn., Aug. 9 (AP)The Rev. Philip Berrigan and 25 other inmates of the Federal prison here were placed in an isolated cellblock today after Father Berrigan and five other inmates passed out leaf lets urging the prisoners to take part in a hunger and work strike to support all political prisoners.

title: SARATOGA SPECIAL WON BY TARBOOSH
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Aug. 9The Calumet Stable's Tarboosh won the $34,400 Sara toga Special today in an ex citing finish in which the run nerup, Loquacious Don, trailed by a head and preceded the third finisher, Rest Your Case, by a nose.

title: Rose and Javits Say a Lindsay Switch Is Imminent
description: Alex Rose, Liberal party vice chairman and one of Mayor Lindsay's closest advisers, said yesterday that the Mayor's switch to the Democratic party was imminent.

title: AMEX PRICES OFF AS TRADING IS UP
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange finished lower yester day in slightly steppedup trad ing.

title: W. H. DEPPERMAN, 68, PUBLICITY EXECUTIVE
description: William H. Depperman, an account executive with Hill & Knowlton, Inc., and publisher for many years of a profes sional journal, Practical Public Relations, died Sunday night in Memorial Hospital for Cancer and Allied Diseases. He was 68 years old and lived at 24 Old Mill Road, Chappaqua, N.Y.

title: Rogers Gives $1Million to Thant For Relief Work in East Pakistan
description: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., Aug. 9Secretary of State William P. Rogers met today for four hours with Secretary General Thant to discuss ways the United States and the United Nations could cooperate in aid ing the millions of East Pakis tanis left destitute by cyclone and war.

title: MITSUBISHI LOAN SET FOR A UNIT OF KAISER
description: Kaiser Resources, Ltd., a Canadian subsidiary of the Oak landbased Kaiser Steel Cor poration, said yesterday it had arranged for the final $10mil lion in a $35million package of debt financing from Mitsubishi Canada, Ltd.

title: Advertising:
description: Remember those newspaper articles about the contro versy over women wearing pants to the office?

title: Hotel Business Here Stays in Doldrums
description: New York City hotels are having their worst summer in years.

title: Bahnsen to Face Angels
description: Stimulated by their recent successes over the Baltimore Orioles and by the present con sistency of their pitching staff, the New York Yankees seemed wellprepared to start their three game series with the Cal ifornia Angels at Yankee Sta dium tonight.

title: DrugAbuse Fight in Schools Urged
description: A stronger attack on drug abuse in the city's public schoolspossibly including separate classes for pupils who are pushers and/or users of hard drugshas been pro posed by Dr. Seymour P. Lach man, vice president of the Board of Education.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Sperry Rand Cor poration announced yes terday the appointment of Gerald G. Probst as president of its Univac Division. Mr. Probst, for merly an executive vice president of Univac, suc ceeds Robert E. McDon ald who will assume full time his, post as execu tive vice president of Sperry Rand. In his new position Mr. Probst will direct the computer manfuacturing and mar keting activities of 28, 000 employes and 12 plants in the United States, Europe and the Far East. Univac, with worldwide revenues last year of nearly $700million, is the company's largest operating division. Mr. McDonald said that the move will enable him to devote more time to his added corporate duties which include the management responsibilities of the Univac, Remington Rand and Sperry Flight Systems divisions. Prior to joining Univac in 1961 as director of advanced develop ment, Mr. Probst was associated with the United States Air Force's, Ballistic Systems Division, Guid ance and Control Directorate.

title: Richey Wins, 61, 63
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Aug. 9 (AP) Topseeded Cliff Richey dis posed of Win Irwin today in the first round of the National clay courts tennis champion ships at Woodstock Country Club, but the final game threatened to last all afternoon.

title: Prices of Bonds Drift Downward As Heavy Financing Slate Looms
description: Bond prices drifted down ward yesterday, as the credit markets awaited this week's relatively heavy schedule of new financing activity to be gin.

title: Peru Ousts Mexico
description: Peru defeated Mexico, 3.2, yesterday in the elimination series of the international senior team tennis competition for the Stevens Cup at the Town Tennis Club and qualified to face Britain in the semi finals starting tomorrow.

title: Oilers Rout Giants, 356, As Johnson, Joiner Star
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 9With Fran Tarkenton absent, the New York Giants tried to get by with Dick Shiner and Ed Baker tonight in their exhibi tion football game against the Houston Oilers at the Astro dome.

title: JOSEPH SANTLEY, STAGE VETERAN, 81
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 9 (UPI)  Joseph Santley, who was billed as America's greatest boy actor on the Broadway stage at the turn of the cen tury and latter was a movie and television producer, died yes terday at his home in West Los Angeles. He was 81 years old.

title: Nixon Signs Bills to Fund Jobs And to Guarantee Lockheed Aid
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9  President Nixon signed into law today measures to provide $1 billion for public service jobs for the unemployed and to guarantee $250million of pri vate loans to the Lockheed Aircraft Corporation.

title: Interzone Finals Delayed
description: SAO PAULO, Brazil, Aug. 9 (AP)The Davis Cup interzone finals between Brazil and Ru mania, scheduled for this week end in Sao Paulo, have been postponed for a week because the Rumanian team is having visa difficulties.

title: An Evening With the Premier of China
description: PEKING, Aug. 9The Pre mier of China is an austere man with thick John L. Lewis eyebrows, cool and inquisi tive dark brown eyes and very white, expressive hands.

title: I.O.S. MANAGEMENT ACCUSED AT HEARING
description: FREDERICTON, New Bruns wick, Aug. 9 (Canadian Press)  Management of Investors Overseas Services, Ltd., was accused today of having com mitted a form of fraud at the company's annual meeting held June 30 in Toronto. The ap peals division of the New Brunswick Supreme Court was told by E. Neil McKelvey, a lawyer, representing dissident shareholders, that the conduct of annual corporation meetings is subject to Canadian corporation law and that constructive fraud can take place if the law is not fol lowed.

title: JUDGE DISMISSES DESERTION CHARGE
description: QUANTICO, Va., Aug. 9 (AP)A military judge dis missed today a charge of deser tion against Marine Sgt. Jon M. Sweeney.

title: Article 1  No Title
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 9 (UPI) Mrs. Billie Jean King defeated Mrs. Kerry Melville of Aus tralia, 64, 46, 61, in the sin gles final of the $40,000 Vir ginia Slims international ten nis tournament yesterday. She earned the largest prize in women's tennis$11,000.

title: Holding Down the Fare
description: The incomprehensible detachment with which most local politicians have been reacting to warnings that the fare on the city's subways and buses would probably go to fifty cents at the beginning of next year seems to have disappeared. The last few days have brought encourag ing indications that serious thought is being given in many quarters to ways of heading off so catastrophic a jump in the price of making a living.

title: OUTPUT OF STEEL PLUNGES IN WEEK
description: Steel production last week was almost halted, as output plunged to the lowest level since the nationwide steel strike of more than a decade ago.

title: MARGARET V. CAMERON
description: HUNTINGTON, L.I., Aug. 9 Margaret Vail Cameron, an English teacher at Erasmus Hall High School, Brooklyn, from 1917 until her retirement in 1959, died yesterday in the Carillon House Nursing Home. She was 75 years old.

title: Treasury Bills' Yields Rise at Weekly Auction
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9  Yields on United States Treasury bills rose in the Gov ernment's weekly competitive sale today of these short term securities.

title: Visitor to North Korea Describes Vast Building Drive
description: The following dispatch was written for The Associated Press by Benedicto S. David, Filipino reporter who has just returned from a visit to North Korea, which bars American correspondents.

title: Savings Banks Cite Inflow
description: The Savings Banks Associa tion of New York State said yesterday that its members had a net deposit inflow of $95.5million in July, down from $146million in June and $525million in March. In July 1970, the savings banks here had a net deposit gain of $15.7 million.

title: Chou Looks to Broad Talks With Nixon
description: PEKING, Aug. 9Premier Chou Enlai is prepared for a very broad discussion of world problems when President Nixon comes here some time before May.

title: LoveVine Freamon Jr., 41, Lawyer Led N.A.A.C.P. Unit
description: LoveVine Freamon Jr., a law yer who formerly served as president of the Far Rockaway Inwood Branch of the National Association for the Advance ment of Colored People and as chairman of the Peninsula Pub lic Library, lied Sunday in St. Joseph's Hospital, Far Rock away, Queens. He was 41 years old and lived at 16 Mon roe Street, Inwood, L. I.

title: New Nikon Camera Planned
description: Ehrenreich PhotoOptical In dustries, Inc., said yesterday it would market in this coun try the first new Nikon camera in 12 years beginning in October. The new camera designated the F2 is expected to retail for about $550 with one lens included.

title: Reaction in Tokyo
description: TOKYO, Aug. 9 (Reuters)  Overseas monetary uncertain ties stepped up fears today of an upward revaluation of the yen.

title: The Limited Pool of Human Talent
description: OXFORD, EnglandIf we bring up children, our own or other people's, we soon notice that they differ not only in appearance but also in be havior and abilities. They differ in what they can learn and also in what they want to learnmentally or man ually. On the mental side they differ even in how they learn the same thing whether it is by sound or sight or symbol. A whole range of consequences follow. They differ in how they re member and use what they have learned and hence in the skills they acquire. They differ consequently in their curiosity and initiative, in their amusements and sense of humor, and, above all, in their credulity, in the beliefs about the world around them, scientific or superstitious, which they are willing to accept.

title: Nixon Economic Rating Drops to 22% in Poll
description: Louis Harris said yesterday that a poll showed President Nixon's rating on keeping the economy healthy had dropped to a new low of 22 per cent.

title: Angela Davis Dispute Halts Pittsburgh Buses
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 9 (UPI) About 40 bus drivers staged a wildcat strike that stranded 6.000 commuters today be cause a Negro driver was prohibited from wearing a Free Angela Davis button on the job.

title: Dollar Falls In Europe
description: FRANKFURT, West Germany Aug. 9 (UPI)Monetary fears sent the dollar plunging sharply on European money markets today.

title: MORTGAGE UNITS PLANNING MERGER
description: Merger News

title: Stockton, Gardner Gain
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I., Aug. 9  Richard Stockton of Port Washington, L. I., and John Gardner of Australia led the field into the second round of the United States Amateur grasscourt tennis champion ships today while fifthseeded Richard Bohrnstedt of Red lands, Calif., was upset by Ken McMillan of Forth Worth, 76, 4p6, 63.

title: Yahya Schedules a Secret Trial Of Separatist Chief Tomorrow
description: KARACHX, Pakistan, Aug. 9 The Martial Law Adminis trator's office in Rawalpindi an flounced today that Sheik Mujibur Rahman, leader of the outlawed Awami League, would be tried by a special military court for waging war against Pakistan and other offenses.

title: Nixon Offers Presidential Box To Mrs. Onassis for Sept. 8
description: President Nixon will not attend the official opening Sept. 8 of the John F. Ken nedy Center for the Perform ing Arts in Washington be cause he feels it is a night for the Kennedy family and therefore has offered the Presidential box for that evening to Mrs. Aristotle S. Onassis. He will attend the second night, Sept. 9, the opening of the concert hall.

title: SovietIndian Pact
description: The SovietIndian friendship accord signed in New Delhi yesterday strengthens Soviet influence in the sec ond most populous nation in Asiaand the worldat the expense of the United States. It could increase the danger of a local war leading to a bigpower confronta tion on the Indian subcontinent.

title: OBSERVER
description: On the theory that almost everybody is now overinformed about the me chanics of getting to the moon and back and might like to learn about another tricky kind of work, we print these excerpts from the transcript of a recent conversation between the au thor of this column, known as Ob server 10, and Editorial Control during the always dangerous approach to the surface of events:

title: President to Speak To the K. of C. Here A Week From Today
description: President Nixon will address the supreme council of the Knights of Columbus in New York next Tuesday, a spokes man for the organization said yesterday. He will be the first United States Chief Executive to speak before the policy making body of the Catholic organization.

title: Power Unit Files Bid
description: A third major operating sub sidiary of the American Elec tric Power System has filed for rate increases. The Indiana and Michigan Electric Company has asked the Public Utility Commissions of Indiana and Michigan to approve increases totaling $19.3million annually for retail customers. The com pany serves 293,000 customers in Indiana and 65,000 in Mich igan.

title: I.M.F. Transacts Major Monetary Deals With Several Countries
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 The International Monetary Fund disclosed today a series of major transactions, most of which had been previously an nounced by the countries in volved.

title: Retail Sales During June Rose 8% From 1970 Level
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9Re tail sales in June rose about $400million to a record $33.11 billion, seasonally adjusted, the commerce department reported today.

title: Lunokhod Still Working
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 9 (UPI)The Soviet Union's Lunokhod 1 robot neared the end of its ninth month of work on the moon in satisfactory condi tion, the official press agency Tass reported today. By Aug. 17, the eightwheeled laboratory will have tripled its intended life span, if it is still operating at that time.

title: 2 VICE PRESIDENTS NAMED AT HARVARD
description: Cambridge, Mass., Aug. 9 Derek C. Sok, the president of Harvard University, announced today the appointment of two vice presidents.

title: SURGE SUBSIDES IN COTTON PRICES
description: Trading of cotton futures rose sharply on the New York Cotton Exchange yesterday when the Agriculture Depart ment released its 1971 cotton crop estimate of 10,931,700 bales, up 8 per cent from last year's output. Many cotton traders had thought the Gov ernment's estimate would be higher.

title: WASTER INVOKES INTERNMENT LAW; 12 DIE IN RIOTING
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Tuesday, Aug. 10  The Gov ernment of Northern Ireland invoked emergency powers of preventive detention yesterday, and the reaction was an explo sion of violence that had cost at least a dozen lives by early today.

title: NIXON: FREES FUND FOR MORTGAGE AID
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9 President Nixon has released $2billion of special housing funds for a program that will, in effect, subsidize the Federal Housing Administration and Veterans Administration mort gage interest rate to hold it at 7 per cent.

title: Union Chief Scores Boycott of Heublein
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 9A rift between the A.F.L.C.I.O. and its affiliated United Farm Workers Organizing Committee intensified today.

title: NEWTON TO BE TRIED A 3D TIME IN KILLING
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Aug. 9 (AP) Huey Newton, whose second trial in connection with the killing of an Oakland policeman ended with a hung jury, will be tried a third time, the District Attorney said today.

title: Bridge: Lead of a Singleton for Ruff Has Merit Only Up to a Point
description: Leading singleton with the intention of obtaining a ruff or two has merit up to a point. But that point is nor mally overstepped when the suit has been bid by the de clarer. This is illustrated by the diagramed deal, played in the recent Summer Nationals in Chicago. South was Dr. Ahmed Hussein of New York, and the singleton lead en abled him to bring home an optimistic game contract by skillful play.

title: Perjury Trial Witness Tells of Payoffs
description: A key witness testified yes terday that an official of the Broadway Maintenance Corpo ration made payoffs to increase the company's streetlighting contract with the city.

title: Vatican Denounces Italian Senate Bill Legalizing Abortion
description: ROME, Aug. 9The Vatican today sharply attacked a So cialist bill before Parliament that calls for limited legalized abortion in this country.

title: U.S. Allows Aid for Soviet Truck Plant
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9The Commerce Department dis closed today the grant of two licenses for the shipment of $162million in equipment for a new truck  manufacturing complex in the Soviet Union.

title: Meant to Deter Pakistan
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 9India and the Soviet Union today signed a 20  year friendship treaty clearly intended to deter Pakistan from an attack on India.

title: Classical Music Dwindling on City's Radio Stations
description: Classical music, which only few years ago was virtually synonomous with the New York radio scene, is being clone in by economics and the Fed eral Communications Commis sion, and today Bach and Beet hoven are rapidly giving place to the Beatles and the Byrds.

title: A Rise of 703,000 In Nonwhites Here Noted in '70 Census
description: New York City's nonwhite population rose to 1,844,000 in the 1970 census, which would indicate 178,000 residents of racial background other than Negro, such as Chinese, Japan ese, Filipinos and others.

title: Soviet, Nepal Renew Pact
description: KATMANDU, Nepal, Aug. 9 (AP)The Soviet Union re newed today a cultural and sci entific exchange program with Nepal for another seven years. The agreement will insure a strong Soviet presence and con tinued close ties with Nepal. Under the agreement, first signed in 1964, the two coun tries will exchange artists, teachers, physicians, techni cians and journalists.

title: EQUITY FUNDING LINK TO INSURER ALLOWED
description: The New Jersey Insurance Department, in an 11thhour decision, granted its approval last night for the merger of the Bankers National Life Insur ance Company and the Equity Funding Corporation of Amer ica.

title: A LOOPHOLE FOUND IN SPENDING CURB
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 9The escalator clause in the cam paign spending bill that the Senate approved last week is so generous that it would per mit each party $2.8million extra in spending in 1972 and might double expenditure ceil ings by the next national elec tion in 1976.

title: Notes on People
description: It was a hot and humid day and the White House dogs, King Timahoe, Vicky and Pasha, languidly settled under a shade tree while President Nixon went out in the noonday sun to welcome 16 Seattle youngsters who had bicycled 3,617 miles crosscountry in 58 days.

title: 33 Albanians Flee by Boat To Greek Island of Corfu
description: ATHENS, Aug. 9  Thirty three Albanians, mostly of Greek origin, sought political asylum in Greece today after an escape aboard a fishing boat to Corfu Island.

title: Peay Quits Packers After an Argument With Devine's Aides
description: GREEN BAY, Wis., Aug. 9 (UPI)The Green Bay Packers, their offensive tackle corps thin already, lost their regular right tackle, Francis Peay, today when he walked out of camp after an argument with assistant coaches during grass drills.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: MARS NEAR EARTH TOMORROW NIGHT
description: Tomorrow evening Mars will make its closest approach to earth of this century, except for a slightly closer encounter in 1924.

title: Sensors to Detect Foe Are Proving Value in Vietnam
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 9 (UPI)  A tiny radio transmitter, buried in the red clay floor of an Indochina jungle with only its camou flaged antenna protruding, bleeped and thousands of South Vietnamese troops got marching orders.

title: Sports of The Times
description: It was a crazy idea in the first place, a wild flight of fancy that popped into mind unbidden. It took form dur ing the second quarter of last Saturday night's exhibition football game in Tampa between the New York Jets and the Detroit Lions while Joe Namath was insouciantly pick ing apart the vaunted Detroit defenses.

title: State Union Leader Assails Legislators
description: The president of the New York State A.F.L.C.I.O. charged yesterday that the 1971 legis lative session in Albany had failed the people and he called for the election of representa tives responsive to the needs of working men and women.

title: Talmadge Scores China Trip
description: AUGUSTA, Ga., Aug. 10 (UPI)Senator Herman E. Tal madge, Democrat of Georgia, said today that he believed President Nixon's planned trip to China was nothing more than a fishing expedition and political in nature.

title: The Future of the American Family: Despite All, Dr. Brothers Sees Hope
description: There yet may be hope for the American family.

title: Miss Hillsman Bride of M. A. Baker
description: Miss Sally Turnbull Hills man, an assistant professor of sociology at Queens Col lege, was married here yes terday afternoon to Michael Andersen Baker, an assistant director here of the Project on Computer Data Banks of the National Academy of Sci ences, Washington.

title: Bishop Named in Cincinnati
description: ROME, Aug. 10 (UPI)Pope Paul VI named Msgr. Nicholas Elko today auxiliary to Arch bishop Paul Leibold of Cin cinnati. Monsignor Elko, 61 years old, was named a bishop in 1955. He has lived in Rome since 1967.

title: About Motor Sports
description: Swede Savage, who suf fered head injuries in a rac ing accident last March, re turns to competition for the first time this weekend, and Under the most distinguished auspices. Savage will run Sunday in a TransAmerican race at Watkins Glen, N. Y., driving a 1971 Camaro owned by A. J. Foyt and $mok ey Yunick and prepared by the latter. Yunick learned his trade on the Southern stockcar circuit, where he acquired a legendary reputation for coping with rules.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: State Consumer Unit Gets Caretaker
description: A special assistant to Gov ernor Rockefeller has been named the temporary care taker of the New York State Consumer Protection Board, which one staff member says has done absolutely nothing since Betty Furness announced her resignation as chairman one month ago.

title: Cardinal di Vignale Dies; St. Peter's Canon Was 81
description: ROME, Aug. 10  Federico Cardinal Callori di Vignale died today at the age of 81, in his home in the Vatican Palace.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Losey Revels in Happy GoBetween
description: MGM thought The Go Between was a worthless film, said the movie's direc tor, Joseph Losey. They wanted to dump it. They planned to open it April 7 in Beverly Hills and forget it. They didn't want to show it at the Cannes Film Festi val.

title: President Goes on Cruise
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 (AP) President Nixon went on Potomac River dinner cruise tonight aboard the yacht Se quoia. Among his dinner com panions were John D. Ehrlich man, his assistant for domestic affairs; H. R. Haldeman, assist ant and chief of staff; Harry Dent, special counsel, and Attorney General John N. Mitchell.

title: Egypt Summons Diplomats From Three Major Posts
description: CAIRO, Aug. 10 (AP)Egypt has called home her diplomatic representatives from Wash ington, Moscow and the United Nations for important consul tations, it was reported today.

title: Dodgers Get Wilhelm
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 10 (UPI) The Los Angeles Dodgers pur chased the contract of the vet eran knuckleballer, Hoyt Wil helm, tonight from their Spokane farm club. He is to join the Dodgers tomorrow.

title: Market Place:
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 10 Robert Heisterberg, vice president in charge of trust investment research for the Bank of America, has been with the bank only about nine months, but he's begin ning to feel at home and is now willing to speak out a bit.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: NORTON SIMON NET UP 15% INQUARTER
description: Norton Simon, Inc., which owns 10 operating subsidiaries, including the Canada Dry Cor poration, HuntWesson Foods, Inc., and McCall Publishing, set records in sales and earnings in the quarter and fiscal year ended June 30, the company reported yesterday.

title: Relief Roll Dips in Quarter For the First Time in Years
description: A quarterly decrease of 28 persons in the city's huge wel fare rollssomething current officials could not recall in many years' experiencewas made known yesterday.

title: Labor Bids Nixon Restudy Peking Policy
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 10 The executive, council of the A.F.L.  C.I.O. urged President Nixon today to reexamine his new policy toward Communist China.

title: Kremlin's Adviser on U.S. Georgi A. Arbatov
description: Man in the News

title: World Horseshoe Tourney Played in Jersey
description: MIDDLESEX, N. J., Aug. 10 Toward midnight tonight the clang of steel against steel finally stopped here in Mountain View Park.

title: Screen: Deep End, Fantasies in a Public Bath
description: The Polish director Jerzy Skolimowski has been making movies since 1964. He has had showings, especially film festival showings, from the beginning, and he has re ceived a good deal of serious critical attention. But he has not, at least in this coun try, enjoyed great popularity even with the minuscule movie audience that supports in spirit, if not with cash, whatever really matters in the new and newest cinema.

title: Economic Analysis
description: In the ranks of consumerism, critics of consumer credit are, in the van.

title: Asians Doubt That US. Can Halt Heroin Flow
description: BANGKOK, Thailand, Aug. 10 Formidable obstacles con front the United States in its efforts to halt the flow of heroin to its troops in Vietnam and to prevent Southeast Asian heroin from moving into the American market to fill the gap that may be left if the traffic from the Middle East is con tained.

title: Books of The Times
description: DO YOU SINCERELY WANT TO BE RICH? The Full Story of Bernard Cornfeld and I.O.S. By Charles Raw, Bruce Page and Godfrey Hodgson. 900 pages. Viking. $8.95.

title: Reynolds & Co. Plans To Incorporate Sept. 1
description: Reynolds & Co., the Wall Street brokerage concern, said yesterday it plans to in corporate Sept. 1 and is con sidering the possibility of a subsequent public stock of fering.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: REYKJAVIK, IcelandThe Iceland ers are admirable, friendly, selfreliant people with a hardiness that has en abled them to survive an arduous cli mate and poorly endowed soil. Never theless, there is striking loveliness to this pastelshaded island with its gla ciers, smoking volcanoes and clear rivers filled with furiously leaping salmon.

title: Theater:
description: Say this for the city endorsed Puerto Rican Travel ing Theater. They do things with vigor and purpose. The actors skillful vitality last night was entirely contagious as they officially unveiled their dramatized anthology of 10 short stories by outstand ing writers of Puerto Rican origin.

title: 7 Unions Are Accused of Working Against Black Postal Employes
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 The National Alliance of Postal and Federal Employes, one of three independent postal un ions, charged today that the seven craft unions recognized by the United States Postal Service were working hand in glove against the interests of black postal employes.

title: THANT CAUTIONS ON MUJIB TRIAL
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 10  Secretary General Thant warned today, that the fate of the East Pakistani leader, Sheik Mujibur Rahman, would inevitably have repercussions outside the borders of Pakis tan.

title: FRENCH TROTTERS CLEARED FOR RACE
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Aug. 10 A decision by French officials cleared the way tonight for the appearance of two trotting champions, Une de Mai and Tidalium Pelo, in the $125,000 International Trot at Roosevelt Raceway Aug. 21. Cancellation of the race had been consid ered.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: CITY POWER HALT IN CRISIS VETOED
description: A fourmember majority of the state Public Service Com mission yesterday formally re jected proposals that would have cut off electricity to major buildings in New York City in expected power crises and would have barred electric service to buildings contructed during the present tight power situation.

title: CLARENCE EPSTEAN
description: SOUTHBURY, Conn., Aug. 10  Clarence Epstean, retired president and chairman of Wal ker Engraving Corporation in New York City, died yesterday in Waterbury Hospital after a long illness. He was 74 years old and lived in Heritage Vil lage here.

title: Cricket Test Is Drawn
description: MANCHESTER, England, Aug, 10 (Reuters)The second crick et test between England and India was abandoned as a draw today. Rain washed out the final day's play. England scored 386 and 245 run for three wickets declared, India has 212 and 65 for three.

title: Ending New Jersey Corruption
description: The sentencing yesterday of former Jersey City Mayor Thomas J. Whelan and several others, found guilty on multiple charges of extortion and conspiracy to collect kickbacks from firms doing business with the city, follows by only a matter of months the sentencing of former Newark Mayor Hugh Addonizio for similar crimes.

title: 9 Peep Shows Are Raided in Times Square Area
description: The police started a crack down yesterday on storefront peep shows in the Times Square area, removing machines show ing sex films and arresting em ployes in nine stores on charge of promoting obscenity.

title: Conservative Disenchantment
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va.Richard Nixon has recently announced his plans to visit China, although there is no in dication that China's aggressive poli cies have changed, that the hostility to the United States has lessened, or that he has a plan to maintain our commitments and obligations to the Nationalist Chinese while he pursues his adventurous policy. The majority of those who worked for Mr. Nixon's election, and voted for him, did so because they believed his promises of the 1968 campaign.

title: Miles Wins 1,500 FreeStyle at Cali
description: CALT, Colombia, Aug. 10 Proving that Arkansas can pro duce more than GradeA hogs and college football teams, Pat Miles won a PanAmerican Games gold medal tonight in the 1,500meter freestyle, com petitive swimming's version of the marathon.

title: Jury Picked in Tate Trial
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 10 (UPI) A jury of six men ?? women was selected ?? the trial of Charles ?? ?? the TateLaBianca ?? August, 1969, for which ?? M. Manson and three ?? ?? have been sentenced ?? Mr. Watson, 25 years ?? pleaded not guilty ?? guilty by reason of ??.

title: Senin Wins Ring Title
description: BILBAO, Spain, Aug. 10 (AP) Agustin Senin of Spain won the European bantamweight boxing championship tonight with a unanimous 15round de cision over Alan Rudkln of Britain.

title: Monday Night Fight
description: New York (Madison Square Gar den)Chu Chu Malave, 145 pounds, New York, outpointed Harold Weston Jr., 145, New York, 9 rounds.

title: Excerpts From Soviet Article About U.S.Chinese Relations
description: Following are excerpts from an article by Georgi A. Arba tov, Soviet specialist on the United States, concerning Chinese  American relations, as transmitted in English by Tass, the Soviet press agency.

title: Canada Weighs Membership In the InterAmerican Bank
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 Canada has announced her in tention to pursue the possibil ity of full membership in the Bank, it announced today.

title: Jersey Restaurant's Patrons Thrive on Politics
description: JERSEY CITY, Aug. 10 At some restaurants, the principal attraction is the bill of fare. At Bruno's chop and alehouse here, it is politics.

title: Yanks Ride Rails Through Heart of Met Country
description: A message from the Bronx was brought to central Long Island yesterday as three Yankees toured the suburbs known as Met Country.

title: Theater:
description: If this play is anything, it is about God and the devil and/or beauty and ugliness, writes the playwrightdirec tor George Birimisa in the program for his Georgie Porgie, which opened last night at the Village Arena Theater. He continues: Es sentially it is a seekinga search for the ongoing process of creation and death, all entwined and ever changing. He must be talk ing about some other play.

title: Berlin: The Final Round
description: The unprecedented marathon meeting of the Big Four ambassadors that began yesterday in Berlin opens what promises to be the final round in negotiation of a new agreement on Europe's most explosive area.

title: The C.E.Q. Advances...
description: Publication of the second annual report of the Council on Environmental Quality is something of an eventfor both the importance of its material and the circum stances of its transmittal to Congress. The document itself is, among other things, a sobering analysis of what polluted air and water are costing the country and an equally sobering, though not alarmist, one about what it will cost to undo the damage.

title: Chairman of Hartford Fire Takes Post at Hartford Life
description: The Hartford Fire Insurance Company announced yesterday that Harry V. Williams, its 63 yearold board chairman, had been elected to the additional post of president of the Hart ford Life Insurance Company, a subsidiary of Hartford Fire.

title: Pyongyang Critique Of Nixon's Journey Reprinted in China
description: HONG KONG, Aug. 10The Chinese press agency Hsinhua today carried the text of a North Korean press commen tary describing President Nix on's projected visit to Peking as not the march of a victor but a trip of the defeated.

title: 7 Choreographers Combine for Series Of Cubicalo Dances
description: The Cubiculo has decided that the clog days of August is a logical time to give a series of dance programs that look back to the season just past and peck forward a bit to one fast approaching. Monday night seven choreographers associ ated with the house presented the first program of the series.

title: ELLSBERG'S PETITION DENIED BY U.S. JUDGE
description: PORTLAND, Me., Aug. 10  The United States Court of Ap peals for the First District to day denied the petition of Dr. Daniel Ellsberg to compel Boston Federal district judge to hold a hearing to determine whether illegal wiretapping had been used to obtain an indict ment against him.

title: Swiss Dollar Influx Slows
description: GENEVA, Aug. 10The in flux into Switzerland of dol lars seeking a haven against a possible devaluation slowed down considerably today, according to Swiss National Bank officials.

title: OSCAR OGG DEAD; CALLIGRAPHER, 62
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Aug. 10 Oscar Ogg, a graphic artist and author who was art direc tor and a vice president of the BookoftheMonth died today in St. Joseph's Hospital after a short illness, He was 62 years old and lived on Westover Road here.

title: PRAISE OF SOVIET VOICED IN INDIA
description: NEW DELHI, Aug. 10Praise for the Soviet Union and some harsh comments on United States policy were voiced to day as the Indian Parliament debated the IndianSoviet friendship treaty signed here yesterday.

title: People's Needs Shape a Growing Harlem Hospital
description: The 84yearold Harlem Hos pital  often feared and de spised by the people it is sup posed to help  has greatly expanded its staff and added $51million in new buildings and equipment.

title: Crime Is Rife in Uganda
description: KAMPALA, Uganda (AP)  Uganda's crime rate is among the worst in the world, says Lieut. Col. E. A. T. Obitre Gama, Internal Affairs Minis ter.

title: Sweden Wins U.N. Draw
description: UNITED NATIONS, N. Y., Aug. 10Sweden was selected today to have the first seat in the General Assembly when it convenes for its 26th session Sept. 21. In a small ceremdny in his office, Secretary General Thant drew lots; Sweden's delegation will be seated in the front row at the extreme left. The other delegations will fol low in alphabetical order.

title: MRS. ROGER FAWCETT
description: Mrs. Helen Aline Bergquist Fawcett, wife of Roger Faw cett, president of Fawcett Pub lications, Inc., died Monday at Mount Sinai Hospital after a short illness. She was 59 years old.

title: RIOTING CONTINUES IN ULSTER'S CITIES; DEATH TOLL NOW 17
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Aug. 10Violence continued in Belfast and other parts of Northern Ireland today in the aftermath of the killings of at least 16 persons, including two women, a 15yearold boy and a priest administering last rites.

title: RUSSELL J. M'VINNEY, PROVIDENCE BISHOP
description: WATCH HILL, R.I., Aug. 10 (AP)The Most Rev. Russell J. McVinney, the fifth Bishop of Providence and the first native Rhode Islander to head the Roman Catholic diocese, died in his sleep today at his summer home. He was 72 years old.

title: Negotiations for AliQuarry Said to Se Near Completion
description: Negotiations for a Muham mad AliJerzy Quarry heavy weight bout are very close to completion, according to Robert Arum, president of Top Rank, Inc.

title: VANOCUR IS LEAVING N.B.C.TV NEWS POSTS
description: Sander Vanocur, who took over as anchorman of WNBC TV's 6 P.M. newscast in April, will leave the post around Labor Day.

title: News Analysis
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, Aug. 10We may yet have much to endure as a commu nity, but if we endure it with courage and steadiness the utter defeat of terrorism is sure.

title: Reserve Approves A Holding Company For Banks Upstate
description: The Federal Reserve Board announced yesterday its ap proval of plans for the forma tion of a new upstate New York banking holding company with asset of $1.35billion.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: U.S. to Finance Woman Prisoner Rehabilitation Plan
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 10 (UPI) The Justice Department an nounced today a $500,000 mod el rehabilitation program for remale inmates of Federal, state and local prisons.

title: Astronauts' Photos Depict the Sweep and the Detail of the Lunar Surface
description: HOUSTON, Aug. 10The Manned Spacecraft Center moved into full stride today on the second phase of Apollo 15. As newsmen watched through a glass partition in the receiving laboratory, technicians stuck their hands and arms through long, black plastic gloves attached to the rims of round portholes in the sides of glassandstain less steel chambers filled with nitrogen. Inside this clean atmosphere, where the lunar samples were pro tected from contamination, were two long tubes contain ing core samples from the moon's crust, and perhaps half a dozen small plastic bags containing rocks.

title: TV: C.B.S.'s TwiceTold Tale and Henry VIII
description: First you see it, then you don't. In this case, though, it isn't magic.

title: 1966 Heat Wave Linked to Fatal Strokes
description: A heat wave in 1966 that affected much of the United States east of the Rockies led to a sharp increase in deaths from stroke, according to a study by two Illinois health statisticians.

title: Pakistan Shows Concern
description: KARACHI, Pakistan, Aug. 10 Pakistan has reacted with surprise and concern to the signing of the pact between In dia and the Soviet Union, which Pakistan apparently regards as a defense treaty.

title: DR. PASCAL PARENTE, THEOLOGIANAUTHOR
description: CAMBRIDGE, N. Y., Aug. 10 (AP)  The Rev. Dr. Pascal Prosper Parente, a Roman Catholic theologian, author and edticator, died in retirement here yesterday at the age of 84.

title: CHANTILLY IS VICTOR IN TEST FOR HUNTERS
description: BRANCHVILLE, N. J., Aug. 10Sindy Paul of Abington, Pa., rode both the champion and the reserve winner in the small pony hunter competition tonight at the Sussex County horse show.

title: ROBERT L. LEWIS
description: SARASOTA, Fla., Aug. 10 Robert L. Lewis, who pio neered in electronics and be came an assistant to the presi dent of the Sonotone Corpora tion before he retired in 1963, died today. He was 76 years old.

title: News Analysis
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 9The drab, marblewalled Cook County Criminal Court building is fa miliar to many theatergoers as the scene of The Front Page, a play many think is a satire, rather than a documentary, of Chicago journalism and politics.

title: Chows Views Encourage U.S. Aides
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 Administration officials said privately today that they were encouraged by Premier Chou Enlal's emphasis, in the inter view with James Reston of The New. York. Times, on longterm issues rather than shortterm gains.

title: Japanese Air Chief Resigns
description: TOKYO, Aug. 10 (AP) The resignation of Gen. Yasuhiro Ueda, air chief of staff, which he submitted because of the collision July 20 between Japanese fighter and an air liner, was accepted today Kei kichi Masuhara resigned earlier as defense chief because of the collision.

title: COURTMARTIAL TOLD OF STRESS ON MARINE
description: QUANTICO, Va., Aug. 10 (AP)Three psychiatrists at the courtmartial of Sgt. Jon M. Sweeney testified today that the former prisoner of war had made two attempts at suicide because of his grossly de pressed state.

title: MRS. JOHN J. SMITH
description: Mrs. Julia A. Smith, the mother of Stephen E. Smith, who managed Edward M. Ken nedy's campaign for the Sent ate and is married to Jean Kennedy, the Senator's sister, died yesterday at her home. She was 86 years old and lived at 791 Park Avenue.

title: Power Fails in Washington
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 (UPI)A 30minute power fail ure hit a large section of downtown Washington today, stranding people in elevators and causing big traffic tieups. The blackout covered about 80 blocks. Electricity was restored at 2:40 P.M. The Potomac Elec tric Power Company said the failure was due to a malfunc tion at a substation.

title: PROTESTS ARE FILED OVER ROWING CHOICE
description: Both the New York Athletic Club and the New York Rowing Association filed protests yes terday with the National Asso ciation of Amateur Oarsmen for selecting the secondplace doubles team to represent the United States in the European championships at Copenhagen next week.

title: IDAHO INMATES RIOT; DESTROY 2 BUILDINGS
description: BOISE, Idaho, Aug. 10 (AP) Inmates of the Idaho State Penitentiary rioted tonight, set ting fires that destroyed two buildings in the ancient prison complex.

title: ERIC LUNDGREN, LED ART UNIT AT ESQUIRE
description: BREMEN, Me., Aug. 10 Eric B. E. K. Lundgren, an artist and former art director of Esquire magazine, died of a heart attack in Damariscotta on July 29. He was 65 years old, His family announced his death yesterday.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Sounding more like a tax expert than a quarterback, Fran Tarkenton said yesterday all he wanted from the New York Giants was what at least three other clubs already had given their stars.

title: Surgery Sidelines Trevino
description: TRUTH OR CONSEQUENCES, N. M., Aug. 10 (UPI)Lee Tre vino was in good condition and high spirits today, recovering from surgery for acute appen dicitis. He's in good spirits and eager to get back to doing what he knows best, said Dr. D. E. Stoops, one of two sur geons who performed an emer gency operation on the pro golf star early this morning. Tre vino is expected to miss three weeks of the golf tour.

title: AMERICAN EAGLE SETS SAIL MARK
description: PLYMOUTH, England, Aug. 10 (UPI)  American Eagle of the United States smashed the record for the 605mile Fastnet Rock race, fourth and final of the 1971 Admiral's Cup series, to night and the Australian's chal lenge for the team title vir tually ended.

title: Ground Action in Vietnam Continues to Remain Light
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 10 (AP)Battlefield action in South Vietnam remained light today, with the only sig nificant clash reported from a Mekong Delta village where Vietcong guerrillas sought to collect tax money from the residents.

title: Killebrew Clouts 500th And 501st but Twins Bow
description: Harmon Killebrew reached one plateau last night and quickly started toward an other.

title: Agreement on Repatriation
description: NEW DELHI., Aug. 10India and Pakistan have agreed, after a threeandonehalf month impasse, on the repatri ation of personnel at their respective diplomatic missions in Dacca and Calcutta.

title: Liner in Lisbon Collision
description: LISBON, Aug. 10 (Reuters) The 29,429ton Italian liner Cristoforo Colombo and the Ana Mafalda a 3,3.18ton Portu AUCSO ship, collided at the en trance to Lisbon harbor today, but the authorities said there were no casualties and damage was slight.

title: Lindsay's Pequest for Transportation Funds Slows Action by the House on Gateway Recreation Area
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 Mayor Lindsay's request for Federal financing of mass transportation to the proposed Gateway National Recreation Area has slowed House action on the project, members of a House Interior subcommittee said today.

title: Police Kill Bank Robber
description: LANCASTER, Pa., Aug. 10 (UP)A robber was killed and two boys were wounded in the crossfire today when the police broke up a bank holdup. The police said they believed the robbery at the South Duke Street branch of the Fulton Na tional Bank had been staged by a threeman gang of robbers from Philadelphia. They were trying to ascertain the identity of the dead man through finger prints.

title: PRICE CHANGES SET ON VARIED PRODUCTS
description: Copper water tubing prices were cut yesterday by several major manufacturers to meet competitive prices. The Phelps Dodge Tube Company and the Reading Tube division of Read ing Industries, Inc. said yester day they were cutting prices on both the copper water tube and related products by 5 per cent.

title: Suffolk Legislators Endorse Expansion Of County Airport
description: HAUPPAUGE, L. I., Aug. 10 The Suffolk County Legisla ture today took the first major step toward transforming the Suffolk County Airport at Westhampton Beach from a small, generalaviation airport to the largest facility east of Kennedy International Airport.

title: SpanishSpeaking U.S. Citizens Owned 1% of Concerns in 1969
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 About one per cent of Ameri can business concerns in 1969 were owned by Spanishspeak ing United States citizens, the Commerce Department report ed today.

title: Advertising:
description: From merrie old England, an attractive former ballet dancer has arrived on our shores to discuss Internation al magazine publishing.

title: STOCKS DECLINE IN AMEX TRADING
description: Prices on the American Stock Exchange declined for the third consecutive session yesterday in moderate trading.

title: Stokes' Game Coaches Picked
description: MONTICELLO, N. Y., Aug. 10 (UPI)Arnold (Red) Auerbach, who coached the Boston Celtics to nine National Basketball As sociation championships and Al Attles, the coach of the Golden State Warriors, were named to day to coach in the Annual Maurice Stokes Basketball game at Kutcher's Country Club next Tuesday.

title: RATES ARE STEADY FOR TAXEXEMPTS
description: This week's heavy volume of taxexempt financing did not drive interest rates higher yes terday, but most new bond is sues sold quickly anyway.

title: Senior Finance Officer Appointed by Lockheed
description: Directors of the Lockheed, Aircraft Corporation yesterday elected Roy A. Anderson to the board and also named him sen ior vicepresidentfinance, Mr. Anderson is 50 years old.

title: BIG FUND SETTLES LAWSUITS ON FEES
description: Massachusetts Financial Serv ices, Inc., which manages two of the nation's largest mutual funds, has decided to settle two stockholder suits by agreeing to join a regional stock exchange so it can recapture a portion of brokerage commissions the funds will generate.

title: ASHE IS DEFEATED AT CANADIAN NET
description: TORONTO, Aug. 10 (AP)  Ray Ruffels of Australia upset secondseeded Arthur Ashe of Richmond, 63, 36, 76, today in the second round of the $70,000 Canadian open tennis championships.

title: ...but the President Retreats
description: To sense Mr. Nixon's timidity concerning the Council's report, one has only to compare his comments with those that accompanied the submission of the agency's first annual report in the summer of 1970. That document, which was vague and mildthe Council had barely been launchedwas sent to Congress with the President's warning of the prospect of ecological disaster. When he signed the law creating the Council, eight months earlier, he had been even more emphatic. The nineteen seventies, he said, were absolutely America's last chance to reclaim the purity of its air and waterIt is literally now or never.

title: S.E.C. Seeks to Protect OffshoreFund Investors
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 (Reu ters)  The Securities and Ex change Commission announced plans today to study possible protection of foreign buyer of shares in unregulated offshore funds, which invest heavily in American securities.

title: Tax Move Near in Hartford Assembly
description: HARTFORD, Aug. 10  The leaders of Connecticut's Gener al Assembly worked behind closed doors today to shape a substitute for the recently enacted state income tax.

title: BIG 4 BERLIN TALKS CONTINUING TODAY
description: BERLIN, Aug. 10Ambassa dors of the four victorious powers of World War II today opened the crucial and perhaps decisive 27th round of their ne gotiations on improving the situation of Berlin.

title: PLATINUM PRICES SHOW A DECLINE
description: Prices of platinum futures dropped $1.40 to $2.40 a troy ounce following the easing of gold and silver prices yester day.

title: Advertising:
description: Department stores have for many years imprinted sales pitches for merchandise they carry on the envelopes with their monthly statements. So why can't this tech nique be used by other corporations that want to reach the consumer directly?

title: Judge Sets Oct. 12 For 3d Newton Trial In Slaying on Coast
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Aug. 10 Huey P. Newton, founder and highest ranking officer in the Black Panther party, will stand trial Oct. 12 for the third time in the fatal shooting of an Oak land policeman in 1967.

title: Citizens. Coalition Seeks National Policy to Hold. Population Growth at Zero
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 Milton S. Eisenhower, interim president of Johns Hopkins University, and former Senator Joseph D. Tydings announced today the formation of a citi zens coalition to push for adoption of a national policy of zero population growth.

title: Miss Golomb Wed To Simon Selber
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 10 Miss Marilyn Deborah Go lomb and Simon William Sel ber, both of New York, were married here today in the East Garden of the Ambas sador Hotel Rabbi Abraham Postone of Calgary, Alberta, Canada, an uncle of the bride, performed the cere mony.

title: MRS. EDWARD A. CLANCY
description: BRIDGEPORT, Conn., Aug. 10Mrs. Laura V. Rickard Cardinal in February, 1965. He Rickard & Son Trucking Com pany here, died yesterday in Park City Hospital, following a long illness. She lived at 32 Westwood Road, Fairfield.

title: Dodgers Get Wilhelm
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 10 (UPI) The Los Angeles Dodgers pur chased the contract of the vet eran knuckleballer, Hoyt Wil helm, tonight from their Spokane farm club. He is to join the Dodgers tomorrow.

title: New Trouble on IRT Disrupts Service on Seventh Ave. Line
description: A new power problem cropped up on the Seventh Ave nue IRT line last night, forc ing another suspension of sub way servicethis time from 168th Street in Manhattan to the terminal at 242d Street and Van Cortlandt Park in the Bronx.

title: Namath Gets Blocking Guard for Hospital Privacy
description: Outside the room in Lenox Hill Hospital, the New York Jets have posted a security guard to preserve Joe Namath's privacy.

title: SATO AIDE SEEKS RAPPORT WITH U.S.
description: TOKYO, Aug. 10Our re lations with the United States are as important to us as sun shine or water, Kakuei Ta naka said.

title: ONE FAVORITE LOSES IN U.S. OPEN CHESS
description: VENTURA, Calif., Aug. 10 All but one of the favored playersgrandmasters, interna tional grandmasters and mas terswon their games here as the second round in the 72d United States Open Chess Tour nament was completed today.

title: Jackson Sees Peril Of Party TakeOver By Democratic Left
description: Senator Henry M. Jackson warned yesterday that the Democratic left was trying to take over the party and that if it succeded the Democrats would lose in 1972 and be in deep trouble for years there after.

title: Bank Holding Concerns Given Insurance Rules
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 The Federal Reserve Board spelled out today the kinds of insurance agency activities that will be per missible for bank holding companies. The activities will be limited.

title: Bridge: A Temptation is Resisted And Thus Contract Is Made
description: There is one exception to the rule that a change of suit is forcing in response to an opening preemptive bid. If the opening bid is three spades and the response is four hearts, game has been reached and the opener is not only not forced to bid but also is virtually required to pass.

title: Warranties Widened By American Motors
description: DETROIT, Aug. 10The American Motors Corporation pledged today that if almost anything goes wrong with its 1972 cars in the first year, or 12,000 miles, we'll fix it free.

title: Richey, Mrs. King Gain
description: INDIANAPOLIS, Aug. 10 (AP) Cliff Richey of Sarasota, Fla., and Billie Jean King, Long Beach, Calif., advanced easily today in the $58,000 national clay court open tennis cham pionship.

title: Cambodian Aide, in U. S., Says Nation Will Not Join a Political Bloc
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10  Lieut. Gen. Sisowath Sirik Ma tak, acting Premier of Cambo dia, said here today that his country would continue using United States arms and eco nomic aid and declared that Cambodia intended to join no political bloc,

title: BROKERAGE FORMED BY SOURCE EQUITIES
description: Source Equities, Inc., a new brokerage firm with offices at 160 Broadway, announced yes terday that it would provide fullservice brokerage facilities to investors on a flatfee basis. The company executes orders in both listed and unlisted se curities through facilities of Imarketmakers in the overthe counter and third markets.

title: CITY G. O. P. GROUP BIDS LINDSAY STAY
description: A group of prominent Repub licans who have supported May or Lindsay's political career including John Hay Whitney, David Rockefeller, Walter N. Thayer and Gustave Levy joined yesterday in a public, 11thhour plea to Mr. Lindsay not to leave the Republican party.

title: Beeps Join Waggles on Trading Floor
description: Floor brokers on the New York Stock Exchange have started carrying pocketsized radio receivers through which they can be alerted to incom ing buy and sell orders.

title: Vatican Again Seeks Seemliness in Dress
description: ROME, Aug. 10The Vati can issued today its latest dictate on fashion: Visitors to holy places should be seemly, dignified and dressed.

title: The Proceedings In the U.N. Today
Princess Pout Wins Primonetta Easily
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Aug. 10Princess Pout, a 5 yearold mare owned by June H. McKnight, made things look easy under a burden of 128 pounds in the Primonetta, the $15,000 purse handicap that was the feature of today's card at Saratoga. Competing against half a dozen of her own sex, Princess Pout beat the Tartan Stable's Arachne by two lengths, with Woody Stephens's Top Round next.

title: Galanos Treats 40's Discreetly
description: Did Jimmy send your in vitation to your home? asked the woman from Larchmont to her seat mate from Man hasset. And Norell, too?

title: U.S. PANEL SCORED BY PUERTO RICANS
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 Puerto RicanAmericans pro tested today that the Cabinet Committee on Opportunities for Spanish Speaking People was dominated by MexicanAmeri cans.

title: More Aid for Opium Drive
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 (AP) Three more observation heli copters are being added to Mexico's drive against mari juana and opium poppy fields, which is aided by the United States, the Justice Department said today. Deputy Attorney General Richard G. Kleindienst plans to present the aircraft to Mexico's Deputy Attorney Gen eral, David Franco Rodriguez, in a ceremony tomorrow at Juarez, Mexico, across the bor der from El Paso.

title: Harry Cohen, ExManager Of Newburgh Evening News
description: NEWBURGH, N.Y. Aug 10 (AP)  Harry Cohen, general manager of The Newburgh Evenings News from 1943 to 1057, died at his home here early today at the age of 84.

title: Syracuse Split by Racial Views
description: SYRACUSE  Something great to grow on is the way many of Syracuse's boosters describe this city.

title: Briscoe, Hart in Knockouts
description: PHILADELPHIA, Aug. 10 (AP) The secondranked middle weight contender, Bennie Bris coe, moved closer to a shot al the title tonight as he scored a secondround technical knock out over Juarez deLima of Brazil at The Spectrum. Eugene (Cyclone) Hart, another middle weight contender, knocked out Fate Davis in 52 seconds of the fifth round. Hart has won 21 straight fights, 20 by knockouts.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: 10 PLAYERS APPEAR AT JOHNSON HEARING
description: Ten members of the Cali fornia Angels appeared at a sort of pretrial hearing at the Base ball Commissioner's office yes terday in the suspension case involving Alex Johnson, last year's American League batting champion.

title: FRIODMAN DIFFERS WITH REES PANEL
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 (Reu ters)Milton Friedman, the economist, said in an interview today that a Congressional subcommittee's suggestion to devalue the dollar unilaterally would not work without the cooperation of other countries.

title: Scott Reaches Third Round In Tennis at Southampton
description: SOUTHAMPTON, L. I., Aug. 10Gene Scott of New York, seeded second, won a pair of matches to catch the field in the third round of the United States men's amateur grass court championships at the Meadow Club today.

title: White House Gym Held a Roman Romper Room
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 President Nixon's press secre tary and two aides to a Repub lican Representative engaged in a running dispute today over a new White House health fa cility in the Executive Office Building.

title: Executive Changes
description: The Dayco Corporation has elected Richard J. Jacob as its chairman and chief executive officer. Mr. Jacob assumes the duties in addition to those he presently holds as president. He succeeds his brother, Robert B. Jacob, who died suddenly last Friday.

title: Thieu Asks for Death For Narcotics Dealers
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 10 (AP)  President Nguyen Van Thieu proposed a bill today that would make dealing in narcotics a war time crime and would decree the death penalty for import ers and peddlers belonging to organized rings.

title: PENTAGON TO BUY 48 F14'S FOR NAVY
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 The Pentagon said today that, as previously indicated, it would buy 48 more F14 fight ers for the Navy.

title: F.A.A. Asks TV Outlets to Bar BombHoax Film
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 (UPI)The Federal Aviation Administration in a recent let ter asked 500 television sta tions in 150 cities to refrain from showing The Doomsday Flight, a film it believes has prompted a surge in telephoned bomb threats to airlines.

title: Indonesia Signs Oil Pact
description: Indonesia's stateowned oil company, Pertamina, said yes terday that it had signed a new productionsharing con tract with CalasiaticTopco, a subsidiary of the Caltex Petro leum Corporation and ex tended the contract to the year 2001.

title: Church Council Would Help
description: GENEVA, Aug. 10The World Council of Churches offered to day to attempt a reconciliation between the Roman Catholic and Potestant factions in Northern Ireland. The offer was sent to member churches, Anglican, Methodist and Pres byterian, in Northern Ireland by the Rev. Dr. Eugene Carson Blake, general secretary.

title: ECOLOGICAL SCIENCE IN CREDITOR TALKS
description: The Ecological Science Cor poration, which is short of cash, disclosed in Miami yes terday that it had met with its creditors on Monday and that the creditors would meet by themselves next Monday.

title: Nestern Electric Expands 6Month Sales and Profit
description: The Western Electric Com pany reported yesterday gains in firsthalf sales and net in come.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Giant fans should relax. There is no cause for alarm even if Fran Tarkenton, the indispensable quarterback, has exchanged his football Uniform: for civilian garb and re turned to his outside business interests in Georgia. With out even gulping hard or brushing away a tear from his innocent blue eyes, Coach Alex Webster said as much in a televised interview shortly after news of the Tarkenton defection had reached an unsuspecting public.

title: Notes on People
description: Senator Edward M. Ken nedy canceled plans yester day to visit Pakistan, not because he didn't want to go there, but because he's not wanted by the Pakistani Gov ernment.

title: Former Pentagon Aide Doubts Soviet Leads in Arms Research
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10A former Defense Department of ficial questioned today the sig nificance of recent Pentagon contentions that the Soviet Union was surpassing the United States in military re search and development.

title: ANGELS' 2 HOMERS IN IIIREERIIN 8TH IIEFEAI YANKS, 16
description: It probably won't make much difference in Lefty Phil lips's haunting memories of 1971, but his California Angels scored three runs in the eighth inning on a pair of home runs last night to defeat the other wise redhot New York Yan kees, 76.

title: Raymond Rubin, Lawyer, Dead; Fought for Widow in Powell Suit
description: Raymond Rubin, a lawyer who practiced independently at 291 Broadway, died of cancer Monday in the Hospital for Joint Diseases. He was 57 years old and lived at 70 East 10th Street.

title: THIEU FOES SEEK A ONEIAN RACE
description: SAIGON, South Vietnam, Aug. 10The political opposi tion in South Vietnam is trying hard while Ambassador Ells worth Bunker is in Washington to bring about a situation that the Americans regard as the worst possible: A oneman presidential campaign with only Nguyen Van Thieu on the ballot.

title: MOSCOW HOPEFUL NIXON WON'T DROP SOVIET PROBLEMS
description: Excerpts from Pravda article are printed on Page 2.

title: CONTRACT AWARDS
description: The Aerojet Ordnance and Manufacturing Company re ceived yesterday, a $14mil lion initial payment, under a $30million Air Force contract for production and loading of air munitions.

title: 3 Shifted in Indian Bureau; One a Critic of U.S. Policy
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10  Three employes of the Bureau of Indian Affairs, including an outspoken critic of the Gov ernment's treatment of Indians, have been relieved of their posts.

title: JULY STORE SALES OFF FROM RECORD
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 10 Retail sales declined somewhat in July from the record June level, according to highly pre liminary estimates of the Cen sus Bureau disclosed today.

title: PEKING
description: PEKING, Aug. 10China is now ob vibusly reappraising if not yet chang ing its foreign policy but its list of demands is longer and clearer than anything else on the coming agenda.

title: Dollar Recovers Slightly After Weak, Erratic Day
description: LONDON, Aug. 10 (Reuters) The run on the United States dollar continued in European markets throughout most of to day, although by tonight there were signs that the dollar was getting a little stronger in re lation to European currencies.

title: BIG BOARD LOWER IN LIGHT TRADING
