description: In recent books on the American Indian there has been a rediscovery of the movingly expressive language used by tribal spokesmen of the past. No thorough investigation of the au thenticity of many of the recorded words attributed to Indians appears ever to have been made, but cursory research indicates that a surprisingly large number of Indian speeches and poems are genuine translations that have not been tampered with by ro mantic nonIndians. One of the most eloquent of Indians was the Nez Perc's Heinmot Tooyalaket or Chief Joseph (c. 18401904); and although his speeches were recorded on at least three separate occasions by three different interpreters of vary ing abilities, the power of Joseph's thought and imagery somehow comes through brilliantly in all of them.

title: Tigers Win on 4 Walks in 7th
description: DETROIT, Aug. 28 (AP) Four walks and an error by Chicago's first baseman, Mike Andrews, produced two Detroit runs in the seventh inning and gave the Tigers a 54 victory over the White Sox today.

title: Jesse Lane Is Dead at 62; Labor Relations Consultant
description: Jesse Lane, a labor relations consultant for the New Holland division of the Sperry Rand Cor poration, died Friday of a heart ailment in Good Samaritan Hos pital, West Islip, L. I. He was 62 years old and lived at Sea view, Fire Island, and in Palm Beach, Fla.

title: The Nation
description: The history of the New York Police Department can be read as one long story of corruption. Every 20 years or so, there is a new scandal, followed by a brief flurry of reform, followed by the long gradual slide back into what seems to be the De partment's normal state of dis creet but allpervasive corrup tion.

title: Music
description: THE first problem is to find a problem. If the notorious suffering that results in good music were a suffering of the heart  of passionate compassion and of experiencethen mil lions would be great artists by 18. Music is plainer than that. It results from a formal suffering quite selfinvolved: thepressure of discovering the sole solution to a given prob lem. If the problem cannot be disentangled like a spider web and rewoven into the five straight lines of a staff, as by a Palestrina, then it must be shattered like a safe, as by an Ives, who scattered debris but froze the basic lightning in crystal.

title: COLOMBO REMOVED TO HOME OF A SON
description: Joseph A. Colombo Sr., the 48yearold reputed chief of a Mafia family in Brooklyn, was in the home of his son, Anthony, at 1259 84th Street in the Bay Ridge section yes terday after being suddenly re moved from Roosevelt Hospital in the early morning.

title: Gilbert S. Mclnerny, 55, Home Products Director
description: BARNARD, Vt., Aug. 28  Gilbert S. Mclnerny, former vice president, secretary of general counsel and director of the American Home Products Corporation, died of a heart attack on Thursday in Mary Hitchcock Memorial Hospital in Hanover, N. H. He was 55 years old.

title: Met Junior Girls Golf, Plagued By Rain, Reset for Thursday
description: Some golf tournaments seem destined not to be played. Such seems to be the case with the Metropolitan junior girls cham pionship. It was first scheduled to be played last month but a storm caused a postponement until last Friday. Then, rain necessitated another postpone ment.

title: One thing you can say about Greenberg, he doesn't play it safe
description: Any writer who will begin a novel of only 143 pages with a 400word sentence, which sentence itself be gins with Once upon a time, can't be all bad. For one thing, you know he's not playing it safe. He's a man you can count on to take a chance. Alvin Greenberg is such a man.

title: Venice Fete Cancels Public Showing of The Devils
description: VENICE, Aug. 28Ken Rus sell's The Devils arrived in Venice tonight and encountered semicensorship. It was shown for the press and for an invited audience at the Lido Cinema Palace, but its public showing (which would have followed the premiere) at the alfresco Arean Theater was canceled to avoid possible police interven tion.

title: City's Cutback Threatens Closing of Two Libraries
description: A citywide epidemic of cul tural cutbacks has reduced hours and projects at libraries and museums, theatens to close up two New York Public Li brary research collections en tirely and has led the Museum of Natural History to consider shutting off the entire top floor, including its dinosaur hall.

title: Miss Dewey Wed to David Stuart
description: MILLIS, Mass., Aug. 28 Miss Priscilla Badger Dewey, a descendant of Henry Dun ster, the first president of Harvard College, and David McNamee Stuart were mar ried here this afternoon at St. Paul's Episcopal Church. A reception was given at Fieldstone Farm, the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. Talbot Dewey.

title: Botanical Garden Plans Center For Forest and Garden Study
description: The nation's largest ?? research center, including the first arboretum to be developed by a professional botanical staff, will be set up by the New York Botanical Garden in Millbrook in Dutchess County.

title: Et A1.
description: Rambling, selfindulgent, slushy memoir of the author's friendship with fatherfigure Buber aged 7587. This is not even a chronological account of wonderful times, but a hodgepodge of noble moments, sadly compromised by the au thor's inability to quote Buber's conversation directly. All very pious I and Thouing, without a core of skeptical rationalism to hold together the author's adoration. Buber was a saint, but this book is only for rapt believers.

title: RECORD RAINFALL WATERLOGS CITY
description: Tropical storm Doria, losing power as it left the sea, blus tered over western Connecticut and Massachusetts yesterday, leaving behind broken power lines, flooded streets and base ments and a waterlogged met ropolitan area.

title: 241 Shot Comes In
description: CHICAGO, Aug. 28 (AP) Cassie Red, a 241 shot owned by Charles Windle of Chicago, closed strongly along the hedge to win the $29,800 Chicago Handicap today before 23,907 fans at Hawthorne.

title: Migration to Britain Drops
description: LONDON, Aug. 28 (Reuters) The number of Common wealth immigrants allowed in to Britain in the first six months of this year was 10.8 per cent below the same period last year, the Home Office said this week. The figures were 12, 845, compared with 14,426 in the first half of 1970.

title: Anne Hildt Wed To R. A. Geddes, Banker, in Ohio
description: GATES MILLS, Ohio, Aug. 28  In St. Francis of Assisi Roman Catholic Church here this afternoon, Miss Anne Rowland Hildt, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. John Hildt of Gates Mills and Harbour Is land, the Bahamas, was mar ried to Robert Ahles Geddes.

title: Coast Auto Track Is Regeared For Its Second 500Mile Race
description: ONTARIO, Calif., Aug. 28 A firmer place in the big time auto racing world may come to the Ontario Motor Speedway the second time around.

title: Photography
description: IN addition to a selection from its exhibits of the past season, the Neikrug Galleries is currently feat uring a 10print sequence by a Portuguese photographer, Jorge Guerra, who is now liv ing and working in Montreal.

title: The Nation
description: Mayor Lindsay could have handled it differently. He might have said that he had more im portant things on his mind than the decision of a corporation with 40 seasonal employes to move from the Bronx to East Rutherford, N.J.

title: Colgate Lists Scrimmage
description: The Colgate University foot ball team, which begins regular season play on Sept. 18 at home against Boston University, will tune up with a full scale scrim mage Sept. 11 against the Uni versity of Pennsylvania.

title: Doctor Foresees an I.Q. Caste System
description: CAMBRIDGE, Mass.  A Harvard University psychol ogist has concluded that the America of the nottoodistant future is likely to be one in which people are locked at birth into a rigid caste system based on inherited intelligence.

title: Wood, Field and Stream; When Is a Littleneck Not a Littleneck? When It Grows Up to Be a Quahog
description: Nearly four years ago, wrote in this column that lit tleneck clams were nothing more than young quahogs, a belief to which, by the way, I still cling.

title: Oyster Bay to Hire TeenAgers To Step Up Fight Against Drugs
description: OYSTER BAY, Aug. 28 Eleven teenagers will be hired here next month in an effort by the town to step up its fight against drug abuse.

title: 3 KILLED AND 2 HURT BY GUNMAN IN IDAHO
description: DRIGGS, Idaho, Aug. 28 (AP) Three teenaged brothers were shot to death and a rela tive and a city marshal serious ly wounded early Saturday on a county road in an isolated section of eastern Idaho.

title: Sports of The Times
description: Willie Mays hit a home run off the first ball pitched to him this season and then proceeded to hit one in each of the first four games. So cyclonic was the start that all of Willie's wellwishersand who isn't? began dreaming the impossible dream that the amazing Mays would zing right through to Babe Ruth's career record of 714 homers without even waiting for the pause that refreshes.

title: Recordings
description: AMONG the many things we owe to Mozart is his discovery of the artistic and expressive potential of the solo con certo. When, at the ripe old age of 11, ho adopted the form, it was in a rather ele mentary state  a fastslow fast set of three movements intended for entertainment that would not make many demands on the part of the listener. Fluent tunes and a reasonable amount of virtu osity from the soloist put to gether in tidy packages just about filled the bill.

title: Lawyers Draw Attention To California's Prisons
description: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug. 26 Fay Stender held up a thick sheaf of letters, many of them painfully printed on lined paper.

title: Stamps
description: APHILATELIC souvenir card for the 85th annual convention of the American Philatelic Society was issued by the Bureau of Engraving and Printing. The convention, which ends today in San Antonio, Tex., was staged in connection of TEXANEX 71, the show of the Texas Philatelic Association.

title: Pamela Kraemer is Wed in Jersey
description: ENGLEWOOD, N. J., Aug. 28The First Presbyterian Church was the setting here this afternoon for the mar riage of Miss Pamela Tracy Kraemer, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. W. Frank Kraemer, to James Cameron Colthup, son of Mrs. James F. Col thup of Englewood and Point O' Woods, Fire Island, N. Y., and the late Mr. Colthup.

title: Mrs. Onassis, in Poland, Escapes Pursuing Crowd
description: WARSAW, Aug. 28  Mrs. Jacqueline Onassis, attending a Radziwill family funeral in Warsaw, escaped a pursuing crowd today by leaping aboard a streetcar passing the suburban cemetery.

title: U.S. Skippers Win 3 Races In PreOlympic Regatta
description: KIEL, West Germany, Aug. 28 (UPI)  American yachting men gained three victories to day in the opening event of a preOlympic sailing regatta in Kiel Bay.

title: Some Domestic Air Fares Are Cut to Lure Travelers
description: After climbing for two years, domestic air fares have begun to fall in a limited way as the nation's airlines grope for ways to entice more vacation travel ers to their jets.

title: John Collin Weds Patricia Herrick
description: CEDARHURST, L.I., Aug. 28Miss Patricia Alexandre Herrick, daughter of Mrs. J. Alexandre Tompkins of Ce darhurst and of Walter Rus sell Herrick of West Hartford, Conn., and Fisher's Island, N.Y., was married here this afternoon to John Nicholas Collin, son of Mrs. Michael MilesSharp of Woodbridge, Suffolk, England, and Hugh G. Collin of Dorset, England.

title: Yacht Parthenia Afloat Again Off L.I., Owner Hopes to Restore Old Glory
description: SAG HARBOR, L. I., Aug. 28The Parthenia, a relic of the age of steam yachting that had lain rotting end ap parently abandoned here for 10 months, is once again afloat. But she has been stripped of almost everything of value in the time that she lay on her side in seven feet of water.

title: Gibson Fans 13 in Victory
description: ST. LOUIS, Aug. 28 (UPI) Bob Gibson pitched a three hitter and struck out 13 men tonight, leading the St. Louis Cardinals to a 40 victory over the Cincinnati Reds. Lou Brock stole three bases to raise his total to 49 and scored two runs.

title: LETTERS
description: To the Financial Editor:

title: JUNIOR TEAMS PLAY GOLF MATCH, SEPT. 8
description: Seven Metropolitan Golf As sociation district junior golfers are scheduled to meet a team of British juniors Sept. 8 in an 18hole team match. The Stanwich Club of Greenwich, Conn., will be host for this in formal international competi tion.

title: Army Softens Rigors Of Recruits' Training
description: FORT ORD, Calif., Aug. 28The United States Army's cam paign to make military life a more appealing and satisfying experience has had a revolu tionary impact on, one of its most traditional and hidebound devicesthe eightweek basic training course.

title: Crowds, Revenues and Pay Lend N.F.L. Rosy Glow
description: Pro football will have a year of success beyond its prior dimensions. Its moodsangry and hurting while heroic and rewardingwill again suit a society hungry for value judgments and identification.

title: Queens Chamber Appoints
description: C. Albert Parente of Jackson Heights has been appointed chairman of the speakers' bur eau of the Queens Chamber of Commerce. A prominent Queens lawyer, Mr. Parente is a former Queens assistant district attor ney.

title: Hambletonian Victor to Get Historic Swedish Trophy
description: Sweden's leading harness race track, Solvalla in Stock holm, will present a rune stone trophy to the winner of the 1971 Hambletonian Stake, the prized contest for 3year old trotters that will be raced Wednesday at DuQuoin, Ill.

title: 4 Policeman Hurt as Cars Rush to Scene of Mugging
description: Two patrol cars collided, in juring four policemen, as they were responding last night to an assault and robbery of a 60yearold man at the Grand Concourse and Mount Hope Place in the Bronx.

title: Purported Text of Accord Is Published in West Berlin
description: BERLIN, Aug. 26A text purported to be that of the Ber lin draft agreement reached last week by the United States, the Soviet Union, France and Brit ain was published here today. It provided what was called the simplest, quickest and most privileged treatment known in international practice to traf fic to and from West Berlin.

title: Cymbeline: Most Often the Gags Don't Pay Off
description: A. J. ANTOON, who has just staged Shakespeare's Cymbeline under the August moon in Central Park, needs either more boldness or less. He isn't afraid to make mock of the play from time to time, he isn't afraid to alter its lines from time to time, he isn't afraid to treat it as though it were Charley's Aunt or Tarzan of the Apes or even a Beatrix Potter drawing from time to time. But everything he does is done from time to time. He hasn't the stout heart to see any one attack through, with the result that Shakes peare's charmingly grotesque fairytale seems badgered by pinpricks instead of being carved to a new shape.

title: Nader's Charges on Land Use Denied by California Officials
description: SACRAMENTO, Calif., Aug. 28  Past and present state officials have rejected as un founded charges by Ralph Nader's study group that pow erful special interest groups dominate and corrupt the reg ulation of California land use and practices.

title: 6,250,000 Shots Later, It Could Be News Again
description: SALISBURY, England, Aug. 28 (AP)Golfers at South Wiltshire Club near here wondered what the holdup was at the 165yard 18th hole.

title: Mother of 3 to Fight Sterilization Ban
description: PEEKSKILL, N. Y., Aug. 28 With her long blond hair and striped blue jeans, Florence Cafarelli could easily be taken for a college student. But at the age of 26 she has been married and out of school for 10 years, the mother of three children ages 8, 7, and 3.

title: Gardens
description: THE sight is unbelievable, improb able, even a bit ludicrous. Imagine, if you will a West Side Manhattan penthouse terrace, approximately 100 feet long and 12 feet wide, looking over miles and miles of New York haze and concrete, and find ing there the lushest, ripest, healthiest crop of sixfootandover stalks of corn, growing with an ease and abandon that is positively unnerving. Yes, clumps and clumps of gorgeous, tall Seneca Chief corn all over that terrace, with ears ready for the picking, their tassels afly ing and those long, green and gold leaves gently rustling in imperturbable elegance in a climate and environment as contradictory and paradoxical as any.

title: Bolt to Defend His Title In Senior Golf Sept. 2026
description: Tommy Bolt, a threetime winner and defending cham pion, will compete again in the 15th annual United States na tional senior open golf tourna ment to be held at three Las Vegas course Sept. 20 through 26.

title: Heisman Trophy Could Be IvyCovered for First Time Since 1951
description: Ed Marlnaros's name does not rhyme with Heisman even when the pronunciation is adjusted slightly. The Cornell tailback will not even receive the backing of an expensive publicity campaign from his university, a common prac tice found successful in nail ing down the Heisman Tro phy as the outstanding col lege football player in a given season.

title: Black Panther Leader Eulogizes Jackson as Hero
description: OAKLAND, Calif., Aug. 28 In a revolutionary memorial service conducted by the Black Panther party, George Jackson was eulogized today as a hero who died in a significant way.

title: Lou McGarity, 54, a Trombonist With Major Jazz Bands, Dead
description: ALEXANDRIA, Va., Aug. 28 Lou McGarity, jazz trom bonist, who was a featured art ist with leading bands, died to day of a heart ailment in Alex andria Hospital. He was 54 years old and had lived in New York.

title: Apparel Industry Discounts Surtax
description: After two weeks of Presi dent Nixon's new economic program, a crosssection of Seventh Avenue is convinced that the pricefreeze came too late and that the sur charge on imports is too small.

title: Preseason Ticket Rates Rolled Back by Brains
description: BOSTON, Aug. 28 (AP) The Boston Bruins of the National Hockey League have rolled back ticket prices to 1970 rates for three pre season games.

title: Police Seek Clue to Stamford Murders
description: STAMFORD, Conn., Aug. 28  The state and local police, already baffled by the murders of four young black women here, are puzzling now over the murder of a fifth last week end.

title: Monserrat's SchoolBoard Aide Is Also His Business Associate
description: A business associate of Joseph Monserrat, who is a member and former president of the Board of Education, has been serving as a consultant to Mr. Monserrat at the board at a salary of $100 a day.

title: A Scholar's Tour of ParisFor 90c
description: A COUPLE of years ago, when Dan ica Zujovic was still in college, she answered an ad for a sum mer job as a guide on a Paris tour bus. Her task, she was told, would be twofold: Make the tour interesting; answer every question. But what should she do, Danica asked, if her party in quired about, say, an old abbey, and she knew nothing about it? Make it interesting, was the response. Tell them it was burned in the Revolution and all the monks were beheaded.

title: YANKEES BOW;
description: KANSAS CITY, Aug. 28 Despite two home runs by Ron Blomberg, the New York Yankees lost to the Kansas City Royals tonight, 43, on an un earned run in the eighth inning that developed from Jerry Kenney's twobase throwing error.

title: WHITE ACADEMIES THRIVE IN SOUTH
description: NEW ORLEANS, Aug. 28 Private, allwhite academies continue to prosper in the South this year, especially in the cities, because of re newed unrest aroused by the busing issue.

title: The World
description: DUBLINIn a pub off St. Stephen's Green last Monday night, an associate of John Lynch, the Dublin Prime Min ister, sipped a pint of ale and said with a faint smile, Don't bother your head with what they talked about tonight. That's not important for the moment. What's important is that they talked, period.

title: 33 Years in Baseball
description: Joe Schultz, a coach for the Detroit Tigers, has been in base ball 33 years.

title: Edward Mangan Marries Diane Duane
description: BRONXVILLE, N.Y., Aug. 28  Miss Diane Judith Duane, daughter of James Duane of Bronxville and Plymouth, Mass., and the late Mrs. Doris Dowd Duane, and Edward Joseph Mangan, son of Mr. and Mrs. William Ed ward Mangan of Bronxville and Candlewciod Lake, Conn., were married here this after noon by the. Rev. John Krol jac in St. Joseph's Roman Catholic Church.

title: Indonesia Will Free Reds
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Aug. 28 (Reuters)Foreign Minister Adam Malik said today that by the end of the year, Indonesia would release 22,000 Commu nists arrested after a coup at tempt in 1965. Mr. Malik, who put the total number of Com munist prisoners at 45,000, said that the Government would re lease all those who were not criminaly involved in the coup attempt.

title: Religion
description: The Catholic antiwar move client has known it was in filtrated since more than a year ago, when Father Daniel Berrigan was a fugitive from Prison and a decoy Berrigan trip drew Federal Bureau of Investigation agents to a dead end in the Middle West. Thereafter, movement people ere extra cautious about Whom they took into their councils.

title: VIKINGS DEFEAT STEERS, 26 TO 21
description: PITTSBURGH, Aug. 28 (AP) Fred Cox kicked four field goals as the Minnesota Vikings de feated the Pittsburgh Steelers, 12621, tonight.

title: The Company at Checkerboard Square
description: ST. LOUISNo visitor to the Ralston Purina Company's new headquarters building here could doubt that Check erboard Square is keeping abreast of the times.

title: Contemplations Upon Fallen Marble, Or, My Two Weeks in Greece
description: ONE of the best travel books I have read in a long while Henry Miller's The Colossus of Ma roussi  prompted me to visit Greece this summer. Miller's book is an unabashed love letter to Greece and to the Greek people, and it proved an invaluable companion, although, of course, having been written in 1941 it might seem hopelessly out of date and is mute about where to find the fashion able beaches, shops, restaurants and hotels. Miller was concerned with what most travel writers dare not treat national character. I really think travel books should concentrate on little else. After all, what traveler today cannot find the necessities by himself, or with the help of an agent? What I require from a book, and feast upon when I find it, are imaginative insights into people.

title: HARVEY FERGUSSON, WESTERN NOVELIST
description: Harvey Fergusson, a novelist, who wrote of the historic and contemporary American South west, died Friday of a heart ailment in Berkeley, Calif. His age was 81.

title: MAN IN BUSINESS
description: Akzona, Inc., is a new in ternational company whose sales of fibers, salt, chemi cals, pharmaceuticals, leath er and wire and cable prod ucts should reach $500mil lion this year.

title: CLERK UNDER FIRE IN SIRHAN INQUIRY
description: LOS ANGELES, Aug. 28 Investigation continues here into the handling of evidence in the assassination of Senator Robert F. Kennedy after grand jury criticism of County Clerk William G. Sharp for misfea sance in management of trial exhibits.

title: Bears Defeat Browns, 2019, Before 43,568 Fans at Notre Dame Stadium
description: SOUTH BEND, Ind., Aug. 28 The Chicago Bears beat the Cleveland Browns, 2019, to day in a preseason game that marked the first appearance of professional teams in the Notre Dame Stadium. A crowd of 43, 568 filled twothirds of the seats and the university expect ed to net from the event $100, 000, which will be used to re furbish the 41yearold stadium.

title: Sweeney Gets Vermont Post
description: Edward Sweeney, last year's football captain at C. W. Post, has been appointed an assistant football coach at the University of Vermont. The former defen sive back and kick return spe cialist will handle the defensive secondary for the Catamounts.

title: Economy
description: Except for a few, gobs of oil on the beach at San Clemente, everything seemed to be coming up roses for President Nixon at the end of the second week of his bold new economic policy.

title: DOCTORS AT N.Y.U. TO HELP ETHIOPIA
description: A group of New York Uni versity medical professors has organized a program to enable American doctors to help train young doctors and initiate medical research in Ethiopia.

title: ROBINSON, SEARS WIN IN TRAPSHOOT
description: VANDALIA, Ohio, Aug. 28 (AP)Two shooters who didn't win a major title during the 76th annual Grand Ameri can Trapshooting tournament, emerged as the best overall marksmen of the event.

title: Et A1.
description: An earnest, academic expli cation of some of Nabokov's tricks: assonance, alliteration, foreshadowing, ironic hints to be picked up only on the sixth reading, rhetorical devices adapted from the Russian. Not so much criticism as lexico graphy, which has its uses but makes for catalogue entries, not books.

title: Letters to the Editor
description: To the Editor:

title: MRS. VIRGINIA C. THORP
description: Mrs. Virginia Connolly Thorp, president and owner of the Medical Careers Agency, 342 Madison Avenue, an employ ment agency, died Thursday of a heart attack at her home. She was 63 years old and lived at 34.41 85th Street, Jackson Heights, Queens. Mrs. Thorp was the widow of Stuart Kirby Thorp.

title: Why Be Good?
description: OTTAWA  The Trudeau Government, facing a threat to its very existence, is mak in an urgent search for means to relieve what the Prime Minister termed the, rough blow dealt by President Nixon's new economic poli cies.

title: Three Military Academies On Army Soccer Schedule
description: Army's soccer team plays a 12game schedule this fall that includes three other military academies and several of the other top Eastern teams.

title: WESTPORT TITLE TO POLK COUNTY
description: WESTPORT, Conn., Aug. 28 Polk County, who has com pletely dominated the amateur owner hunter division in the East this year, won another championship today at the Fair field County Hunt Club's junior horse show.

title: Economy
description: TOKYOI knew the yen was undervalued two years ago, when I went to New York, a local bookseller said. My dollars didn't go anywhere near as far as did my yen in Japan. So I went to a classmate of mine who is now branch manager of a Japanese bank in New York and said to him, You should give me more dollars for my yen.

title: METS DEFEAT DODGERS HERE, 92, 21;
description: The New York Mets scored one early knockout and one late knockout yesterday to sweep doubleheader from the Los An geles Dodgers before 43,492 persons in Shea Stadium.

title: Donohue Wins Pole Spot For California 500 Race
description: ONTARIO, Calif., Aug. 28 (UPI)Mark Donohue of Media, Pa., drove his rebuilt McLaren Offenhauser 185.004 miles per hour today to earn the pole po sition for the second California 500 at the Ontario Motor Speed way.

title: Dancer, in Substitute Role, Drives 2 Freehold Winners
description: FREEHOLD, N. J., Aug. 28 Stanley Dancer substituted for his son Ronald today at Free hold Raceway and proceeded to drive two winners, including Wilrose Farms' Leroy N in the featured $10,000 Sea Girt pace. Dancer became a grandfather for the first time when his son took off for the afternoon to welcome his first born, Ronald Stanley Dancer.

title: Back in 1958 a certain group of writers
description: The title of this book is not espe cially wellchosen, as the author him self, would probably agree. The al ternatives are awkwardA New Consciousness, The Extension of Contentand The Beat Genera tion has the advantage of recogniz ability. Bruce Cook, who is book re view editor of the National Observer, takes the term to be more inclusive than its limits allow, and that is one of the several virtues of his book. He manages to see Jack Kerouac, Allen Ginsberg and Gregory Corso in a wider set of relations that include Robert Creeley, Robert Duncan and Charles Olson, thus allowing himself to estimate fully the change of con. sciousnessnot only literary con sciousnessthat the Beats embody and in part instigated.

title: 17th Century Coins Found
description: MOSCOW, Aug. 28 (UPI) Boys digging in a field in Solo nitsko, near Novgorod, found 132 pounds of coins dating from the 17th century reign of Peter the Great, the newspaper Trud reports. Trud said the boys unearthed a big jar of coins that filled four buckets. The Novgorod Historical and Architectural Museum said the coins dated to the Czar who ruled from 1682 to 1725.

title: SHEIKH MUJIB
description: Secrecy was the keynote last week of the trial of Sheikh Mu jib, the Bengali leader, on charges of waging war against Pakistan. No word of what transpired at the trial reportedly taking place in a fail in a small West Pakistan city south of Rawal pindi  has emerged since an announce ment that a leading constitutional lawyer had been named de fense counsel and that the trial by a military tribunal had indeed opened. There was even some uncertainty that the East Pakistan leader was still alive, although the presump tion last week was that he was. Most ob servers felt that even tually he would be con victed and sentenced to death but that the sentence would be commuted to long im prisonment.

title: Nevins Papers to Be Opened To Scholars at Columbia
description: The personal papers of the late historian Allan Nevins have been opened to scholars at the Columbia University Libraries.

title: WALLACE, IN FLORIDA, EVASIVE ON '72 PLANS
description: JACKSONVILLE, Fla., Aug. 28 (AP)Gov. George C. Wal lace of Alabama sounded like a Democrat some of the time and like an independent at others as he brought his pos sible 1972 Presidential cam paign to Florida today.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: The World
description: BERLINAt the same time last Monday that the Big Four ambassadors were toasting each other with champagne on com pletion of their draft agreement to improve the Berlin situation, the rain clouds parted and the great city was suddenly bathed in brilliant sunshine.

title: L.I. WOMAN MAYOR DIGGING INTO TASK
description: RIVERHEAD, L. I., Aug. 28 Mrs. Sandra Swenk of Port Jefferson, believed to be Long Island's first woman mayor, made her first official state ment to the Suffolk County Legislature at a meeting here this week.

title: New School Zoning For Forest Hills Affirmed by Court
description: A State Supreme Court jus tice has ruled that the Board of Education was within its rights when it rezoned Forest Hills, Queens, and sent some high school students from there to Jamaica.

title: Morales Will Defend Title On Garden Mat Tomorrow
description: Pedro Morales, WorldWide Wrestling Federation champion, will defend his title against Stan Stasiak in the feature ex hibition at Madison Square Garden tomorrow night. Sta siak, a 290pounder from Buz zard Crook, Ore., will wrestle Morales to the finish.

title: For France, a New Price Index
description: PARISAs they were until recently at least in the United States, prices are spurting all over Europe. But how does one measure the magnitude of the increases and the effects on the aver age family?

title: Benedictine Unit in Minnesota, World's Largest, Elects Abbot
description: COLLEGEVILLE, Minn., Aug. 28The giant bells of St. John's Abbey and University Church rang out this week to signify the election of a new abbot for the world's largest Benedictine community.

title: Lisa G. Eyer Is Betrothed
description: Mrs. Richard M. Furlaud and George A. Eyer Jr., both of New York, have announced the engagement of their daughter, Miss Lisa Gordon Eyer, to Dr. Gaylord James Avery 2d, an interne in sur gery at the Roosevelt Hospi tal. He is the son of Mrs. Laura York Avery of Ridge field, Conn., and Gaylord Avery of New York.

title: SWEDES PROPOSE NEW CONSTITUTION
description: STOCKHOLM, Aug. 28 (AP) Eighteenyearolds would be able to vote and to be elected to Parliament in Sweden under a revised constitution just pro posed, and the monarchy would probably be stripped of its few remaining powers when the present King dies.

title: Florida Governor Backs Busing to Gain Integration
description: GAINESVILLE, Fla., Aug. 28 (UPI)Gov. Reubin Askew said today that massive busing of students to achieve integration was an artificial and inade quate instrument of change but must be used until integra tion can be broadened com munitywide.

title: Colts Down Redskins
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28 (AP) Earl Morrall threw a 36yard touchdown pass to Tom Mitch ell and Tom Matte ran for a touchdown from 5 yards out tonight as the Baltimore Colts stopped a late Washington surge and defeated the Red skins, 2014.

title: Despoiling the West
description: If plans for the New West now being nurtured by the coalmining industry should succeed, they may well re verse the population trend of a century and send Ameri cans scurrying back to the Old East. A Times survey indicates unmistakably that, unless a dangerous course is arrested, the shabby desolation of stripmined regions in Appalachia will be reproduced on a monumentally larger scale from New Mexico to the State of Washington.

title: REST YOUR CASE FIRST IN HOPEFUL
description: SARATOGA SPRINGS, N. Y., Aug. 28Rest Your Case of the Cragwood Stable capped the final day of the most successful meeting in the history of Sara toga by taking the $128,925 Hopeful today. With a crowd of 19,189 on hand, Rest Your Case captured the 6furlong sprint for 2yearolds by a length over the favored Gover nor Max, with Loquacious Don next in the field of seven.

title: Letter
description: To the Editor:

title: Joseph Valencic Weds Robin Newbold
description: RIDGEWOOD, N. J., Aug. 28Miss Robin Watson Newbold was married here this afternoon to Joseph Joel Valencic both of Corona del Mar, Calif., in the chapel of the United Methodist Church.

title: Ky Attends the Public Funeral of an Immolated ExSoldier, Then Has a Private Talk With an Army Chief
description: DANANG, South Vietnam, Aug. 28Vice President Nguy Cao Ky, clearly trying to build up his political following despite his refusal to run in the presidential elections, appeared before a crowd of thousands to day at the funeral of a disabled veteran who had burned him self to death for freedom and democracy.

title: About Motor Sports
description: ELKHART LAKE, Wis., Aug. 28A bigmoney show like the CanAm needs stars like Jackie Stewart, Denis Hulme and Peter Revson, but it could not thrive without a supporting cast. The lesser drivers play supporting roles because, primarily, they don't have the heavy financing that the leaders have. But they are all individuals, val ued for their personal quali ties. Three of them, taken at random from the field, give the CanAm some of its international flavor: a German, a Japan ese and an American of Polish descent.

title: Connally Feels Controls Will Remain
Red Wings Clinch I.L. Crown
description: RICHMOND, Aug. 28 (Ap) Bobby Grich hit three home runs as the Rochester Red clinched the International League regularseason pennant tonight by winning two games from the Richmond Braves, 54 and 62. Grich, hit two homers in the opener.

title: Forest Hills Club Is Preparing for U.S. Tennis Open
description: The West Side Tennis Club, in Forest Hills, Queens, is being spruced up for the big gest event of the season, the $160,000 United States Open championships starting next Wednesday.

title: New Jakarta Envoy for U.S.
description: JAKARTA, Indonesia, Aug. 28 (Reuters)The United States has approved the ap pointment of Lieut. Gen. Sjarif Thajeb as Indonesia's new Am bassador to Washington, the Foreign Ministry has an nounced. General Thajeb, 51 years old, is deputy speaker of the House of Representa tives.

title: Hulme Wins Pole for CanAm Today
description: ELKHART LAKE, Wis., Aug. 28The sidebyside combina tion with which Team McLaren customarily starts CanAm races will be missing tomorrow.

title: A.A.A. Ends Cooperation With Nader's Investigation
description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28 The American Automobile As sociation has moved to block what its leaders regard as a drive by Ralph Nader, the con sumer advocate, to blacken its reputation and steer it into the activist consumer movement.

title: LEADING JUNIORS AWAIT TITLE GOLF
description: Some of the nation's best young golfers will begin medal play competition tomorrow over Colgate University's Seven Oaks championship course in the first annual National junior Golfers Association tourna ment.

title: Black War Veterans Planning a Coalition To Press Demands
description: The United Black Veterans of America, a New Yorkbased organization formed in April, announced plans yesterday to develop a national coalition of black and other minoritygroup veterans to seek more educa tional, employment and medi cal facilities for discharged servicemen.

description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Business Index Falls
description: The New York Times Weekly Index of Busi ness Activity fell to 365.8 from 369.9 a week ear lier. A year ago it was 369.8.*

title: Mrs. Mason Has Child
description: BETHESDA, Md., Aug. 28 A daughter was born on Aug. 13 to Mr. and Mrs. Ar thur D. Mason at the Wash ington Hospital Center in Washington. The child has been named Laura Gail.

title: Soviet Arms to Lebanon
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, Aug. 28 (Reuters)Lebanon will buy arms from the Soviet Union for the first time under a $52.7 million, fiveyear defense plan approved by Parliament on Thursday, the Communist news paper, AlNidaa, reported here today, quoting Dr. Elias Saba, Lebanon's Acting Defense Min ister.

title: A girl for Miss Devlin
Law
description: WASHINGTON In politi cal circles, the classic defi nition of the word awkward might well be: Accusations that the chief criminal law enforcement officer in a law andorder administration has been involved in a swindle.

title: Mobile Sickle Cell Lab Makes Brooklyn Tests
description: The Brooklyn  Cumberland Medical Center has been sending a mobile laboratory into the black and Puerto Rican communities of the Fort Greene and Bedford Stuyvesant sections of Brook lyn this summer on weekly visits in search of sickle cell anemia.

title: U.S. BUSINESS ROUNDUP
description: Local, state and regional economic indicators at mid year showed some headway, but by and large reflected the same problemsinflation and persistent joblessness that led to the Adminis tration's new economic program.

title: Market Research
description: Market research, the hybrid craft that put academic credentials to the commercial uses of advertising and prod uct development, is moving into higher corporate eche lons. Like many other small industries, it has been bat tered by recession and socio business fads.

title: Editorial Cartoon 2  No Title
Une de Mai Defeats Fresh Yankee Again in Taking Roquepine Trot by a Neck
description: WESTBURY, L. I., Aug. 28 Compared with last week, when Une de Mai of France out trotted Fresh Yankee of Can ada by a nose in the $125,000 International, the French mare had an easier time in captur ing tonight's $30,000 Roquepine Trot from the same rival at Roosevelt Raceway.

title: HONG KONG
description: HONG KONG, Aug. 28Coming out of China into the recklessly beautiful city of Hong Kong is almost more of a shock than going the other way. Suddenly everything is different, every thing is speeded up, as if somebody had flicked a switch on a gigantic movie camera and all the sights and sounds of life began to race and scream.

title: Books: Business Security
description: SECURITY FOR BUSINESS AND INDUSTRY. By Charles F. Hemphill Jr. Dow Jones Irwin, Inc., Homewood, Ill. 297 pages. $9.95.

title: GREECE'S PREMIER BARS EASED RULE
description: ATHENS, Aug. 28Premier George Papadopoulos squelched hopes tonight that his drastic Government reorganization this week would quickly lead to a political liberalization of his armybacked regime.

title: Wingate Declares Decontrol of Rent Is Hurting the Poor
description: A leader of the black com munity yesterday sharply criti cized the recent state law de controlling apartments in New York City as they are volun tarily vacated.

title: Bennett Cerf Dies; Publisher, Writer
description: Bennett Cerf, one of the coun try's foremost book publishers, died late Friday night at his estate in Mount Kisco, N. Y. He was 73 years old.

title: Education
description: The immediate effect of the wage freeze on the na on's schools is likely to be the smoothest, leaststrike bound opening in recent years. In contrast to hun dreds of strikes in the initial school weeks during the mil itant nineteen  sixties, the outlook for the 197172 aca demic year is for on  time openings, with only a hand ful of walkouts.

title: Spahn Forced to Resign
description: TULSA, Okla., Aug. 28 (AP) Warren Spahn, one of the top pitchers in National League his tory, announced his forced res ignation yesterday as manager of the Tulsa Oilers of the American Association. Spahn was manager of the Oilers for five seasons in the Pacific Coast League and American Association.

description: WASHINGTON, Aug. 28Following is the ninth set of official questions and answers issued by the Presidents Cost of Living Council on specific issues in the 90day freeze on prices and wages:

title: Pamela Morse, a '68 Debutante, Bride of David Winchell Tellier
description: ORLEANS, Mass., Aug. 28 In the Episcopal Church of the Holy Spirit here this afternoon Miss Pamela Dean Morse was married to David Winchell Tellier by the Rev. G. David White.

description: To THE EDITOR:

title: Heat of Battle First in N. H.
description: SALEM, N. H., Aug. 28 (AP) Heat of Battle led all the way today in winning the $10,000 White Mountain Handicap be fore a crowd of 13,266 at Rock ingham Park. Ridden by Mike Carrozzella, Heat of Battle beat Kiss and Run by 1 lengths in the 11/16mile event. He paid $7.40 for $2.

title: Giant Move Keeps City Aides Up Late Planning Next Step
description: Plans for future action by the city as a result of the deci sion of the New York Giants to move to New Jersey in 1975 are expected to be announced by Mayor Lindsay later this week.

description: To the Financial Editor:

title: Turbotrain Fails Test By Running Out of Fuel
description: EUGENE, Ore., Aug. 28 (UPI)A highspeed Amtrak turbotrain undergoing a series of endurance tests was late for a public appearance yes terday. It ran out of fuel.

description: By Nolan Porterfield. 312 pp. New York: Harper's Magazine Press. $7.50.
